(4th interaction) - I asked if we could either pay for the additional 5 cents or purchase a plastic bag (for .10). She said no and walked away again. I think that purchasing anything is reasonable of an ask to hit the target. I really do.

(5th interaction) - By this time, I was fuming. I asked the older gentleman who I've seen worked there the last 6 times Ive been there if it's okay if we did that. He walked away and came back the RUDE girl again. She said no again.

(6th interaction) - I asked for her name so I could talk to her manager about her. As I do at all restaurants when service is superior or totally unacceptable, I try to be as honest as possible to management so they know they're either doing a good job or they know that there's room for improvement. She grilled me and walked away and just gave me the nastiest face saying "NO"

Wow. As if that wasn't it... I walked to the front to talk to the manager and as we were walking, the man asked her what was wrong and she said in EXACT words in Chinese - "I dont know, she's f*cking crazy" WOW. She thought I didn't speak chinese because I was talking to her in English and even then, I didn't lose it. I told her politely that I spoke English in Chinese and her response was "SO?!" (exact words and tone).... I try to explain to the manager that she was being rude and unnecessary and all they could say was that they'll bring it back up to the owners. I said that we'd not be able to frequent this restaurant anymore if their attitude doesn't change. And you know what, it wasn't about the dessert, or the 30 dollars or the 5 cents but about the principle. I could NOT believe that this girl worked in the restaurant business. Seriously.

Overall, I know that was supposed to be a short review but it didn't happen. Sorry! But the food here is average. It's cheap and a place that you'd want to go to if you wanted a quick bite. The imitation shark fin soup is terrible. The sesame balls are good. The chicken wings are decent. The desserts aren't over the top but it'll do if you have a late night craving. They're also usually super packed. If the service wasn't that terrible, I'd probably at least visit once or twice a year. But now, it's on top of my NO NO list. I hope you guys get treated better than we did.

Watch out for the young asian girl in ponytails and a pink hoodie...
author: Vanessa K.

description: I have been coming here fooooorever for their chinese desserts. yum! I love their Sago, waffle sandwich, and eggettes. THE BEST! if your looking for something savory i usually get the soy sauce chicken wings made to order. Customer service is ok. place is old with interesting decor but food always hits the spot.
author: Melissa K.

description: This place was great for a quick late night meal. We came in after work and had the perfect combination of a meal and dessert. The sesame paste that we ordered was one of the best tasting one I've had so far and we ordered extra sesame glutinous balls on the side. The only down side was that the salt and pepper chicken wings didn't taste like salt and pepper, more like garlic wings but it wasn't bad.
author: Monica H.

description:
Service was nice. Food was okay. Price is okay. 
One thing, we were yelled at and lowkey chased outside the door by the Asian man that served us saying "you forgot to tip!? Next time do not eat in if you're not going to tip!" First time I've ever felt humiliated although, most of the asians around didn't understand what just happened. Reason why we didn't tip was because it took them 30 mins to serve an ice cream. And we were going to ask for more water but no one was around serving us.
author: Jimbo R.

description:
Review is for savory food, not dessert/sweet food!

Chicken steak with udon: Surprisingly the chicken pieces were good! They only gave 5 pieces though and the portion is small, so not worth the price. 
Salt and pepper fried chicken wings: Skin was burnt! Not a good sign. I couldn't really taste the meat inside the chicken either. There were also 5 pieces of chicken wings.

Service: They're eating dinner when my friend and I came around 7:30PM so it's kind of hard to get their attention. The waitress who helped us though was smiling and quick, so plus points!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
When both parties don't drink, dessert never fails.

Came here on a Sunday around 9pm and this place was packed.  Don't be overwhelmed by the menu as they have plenty of options from sweets to savory.  We ended up getting the glutinous rice balls, one with sesame and the other with peanuts.  I love anything glutinous and balls are always fun.  I've had their chicken and waffle years ago and it definitely hits the spot.  

Great place for large and small groups especially late night.  Good service.
author: Linda N.

description: Great place for HK desserts. Friends brought me here and I got myself a condensed milk + butter toast and it was perfect. The HK milk tea was on point too. The service was fairly friendly (although my friends speak Cantonese) and I have no complaints. The price is right too. I definitely can see myself coming here in the future if I'm in the area and craving sweet!
author: Jenn T.

description: Kowloon tong is the shit,the owner is really friendly he's always around!he clean up the tables,taking orders all that,such a hard working person!!!i always bring girls here just because the lighting is right,you know when you met a girl in the club,she's like...with a heavy make up fake eyelashes n shit,you needa bring them here check them out,because the lighting is so-damn-right!make sure they're hot before you date her!i freaking love this place.I don't care how the ice cream,fish balls....meatballs.....jelly shit tastes like,I just wanna check out the girls you know what I'm sayinnn lmao
author: Glenmorangie S.

description:
Nothing out of the norm in terms of an Asian dessert place. The service is pretty quick and the waiters are friendly. They immediately provided me and my friend cups of hot tea. It wasn't super packed on a Thursday evening (and parking around the area was surprisingly easy [maybe we got lucky]). 

I ordered the waffle ice cream sandwiches. They weren't bad. But I felt the waffle was a bit overcooked and too stiff for my liking. Plus I didn't get as much ice cream as shown in other yelper's pics :(... Same thing goes for the waffles made in my friend's order. In terms of the egg puffs they weren't exactly baked together. The top and bottom slide off easily from one another which isn't a big deal but it didn't seem made properly. 

Maybe I should have just went with the usual and got sago. I'll probably come back if I'm in the area but wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I'm not a super big fan of desserts but nonetheless, I decided to give this place a try. Got there around 930pm and there were a good amount of seats. But when we left around 11pm, there was a big crowd of people inside and outside the restaurant waiting to get served. Good thing I went early but they are open till 2am which is nice. 

Cafe style setup where they have a good mix of appetizers, entrees and drinks. Went with salt and pepper chicken wings, fries, mango sago and mango a go go. The food here is surprisingly good. My favorite was probably the chicken wings. Super juicy and great flavor. As for the dessert I preferred the mango sago over the mango a go go. The milk really helps the dessert and the sago had more flavor than the mango a go go. The only downside was that there wasn't a lot of mango but overall the sago was good. Not watered down or icy like some places. 

The service was unsatisfactory. They never came up to us to take the order as the waiter was standing right next to us but waited for us to call him over. The never checked up on us during the visit. Pretty much served us the food and left. Didn't offer us water or anything. Overall food doesn't take long to come out but I would have thought they would have considered checking up on their customers more. 

Free waffle ice cream sandwich for order of $30 or more when you check in on Yelp.
author: Raymond Z.

description:
I had a sore throat and was looking for some ginger milk curd.

I did a Yelp search and this is probably the only Hong Kong Style dessert restaurant in San Francisco. I was a bit skeptical at first given that there were only two customers inside at 9 PM on Monday. But I suppose dessert is more of a late night thing since more people came in at 9:30.

My bf ordered their almond and sesame paste. Pretty sweet, not bad! 
The waiter told me the ginger was a bit spicy but it was just fine. I guess they couldn't make it too spicy otherwise customers won't like it.

Cash only?!
author: Danae L.

description: I have been here several times. They have an extensive menu from cold to hot desserts, snacks to instant noodles and dinner entree. There is usually a wait Friday or Saturday night. I always order their black sesame paste. I tried many of their hot desserts and think they are on the sweeter end (its dessert after all) and I'll always ask for a hot cup of water to dilute the hot serving dessert. Egg puffs is a must.
author: SevLong L.

description:
Kind of your hole in the wall place. Their service alone deserves a 5-star. My boyfriends and I walked in about 20min away from their closing time, but they still happily sat us down. (I know a lot of other Asian cafe/restaurant where you'll know you're not welcomed if you come last minute)

The egg puff is a great go-to! Soft on the inside and just a little crispy on the outside. The Sago was also pretty delish. Probably avoid the curry fish balls if you can (I remember my grandma would take me Seven-Eleven in GuangZhou as a kid and those were bigger and chewier... Less dry), these were not like that. The chicken nuggets too. I mean they're no different than a lot of other places but I don't like how dry and crunchy they are. Otherwise the menu has copious amount of your typical Cantonese desserts and treats. It's a good place for some nostalgia fix.
author: Lucy L.

description:
How is this place so popular? The world may never know.
I came here with friends on Thanksgiving Day trying to get some food after Black Thursday shopping.

We ordered a lot of food and regretted all of it except the fried chicken wings.
Here's what we ordered:
Spaghetti with chicken steak and curry - $9.50 for a mouthful of angel hair and a flat fried chicken breast
Egg puff - expensive and overheated, it was way too brown
Hot HK Milk tea - nothing special, small cup
Salt+Pepper chicken wings - $5 for 6 of the world's smallest wings
Curry fish balls - $4 for 6 balls, you could get 2-3times more in Chinatown
Free waffle ice cream - if it wasn't free, there was no way I would get this
Regular fried chicken wings and fries - Big and juicy, the only good thing of the night
Black seasame paste - watered down like crazy, came with combo meal for extra $2

The only reason I'm giving this a 2 stars is because they take card, was open on thanksgiving day, and service wasn't terrible, but the food doesn't make up for any of it.
author: Da X.

description: Too long of the wait. Service was crappie because food came out super slow. Take forever to seat you down. Lack of employees especially on busy weekends. Disappointed! Not coming back.
author: Mila N.

description:
Nice homey little dessert shop in Richmond

Wow, why is everyone on Yelp so down on this place?  It seems like a lot of folks were not impressed by their service--I counted only 2 waiters, at 11pm, for a packed store with a line waiting outside. Give them a break! Their service seemed fine at least to me :)

We happened to bump into this place while walking around for bubble tea. It was 11pm and most places were closed--out of the distance, we saw this shining light coming from a tiny shop, with a lot of people waiting outside. We looked at the menu, and was pleasantly surprised that such a dessert place existed, and the menu includes EVERYTHING. woot.

With so many good things to try, we had to order a bunch of stuff! Curry squid, tofu fa, soup, various teas--if only we hadn't eaten dinner elsewhere first! The food quality was pretty good--basically up to what'd I expect. They weren't putting anything on the menu that they didn't really know how to make in a decent way. And did I mention the menu is huge?

Folks, there's a reason why at 11pm, in a quiet neighborhood where pretty much all other stores are closed, this unassuming place is not only opened, but packed full, with a large crowd waiting outside for tables.

Will DEFINITELY come back to this place. I want to try the Sago! So many possible things to try next time.
author: Henry L.

description: had to try this dessert I've seen all over my newsfeed, I guess it was alright,
author: Vicky T.

description: I love this place to get my fix for good ol' Hong Kongnese food. It's not your standard Chinese food fare but definitely reminiscent of what we had in Hong Kong so come here for a true experience of the different food options and atmosphere. Their Soy Sauce Chicken Wings, Soup Noodles, Pan Fried Noodles with Eggs and Spam, Pork Chop and Pan Fried Rice Noodle with XO Sauce are delicious. They have a HUGE selection of Cantonese desserts ranging from Glutinous Rice Balls filed with things to dessert soups to smoothies with tapioca balls and ice cream sandwiches. Set your expectation on tasty Chinese food you've probably never had before as in no Beef Chow Fun, Har Gaw or Hong Style Chow Mein but yes, Pickled Cabbage with Pork Rice Noodles and Pan Fried Udon with Hot Dog. Yes, I said Hot Dog. Mmmm...
author: Jen L.

description:
Nice little dessert shop. It's often pretty crowded with a diverse crowd - ranging from middle schoolers to elderly couples. I've only had desserts here (although the menu is pretty extensive with other stuff too) and I am a fan! I love hong kong style desserts, sago, waffles, etc. This place definitely reminds me of Shooting Star in Oakland. 

The prices are cheap and portions big. I would definitely go with a friend or 2 and get a few items to share - there are so many things to try! 

Service was prompt and friendly despite the shop being pretty full.
author: Mary N.

description: Been here on and off through the years. A perk is that they do accept credit cards and are open late. Their eggettes are light and fluffy although a bit flavorless. The guy mistook my order and gave me mango black rice instead of sticky rice which is what I was craving for. They add corn to their macaroni soup which is different.
author: Julie L.

description:
I remember my friends and I would always come here in high school during late night hang outs. This was definitely the place to be. It was cash only and back then Smart and Final didn't care if we parked in their lot. But that was probably 1.5 decades ago. Fast forward to present day there's a sign outside of Kowloon that prohibit their customers from parking at Smart and Final lol. Back then the free ice cream waffle was at a minimum of $25 or more and now it's $30 (probably for the last few years). Still a good deal though. The ice cream is high quality because it's made with Dreyers ice cream and you can taste the high quality. Everything here is so fun to eat. You can order cold food, hot food, dessert and more. The options are endless. I wonder what happened to the happy guy who used to work here? He was always so happy and offered extraordinary customer service but I haven't seen him recently. He always made the dining experience pleasant because he was always so enthusiastic. Some of the workers now don't look very happy lol. Anyways I wish there were more dessert spots like Kowloon. I don't really know any other ones or I haven't ventured out far enough. There's a few along Geary and Clement but I don't really go there anymore. I like getting the egg and luncheon meat sandwich because it has no crust. It's luncheon meat and not spam and I like how they are honest about it because I hate places that say spam but put luncheon meat. I also like the ramen noodles plate with egg and luncheon meat. My picky husband likes coming here too so that's definitely a plus. Their hot tea stays hot for hella long because of the cup they used. They only have two high chairs for kids. There's mirrors on the wall and a TV. Bathroom is okay. Not hella clean but not hella dirty either. No toilet seat covers though. I hope they decide to invest in that. I feel like we order a lot when we come here but the total is only around $30 each time! This is definitely my favorite dessert spot in the Bay Area (until I find better).

I hope the free ice cream waffle with check in is forever because that is another reason why I keep coming back and order hella and bumped this review up to 5 stars.
author: Jan E.

description:
nice dessert place, good food, but it's a little bit pricy $$$

Egg puff is a must order. 

Mango-go-go is good, very authentic just like what I had in Hong Kong before.

Super B jelly is also pretty good if you like fruits（i don't rmb the name, but it's something like this. The one with ice cream on) 

Curry fish ball is pretty good but $$

The only disappointing thing I had is the mo mo cha cha....it's not like that! There should be BEANS in the bowl, what I got is  a bowl of tapioca with a little bit blended red bean :(

But good place for dessert and hang out with friends thou
author: Sunny L.

description:
Waffle waffle power

Pros:
- Vast menu that includes snacks, desserts, dessert drinks, savory foods.
- Water is served in thermal cups that keep them cold for a while.
- Waffle + ice cream + sandwich concept = yes. D'oh.
- Waffle sundae = crisp waffle triangles with a big cup of Neapolitan ice cream. Numnums.
- Crispy egg puffs. I like them crispy, wish eggettes would make theirs a bit crispier.
- Apparently, more ice cream flavors are available (I heard it used to just be vanilla). 
- Warm taro sago = not too sweet, not piping hot. Nice for the cold nights.
- Open till late.

Alas, some cons:
- Egg puffs don't taste like much.
- Slow service (kept raising our hand for check since lots of people were waiting for seats, but the worker never really acknowledge us. 
- Waffle is prepackaged methinks.
- Small area, can get easily crampy inside.
- Dim, can barely see anything.
- Cash only ( seriously why the hell are dessert places CASH ONLY???)
- No sauces for popcorn chicken.

Overall this place is okay. It can be a big hit/miss though IMO.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
This is my go to place when I have the late night munchies. This place closes really late, which i like. I always get their shaved ice and definitely get a scoop of ice cream. The creaminess from the ice cream pairs well with the condensed milk, shaved ice, and whatever fruit you get. I always get their mango or strawberry. 

I've been here many times and when I get their fried chicken wings with fries, the size always changes. It is never consistent which disappoints me. My friend got it once and he had humongous pieces. The next time we went, I got it and my pieces were tiny. Sad life.

The must have to get here are their ice cream waffle sandwiches. It was my first time seeing such a dessert exist but it is really good. I always get the vanilla and matcha green tea ice cream. 

This place can get crowded on the weekends but the wait is always short.
author: Peter N.

description: GET THE CHICKEN WINGS. hk style dessert. so gooooood. open late all the time. I also like that they have one grumpy waiter and one super cheerful waiter.
author: Kelly C.

description:
one of my favorite hk dessert cafes

mango sago- 5/5
tofu fa - 5/5
black sesame dumplings - 5/5
almond paste - 5/5
egg puffs - 3/5
condensed milk butter brick toast - 5/5 AMAZING it made me wanna cry
author: Christine G.

description:
In my opinion, Creations Dessert House in SF and Shooting Star Cafe in Oakland are a lot better.  The only thing that stands out is Waffle Ice Cream Sandwich and the Waffle Ice Cream Sundae.  For those, the waffle is made out of egg puff batter.      
I also ordered Egg puffs, which were sub-par.  There was too much tapioca starch and not enough flavour, making them extremely squishy and tasteless.
author: Janine M.

description: Well, this place is one of my face out in SF. Nice , reasonable price, good food, nice service, always busy, I think it is really nice place to hanging with friend or family.
author: Mindy Y.

description: Ice cream is bland, the only reason this place is popular is there is not a lot of dessert cafe within the 10-mile radius.
author: Alex H.

description:
When i came here with my friends late night, although it was packed, the customer service was horrible. There is literally no room to walk around in the store since they have tried to squeeze chairs and tables everywhere. That being said, I found that it was rude to tell someone who ordered boba to go wait outside (in the cold) and not have any manners to move in front of or behind a customer. After ordering, people who have ordered after my group (we all ordered individually) received their drinks first. And we had to go back in to ask about our drinks. Total wait time was 50 mins for a few boba drinks and hot tea. I thought maybe the drinks would make up for it, however the drinks tasted sub-par.

I am definitely not coming here again.
author: Fish F.

description:
Don't come here expecting desserts to be on par with the dessert cafes you find in HK or Taiwan, but come with the expectation that this is the only one with the same authentic feel around the area. What I mean is that the service is mediocre, the decor is boring / old and there's always a Cantonese television running. All epitomes of classic HK diners.

I like this place because it makes me really nostalgic of all the HK diners I've been to, and this place is always crowded whenever I come. I haven't tried the food, but I really enjoy their mango sago and shaved ice with mango, grass jelly and mango ice-cream. I haven't had any of their non-mango desserts because their most consistent dessert seems to be their mango, so I would advise you to get that. I'd like to try their food one day, but I have pretty low expectations to be honest.

4 stars because I thoroughly enjoyed the mango desserts I've gotten here, so the star rating speaks to only that.
author: Claudia C.

description: Came here on a late night and it was fairly busy. Ordered popcorn chicken and it was ok tasting. Asked for ketchup and got it when I was almost done eating. My friend who is vegan ordered the soy chicken and the waiter said it was made of tofu. It was just normal chicken wings. Asked for water a few times and never got it
author: Nate S.

description:
I came here on a Sunday afternoon looking for some dessert. It wasn't busy at all but the service was extremely slow. It took around 10 minutes for our order to be taken even though there were no other patrons waiting for their orders to be taken. The waitress was also not friendly at all. We didn't hear a peep from her the entire interaction. We asked for tea about 3 times before she finally brought it to our table. 

The dessert was nothing special. I ordered the mixed fruit sweet sticky rice and it was subpar. The fruits weren't sweet and the sticky rice was pretty bland. My sister ordered a mango sago with glutinous balls and that was pretty decent.


I'd probably try something else if i ever come back. But 2 stars for the bad service.
author: Renee B.

description:
I'm from SoCal and unfortunately, we didn't have good authentic Hong Kong small snacks and dessert. I was craving for late night tea and found this amazing place. We ordered their salt and pepper chicken wings, grass jelly fruit ice cream dessert, white egg flan, egg puffs, and can't forget the Hong Kong style tea. The food and vibe was on point! Definitely made me remanence my Hong Kong visit.  

Highly recommended!!!! =9
author: Xtine T.

description: Lots of different Asian dessert options!! We ordered the ginger milk, mango sago, and ice cream with eggettes, which were all super good!!
author: Angel G.

description: Its a no frills dessert place, real old school. nothing spectacular but i usually come here for dessert with friends after work or something. the service is nice, they're always friendly, esp when your with a group of chinese people lmao. its pretty cheap, i mean its just dessert like 5-7$ a plate/bowl. i like their salt& hot pepper wings thooo, i always get them even tho last time i was here they skimped on garlic ! ): but anyway we come here regularly and will probably continue to, its open late so thats always nice and there's usually parking everywhere but i mean i don't see why there wouldn't be because nothing else around there is open when they are haha.
author: Diana N.

description: I walked in around 10pm and place was almost full. Wasn't greeted by anyone, and after there was a table available, we still weren't greeted or told we could sit down. We ended up standing in the front for a good 10 minutes until the waiter asked if we wrote our names down.... At the clipboard that was on a far wall that wasn't noticeable. (Tip: have it on the wall next to the door maybe?) We finally sat down and the waitress took our order by standing at our table, staring at us, writing down what we wanted, and walked away. No words came out of her mouth. Service is terrible, food's whatever. Thumbs down.
author: Cecille W.

description:
The atmosphere is very lively. Lots of people coming in at night even even on weekdays. Price is fair considering the spot it is located at.

Food is okay. This is more just like a place to mingle with friends.

The lower star is mainly for the staff, the waiter was alright although I feel like he could slow down a bit.

The person on the inside that brings out items should definitely do an attitude check. 

We know you are busy and stuff, but as customers who just sat down and haven't got their items we do wanna feel welcomed and feel not like you want us out asap.
author: Michael W.

description:
Whatever you do: DON'T get the curry fish balls. It was a huge rip off. We got 8 small, clearly store bought, reheated balls for $4. 

We also ordered the salt and hot pepper chicken wings (fair), egg puffs (fair), mango go-go which is mango with sago tapioca and grapefruit (small but good), and the French toast (poor). The French toast didn't have enough egg on it, so it lacked flavor. It wasn't crunchy enough, and the middle of the toast just tasted like semi stale bread. Even after we drenched it with butter and maple syrup it was still flavorless.

Overall, nothing was really worth it except the mango go-go (even though most dishes were less than $6). But I guess I shouldn't expect to get tasty non-dessert items at a dessert cafe. What a shame...
author: Venus F.

description: We came here at midnight on a midnight food run, and it was exactly what I was looking for.  We ordered a banana split, which was exactly like any other banana split.  We also ordered the Nutella sandwich, it was spectacular! The atmosphere was great, the waiter was super friendly.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because I thought the sandwiches were a little too expensive. Other than that, I recommend coming here, definitely give it a try!
author: Andres S.

description: This place is where to go if you miss Hong Kong and want to somewhat feel like you're on Kowloon island again. Of course it's not as good as Hong Kong, but it's alright. It's a great place to go late in the evening if you just want to relax, be out, but not necessarily at a bar. I've always got the Mango Sago there and I recommend it. It's a great dessert cafe. The service at this place isn't the best though as I never know if I'm suppose to go up to the counter to pay or wait for my check to come to me. It's kind of ambiguous. There's also quite a large young crowd here as well. Probably younger than 21 I assume! Decent place though, I come back here every now and then from time to time over the years.
author: Julie L.

description: This place been here at this location for along time. Good for Asian dessert or a small snacks.
author: Hing S.

description:
Pretty good dessert place in SF. They give you a free waffle ice cream sandwich when you check in on Yelp :).

It tends to get crowded. I've seen groups of people waiting outside before. Maybe the hype has gone down now? Cause the last couple of times I've been here there was no wait.

I've tried their egg puffs which was pretty good. I've also tried their regular food too. Big portion for the price you pay and not bad. I got the curry chicken cutlet with spaghetti noodles.

Service is whatever's. Typical asian service you get. 

It's not my #1 place to go but not a bad place for dessert. I'll be around.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Nice HK Style dessert restaurant with very friendly and prompt service. Unfortunately, compared to the restaurants in East Bay, the portions are tiny and super expensive. The desserts they serve are definitely good, but not at all worth the price :(

We had:
1. Mango Sago - the mango chunks were SO FRESH and SWEET. Delicious, but the bowl of dessert was tiny.
2. Tang yuan (sesame) - probably warmed from a packet, you could probably make this on your own. Give it a miss.
3. Yin Yang dessert - I thought this was a little on the watery side, also again, the serving was tiny.

Overall the food tasted agreeable enough, but it was nothing to write home about. I wouldn't mind coming back if I were in the neighborhood but its definitely not a place I would come out of my way to visit.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I am surprised this place only has three and a half stars! 

I was in San Francisco around 11pm having little hope any dessert or boba place would be open this late. Luckily we saw this place that was open until 1! I was intrigued by all the photos of the desserts and foods.

There were a good amount of people when we arrived. We were immediately greeted and seated once we entered. The menu was pretty straight forward. They not only have desserts, but food platters as well! They have desserts like sago, ice cream, egg puffs, tea, and the list can go on!

We ordered the green tea ice cream waffle sandwich which was delicious, but I found it hard to eat. The popular mango go go exceeded my expectations. Lastly the egg puffs were by far the best I ever had! It was the right amount of fluffiness, chewy on the inside, and crunchy on the outside.

The customer service was awesome! Everybody in the restaurant looked happy with the service. 

I can see how this place can get really busy on Friday and the weekends. The place is pretty big for a dessert place. This place is perfect if you have a late night sweet tooth!
author: Sarah D.

description: If it's past nine and you want food, come here. Came in around ten and it's like the busiest times since everyone is out looking for late night snacks/desserts. I just finished watching Finding Dory and was craving dessert so bad that o literally bussed from downtown to the Richmond district hehe. I always pass by this place but I never actually went inside before so I'd thought I'd give it a go. Ordered my own dessert and egg puffs and food came super quick. The egg puffs was something I expected to be good because it was black sesame egg puffs but what I thought wasn't what I got because it was basically plain egg puffs with little pieces of black sesame spread around lol. But it's still alright. What I really liked was the mango go go. I love how you mainly taste mango and only slightly coconut milk because usually it's the opposite. Since the check in on Yelp was free ice cream waffle for orders over $30, we got it after. It was good but k was already full oops. Overall this place is a cute dessert or snack place.
author: Lisa W.

description: Visited on a random weeknight and place was 30% full. Ordered the sesame almond paste and glutinous ball with peanuts on top. The paste was disappointing as you could hardly taste the sesame -- too watered down. The glutinous ball was empty inside, unlike other dessert spots, and were okay. Easy parking nearby.
author: Kerry K.

description: It's a good surprise to find this place in SF. I lived in Union Square area so it was a bit of a drive to get here. I like how this place is open until 2AM so you can come for a late night snack if you're hungry. They offer main courses as well as dessert...just like a Hong Kong style cafe. I recommend the curry fish balls and waffle ice cream. It's not a fancy place but I like to come here once in a while!
author: Natalie C.

description: Don't expect the good service here. We walked in and grabbed a seat ourselves. No greeting no nothing. They didn't even ask us if we wanted water or anything until our food came. It took them literally 15 minutes after we sat down just to take our order. I got the super mango pudding, it was disgusting. The mango pudding had no mango flavor at all and the ice cream inside was pretty much starting to melt. The egg puff we got was hard, should've listened to other people's yelp reviews before ordering. The fries here were pretty good! Maybe I'll come back and try something else.
author: Ruby F.

description: Awesome place when you get a sweet craving.. they have some innovative deserts which I rarely see otherwise. Highly recommended options are waffle sandwich with nutella and mango sagoo .. Awesome!!!
author: Neha M.

description: Years later and I still come here for late night desserts. Sometimes, I feel like it's a hit or miss because there are days where I enjoy it and other days where I'm like ehh. The last time I visited, it wasn't too bad. Parking can be hard, regardless I think there's always going to be a spot around. It's usually really crowded and there's a clipboard inside for the wait list. I never really had to wait too long for a table to open up. The egg puffs are good when they first come out and before they get cold. The sesame paste was fine. The mixed fruit sago was pretty good this time because I feel like it's usually watered down or something. The last few times I've been here service is whatever, we never get tea anymore, and the check in offer just keeps getting higher. Overall, I'm here when I'm craving something and that's about it.
author: Maggie W.

description: I usually order the super mango pudding but decided to try something different. I tried out their "sweet sticky rice" dessert... the "rice" at the bottom is actually red bean! Also, Kowloon typically serves complimentary tea to customers but has not been consistent.
author: Jenn G.

description: Pretty decent dessert with friendly service. I wasn't super impressed with the desserts but it was ok. The milk tea there tastes like instant milk tea, not worth it to try.
author: Kelly Y.

description:
We came on a Saturday night and it was pretty packed! Horrible horrible customer service. There were no seats so we had to hang around outside. Food took almost half an hour and turned out mediocre. We freaking asked the cashier before we left if everything including napkins/sauces/utensils were in there and he said yes yes.. BUT we didn't get any ketchup or napkins and had to go back to ask for them.. ALSO, my friend tried to check into Yelp for the free ice cream at the end of the order but the cashier dude just burst out laughing to say that we need to spend minimum of $40 and that he already saw her with the app open. Cheap asshole..

We're definitely never coming here again!
author: Minhtam D.

description:
Food 7.5/10
Customer Service 7.5/10
Comfort 7/10
Price Value 7.5/10
Overall 7.5/10

This place has a decent variety of desserts ranging from ice cream, sundaes, fruit bowls, sago, etc...Also if you spend over $25 or more and check in FB or Yelp, you get a free ice cream waffle sandwich which is always a BONUS. When i go here, i tend to get the banana split sundae or the mango a go go. Great place for late night dessert and is quite a popular spot. Recommended for all kinds of people.
author: Auden W.

description:
Best place for dessert and noodles :)

Recommendation:
- Puff ice cream
- waffle ice cream 
- steamed milk 
- their instant noodles are the most tasty instant noodles ever
- chicken wings 
- mango go go 

You can find parking here most of time so this is definitely a perk!! 
I look forward for more dinner food than dessert on the menu in the future.
author: Eva F.

description: Great place to go when you want your Chinese dessert fix, but definitely not the best we've had. The egg puffs are good, the sago with mango isn't too great (mango isn't ripe enough), and I've made better tang yuan with ginger than here.
author: Larissa L.

description: Worst experience I've ever had, extreme long waiting time, seems like they don't care about that you are waiting, bad service, dessert was ok. Will never come again, many better food places to go.
author: Jerry L.

description: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free banana split ice cream waffle sandwich with a purchase of $30 or more.  Enough said.  Worth it!
author: Platform Universe S.

description: This is THE GO TO SPOT for some midnight snacking! Service is quick, so is the food! Line slows down around 9pm-10pm. 4 stars because of the line and cant take the waffle ice cream togo!
author: Potatoe Q.

description:
3+ for the good selections on menu
2- bad customer server service

This was few months ago, i was being accompanied with person for dessert just as i was ready to ask for taking an order. Some fuck'n stupid customer aka old hag that was about to leave just had to bug our server for w/e some shit. It was hella busy n' packed too. I could careless, if it's not busy but since it is. The order could take long, you know?! No common sense of respectful to others and common of courtesy. Some chinese ppl that are middle aged groups are just so very fuck'n rude and inconsiderate. 

Exuse me! You know?! That is just totally fuck'n very rude and uneducated to do that. Wouldnt kill her to just wait till he is done taking our orders and or any questions that we may have before ordering. The server should know better at his job by should of saying, "just give a second sorry, lemmie finish taking their orders first" you know?! 

It's just totally fuck'n rude n' unacceptable at a busy dessert workplace like that. I was already pissed and making a pissed expression facial. You dont do that to customers, whether ur a leaving customer or server; it's just downright wrong. 

How would either those feel, if i did same shit to either one of them. Geez! All i know is, I am going to give this place a one more chance and give it a retry; otherwise, I WILL complain to manager!!! PERIOD!!!!! 

Then maybe, i will give a better update review so lets just hope so that way in nearest future. Besides, i did like this place b/c they do have good selections to choose from.
author: Lorrine L.

description:
latest visit @ fave HK "d-sert" spot: aftr super bowl city fireworks #2...omg, 3 of us killed 6 sweets & 1 savory (incl free yelp ice crm waffle sammie)...aftr pre-CNYE din earlier too!...

been coming here for yyyrs...since it opened like 15+ yrs ago?...aah, when we were youngens & still going to school...there was a period when 1 of my gf's & i met up here once a wk to catch up every wk...we still often go here when we get 2gether now...tried many other places, but this continues to be our unbeatable staple...

THE VIBE  |  a long lil shop on the side street of a corner brick bldg...alwaz busy no matter what time of the nite or day of the wk we come...but the wait, if any, is nvr too bad... casual, lively cafe with wooden chairs & tables...flatscreen on the  bk wall that plays chinese movies, which no 1 really pays attn to...

THE GRUB  |  menu has expanded again...more savory snacks + entrees!...mmmany items overall...could be overwhelming if u r not used to it...but if u r like us, u'd appreciate the variety...

some of our faves:
- egg puffs, 3.25
- mixed [fresh] fruit w/ honeydew puree & sago, 5.25
- soya wings, 6.25
- new: s&p wings, 5.95
- sesame & almond paste, 4.95
- peanut filled glutinous [rice] balls, 4.75
- peanut butter [stuffed] french toast, 4.95
- steamed rice crepe, [w/ sesame seeds & hoisin sauce], 4.75
- sometimes, noodles if i haven't had din yet...5.5 - 6.5 ...six pasta types, incl instant ramen, w/ many protein options...
- if we hit 30 bucks, i redeem us the free ice cream waffle sammie for checkin' into yelp...

popular items we don't usually get:
- other hk snacks (curry fishballs or squid, popcorn chix, etc), 4.25 - 6.5
- sammies (ex. luncheon meat & egg), 3.5-5.95
- new, entrees: spaghetti or rice meal sets w/ hot drink & dessert, only 9.5!
- stewed delicates (snow frog, bird's nest, papaya, white fungus, etc), 5.95-12.95
- steamed egg or milk custard w/ delicates or other, 4.95-12.95
- hot tofu fa choices, 4.5
- shaved ice, 4.95
- hot & iced drinks, ~3
- fresh fruit juices & smoothies, 3.75-4.5
- & much more...

THE SERVICE  |  fast, efficient, busy...sometimes, u have to flag them down...

THE CONCLUSION  |  heart this place!...good variety of HK desserts at very reasonable prices...can sit for hrs, nibble & chat or use free wifi w/out evr being rushed...they were still seating til almost closing time too, nice...
author: Nettie S.

description:
I rarely give 1 star reviews, but I really felt this cafe didn't deserve much more than 1 star. How unfortunate! This place was bookmarked on my Yelp Account for the longest time and I finally had the opportunity to try it out after my boyfriend and I went out for dinner. 

Firstly, we sat down and noticed the plethora of signs stating "Free ice cream waffle sandwich with purchase of $30 or more if you check in on Facebook or Yelp." This caught us by surprise, because initially we checked the Yelp page and were excited to see a check in offer. The check in offer on Yelp does not state you must order $30 or more to be eligible for the offer. It's not that big of a deal, but I just wished they mentioned the small print on their Yelp page.

Secondly, the waiter served us "hot" tea. It wasn't hot at all and tasted more like lukewarm flavored water. Gross.

Moving on, we looked at the menu and decided just to order one dessert. (Good thing!) We ordered the "Mixed Fruit Sago" which oddly we thought was a hot dessert. Yeah, it was served to us cold. This silly mistake may have been our lack of experience in ordering from a HK cafe, but why is it under "hot desserts" on the menu?

The last deciding factor in why this restaurant only deserves 1 star, value. The Mixed Fruit Sago ringing in at $6 was subpar in quality and wasn't worth $6. The fruit was not fresh and the sago lacked flavor. Meh. :(

Save your dimes & quarters and skip this cafe.
author: Briana H.

description:
Nothing special about their food and really bad service.

The desserts here are not fresh (even if the word "fresh" is in the title), overly sweet, and just bad quality. Definitely not worth the money that you pay for it. They had a special going when we went in for a late-night post-dinner dessert: free waffle sundae sandwich with a $25 purchase (there was also a free deluxe waffle sundae sandwich offer on Yelp if you ordered $30 or more). Since there were five of us, we easily passed the amount by ordering one dessert each. I had the mango sago, which seemed like a pretty classic, light, and safe option. It turned out to be... okay.

The waffle sundae sandwich? Two pieces of cheap Eggo waffles (yes, EGGO WAFFLES) with one big scoop of French vanilla ice cream in between. The regular menu price for this dessert is somewhere between $6 and $7. Are you kidding me? Good thing we didn't pay for it.

Pass. There are plenty of better Hong Kong dessert places in the city for me to patron.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
They have Hong Kong desserts, snacks and entrees!

I love their refreshing cold puddings!  Anything with mango and sago, is a sure win for an order!  It's great on a beautiful SF, warm day!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kowloon-tong-dessert-cafe-san-francisco?select=So4PdD6X00mPhQzFm3bX2w#So4PdD6X00mPhQzFm3bX2w

Their waffles are made fresh - their batter ingredients leaves a bit for improvement in terms of tasty goodness!  Nom away right when it is served to you!  The butter and depending on what you get for the filling, is great when eaten right away because it is soft, melted and warm!  Delish!

Adequate seats and tables!  Service is commendable - they know which ones to recommend!

I love how they are opened late!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Overall service is not bad, they refill your water/tea. Ordered for the popcorn chicken and it tasted like the Tyson frozen chicken you get at Costco, overly salted and heavily battered. Egg puffs, sago, ice cream waffle all tasted good, but prices has increased since I last visited them a few months ago.
author: Angela L.

description:
Fellow Yelpers Fia R, Hube N, Jonathan W and I wanted dessert before dinner, so we came to this popular Hong Kong dessert house one late afternoon. The interior has a flat screen TV, is very spacious, and appropriate for groups. It was difficult to see the server who stood behind the counter located far away from the entrance. So instead, we seated ourselves and the overall atmosphere was casual and relaxed. 

Popcorn Chicken ($3.95): Chicken was breaded and deep-fried but lacked the crispy textures, seasoning, and basil and red pepper. Not as good as the ones at Factory Tea Bar.

Egg Puff ($2.50): One of my favorite Hong Kong desserts. I used to buy these as hand warmers when I lived in the Boston area. However, there were too many air pockets instead of a cake-like soft and spongy center. It tasted like a vanilla sugar cone and not the egg puffs I'm addicted to. Seems like a popular item here, but I don't recommend it.

Black Sesame Paste ($3.95): The flavor of Black Sesame was decent, but the paste could be a lot thicker with stronger aroma. The quality did not match the ones at Phoenix Food Boutique, My Favorite Café, and 100% Sweet Café. 

Mixed Fruit Honeydew Sago ($4.75): I loved the taste of the sago, but the fruit was not ripe enough to add to the flavors. 

I love Hong Kong style desserts, but why is it that service is always super slow and completely absent? I had to get out of my seat numerous times in order to get the server's attention. She never came back to check on us during the visit, and the "don't care" approach can be quite irritating after a while. Those interested should exercise extreme patience and be willing to tolerate mediocrity. I will only come back with Yelpers who are fans of this place.
author: Daniel L.

description:
First time at this place on a Saturday night (around 11pm) & surprisingly we didn't have to wait very long, probably 10 minutes max. Their customer service is really good & the staff is very friendly and welcoming. 
Their food is alright - I ordered pan seared pork on pan fried egg noodles & they gave me pan fried rice noodles (which they apologized for, but I was the last to receive my order out of 4 orders..and it was still incorrect). I just decided to eat it anyways because I didn't want to wait longer. The food wasn't salty at all, which is a good thing to me, and the pork was pretty good & lightly flavored. We also ordered a side of fried tofu, which I didn't like. I usually love tofu, but I don't like their deep fried tofu.. I just didn't like the taste. I ordered my mom chicken and pork with udon noodles, and she wasn't a fan of the udon. She told me it's because there wasn't enough salt (typical Filipinos lol). My brother got a combo (forgot what it was), but he has been here before and he said he likes it. 
For deserts, their mango pudding is pretty good & their waffle ice cream sandwiches are delicious! Really a big fan of those! The waffle ice cream sandwiches were free because we checked in on Yelp and spent over $40 on our food. We didn't ask for a specific flavor, so we got vanilla ice cream & it was still really good. Their avocado smoothies are good, and their regular milk tea is pretty good too! The milk tea with coffee was alright, but nothing less than 3 stars out of five. 
Overall, I would go back to this place if I were in the area to get deserts, maybe for food..but more likely for deserts.
author: Jurizza R.

description: This is where you go after eating dinner and want something sweet. Kowloon has a variety of desserts to choose from and some light snacks to choose from. My boyfriend and I usually come here once a week. We usually get tofu fa or the glutinous balls with ginger soup. Mhmm....it definitely warms you up on a cold winter day. The tofu fa is only served on certain days of the week I believe. The wait can be 15-20 minutes depending on the size of your party and make sure to write your name on the wait list. It seems people get confused or don't know where the wait list clip board is because it's right next to the little toy dispenser thing. Most desserts are around $5-$10 at most and it's filling. Oh and if you check in on yelp, you get a free banana split waffle sandwich if you spend a certain amount I believe? I never got the deal since we don't really spend that much on desserts. But nonetheless, this is my go-to spot for Asian desserts! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
We stopped by here on the way home from an out-of-the way Cantonese Chinese restaurant. We wanted some Chinese dessert...

The name of the restaurant drew us in. It was the name of the area my wife lived in when she studied in Hong Kong.

We had the waffle ice cream sandwiches. They were delicious. We had strawberry and green tea ice cream and our children loved it.

The downside to this place is that it's dark inside, which takes away from the ambience. With such colorful desserts, I'd love to see what I'm eating.

I think that there's food here too, but a quick glance at the menu, and I think it's really unique Asian fusion.

This place is a fun adventure!
author: Brian F.

description:
Sesame Glutinous Rice Balls (4.50) - 5 balls in ginger soup for basically a dollar each. It was good but ridiculously overpriced.

HK Milk Tea (2.50) - My friend got this and said it was lukewarm. Bummer.

I'll probably be back to try the sago desserts but I would not reorder the glutinous rice balls. For $5 you can probably 2 dozen packs from a Chinese market. Not worth.
author: Lucy N.

description:
I cam here with three friends on a Friday night for some dessert and the place was very crowded! We had to wait for five minutes before we were seated. 

We ordered an Egg Puff and a Mango Sago and one friend ordered a Hot Fresh Soy Milk with no sugar. The Egg Puff came first and that actually tasted very delicious! It was warm and crunchy with the perfect texture. Our Mango Sago came next and there was a decent amount of fresh mango. There was also some grapefruit on top. That was pretty tasty too. My friend's Fresh Soy Milk, however, tasted sweeter than she had hoped even though she had asked for no sugar. 

Customer service was alright. The guy came to refill our tea twice, but most of the time they are very busy and do not really deliberately come to service you.
author: Regina L.

description:
This place is just whatevers. I tried their mango glutinous rice ball dessert ($4.95) and it was a little disappointing. The rice balls were too mushy and super bland. Creation's does it better because their rice balls are perfectly chewy and slightly sweet. AND Creation's gives you a bigger bowl at the same price.

Always a bunch of people whenever I come. It's a chill hang out spot for young people (teens - early 20's).  

TIP: Free ice cream waffle dessert if you spend $30 and check in on Yelp.
author: Nari C.

description: I have family members in Oakland and San Francisco and when we all have a late night get together, I guess this is our spot. They have friendly customer service. All of their desserts are delicious but I try my best to stay away from their noodles.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I giving this place full just because of the variety of food and dessert available here.  Very affordable price and definitely makes me feel like Hong Kong Style :)
author: Unyo N.

description: The mango sago is dabomb!!! Actually, everything that I have tried so far is good. Just be ready for the line and the wait. But worth it!
author: Louie D.

description: This place was packed with high school and college kids on Friday night. It's not on the main strip of stores that line Clement St. There isn't a lot of parking but you can pay to park across the street at the Smart & Final lot. The menu is pretty extensive. Desserts are okay. Popcorn chicken lacked the flavors that can be found at boba places. French fries were pricey but good.
author: W A.

description:
My friend would not shut up about this place and I was pretty disappointed when I went.

The waffle ice cream sandwiches were pretty good, but then again, I think it's pretty hard to screw up ice cream.

Egg puffs - left no impression on me whatsoever.

On the plus side, they're open pretty late.
author: Trang B.

description:
Not bad for Asian desserts.

I basically came here for one item, and it did not disappoint. I just wanted the steamed egg - so delicious!

So I came here with bunch of friends, and they were all very pleased with all the items. The waffles and ice cream was really good as well, nothing special but just good. 

I like the egg puffs here as well. I am not the biggest fan of Asian desserts overall because I don't care for sago and such. 

I do like the check-in deals though, so check-in on yelp or facebook if you want free desserts. We did that and we were satisfied. This is more of a late night scene also. We came here around 9pm and it was pretty empty but it became crowded as the night went on.
author: Margaret L.

description: Very poor service and rude staff. They had an empty table capable of seating my group but still made us wait outside before letting us sit down. When the food finally came  it wasn't flavored well and was very bland. Definitely will not be coming again nor recommending. Oh and the check in dessert is only with a 40$ purchase.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
It was 9pm on a Monday night but it was packed! Egg puffs were good- I've never had any before elsewhere so I don't have anything to compare to... Everything came out promptly, order is taken from the table and you get free warm tea. We ordered butter and condensed milk toast which was HEAVEN. I was wondering why I gained 5lbs so fast...

I can def see myself hanging out here more if I lived out here and was under 21 and couldn't go to a bar. I'd just order milk tea and all the hongkongnese yumz infinitely. 

Mmmm can't wait to return and eat some spam noodles
author: Alexis P.

description:
Me and my bf have been going there for like years. They have good snack and dessert. 

Must try: 
1) Salt and hot pepper chicken wings. I don't eat spicy, so for those people that do not eat spicy, can ask for non spicy. 

2) Super B kid grass jelly. It has ice cream, different kinds of fruit, and grass jelly on the bottom. Good dessert for after dinner. 

3) Daily specials. I always order chicken steak with curry sauce. They have very good curry sauce. And it also comes with a hot drink. Cold drink needs a dollar more.
author: Connie H.

description:
Located in a somewhat unconventional place (in the middle of a residential block), this place comes short of mediocre for dessert. They don't have that much variety in their menus and serves very typical dessert. I ordered the mango pudding, mango sago, egg puff, steamed egg with sticky rice, and chicken wings. It was a bonus that they offered free waffle sundae with a check in.
Mango pudding: nothing special about it and tasted exactly like this brand of supermarket mango pudding that you can buy for $.99. They didn't try hard to mask the fact that it was made with powder. 
Mango sago: it was okay. Nothing much to say because it wasn't bad or good. Wouldn't get it again. 
Egg puff: it was pretty crispy which was nice but that's about it :/. Pretty plain tasting but then again it was just original flavor. 
Chicken wings: their chicken wings were spot on-crunchy and flavorful without being too salty (unlike some other dessert places -_-) the wings are the reason I gave this place an extra star. 
Steamed egg w/sticky rice: never had it with sticky rice and coconut milk before but it's not a bad combo. There wasn't much of an egg flavor, which might've been masked by the coconut milk and sticky rice. It's good in small amount but I had trouble finishing it. After awhile it starts to become too heavy due to the amount of rice. 
Waffle sundae: i wouldn't order it unless it was free...the waffle was plain but the vanilla ice cream was okay. Nothing special either. 
Service: the waiter provided good service and occasionally refilled our tea.
author: Annie V.

description: Nice standard Asian dessert place. Good selection. Good service. Been here a couple of times, will probably go back.
author: Kris F.

description:
If I lose my memory one, I doubt if I will ever forget about this HK style dessert store in San Francisco.  I discovered this store many many years ago on a random trip to San Francisco, but I would always go out of my way to come to this store when I am in the area because I am dessert-deprived here in Los Angeles.

Not only does the name "Kowloon Tong" sticks to my mind, the numerous items off their extensive menu have me drooling just thinking about it.  My favorite is the RED BEAN and TOFU PUDDING (but unfortunately, they are always out of tofu pudding when I am there.  They always tell me that they either "sold out" or they only sell tofu pudding on Friday & Saturday).  

Like I have said, they have a huge selection of things you can order from, I opted for the "B Grass-Jelly" during my last visit, in addition to my Spaghetti, Fried Chicken Wing, HK Pancake, and Curry Fishball.  (Yea, you can probably understand why I always come out of this store with a food coma, right?)

I would have given them a 5 stars, but the HK pancake was not up to par during my last visit.  It gets crazy here during the weekends, and like most of places in SF, parking is always a problem.

WARNING:  DON'T park at the parking lot across the street, they will TOW.
author: Anita L.

description:
My friends met here as one of them lived out in the Richmond and recommended this place for late night dessert. It was fairly packed for late night; we had to wait a bit for a table of 6. The server spoke minimal English so it made it a bit difficult to communicate. The menu is expansive as most Asian dessert places are. Almost everything was customizable. (Free waffle ice cream sandwich w/ Yelp or Facebook check-in). My order of sticky rice with coconut and mango was AWFUL. First, they brought out a red bean dish which I did not order. They brought it back and simply added some mango bits with a very liquified coconut syrup. My bowl was essentially broth! I was expecting white sticky rice with coconut sauce drizzled on top w/ mango slices. NOPE. So that's a fail.

The rest of the stuff we ordered at the table was good: curry fish balls, waffle ice cream sandwich, sesame custard,  egg puffs which were nice and warm. A bit airy which I prefer. 

They also have a small selection of foods to order in case you prefer to eat a full meal prior to their dessert. I may stop by out here if I am nearby but it isn't a place I would go out of the way for. I prefer my broths to be in ramen or pho--not mango sticky rice.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
All your standard HK desserts with great variety! I'd been craving HK desserts for a long time, and this place really hit the spot. So much so that I can 2 days in a row. 

I especially loved the egg puffs here. Crispy on the outside, and chewy on the inside, just the way it's supposed to be. If you have a group, make sure to order more than 1! It goes by really fast!

Other things that I've tried and recommend: mango sago, hot tofu soup and hot taro soup. All really good!

They can piece together tables, so this place is great for larger groups too!
author: Cynthia X.

description:
Your typical HK style cafe with an extensive menu. Service is pretty fast and friendly, and the place overall is "clean" (in Asian cafe standards). You also get complimentary tea! 

I recommend the waffle ice cream sandwich to share. The waffles are so crispy and comes in a huge portion (good for *at least* five people).

They have an extensive menu. For a "healthier' option, go for the fruit-based desserts that actually consist of fresh fruit rather than syrup-drenched canned fruit! 

Come in before 10p on a Friday/weekend night to beat the crowds.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Such a fun spot. On a recent jaunt to SF, my friends dedicated a day to introducing me to the Inner Richmond neighborhood. Kowloon Tong Dessert Cafe was just one of many stops, yet an easy highlight.

More utilitarian than elegant. The menu is vast in size, yet slim on description. The room's dim-lighting is out of electrical circumstance, not romantic intention.

So what is Kowloon Tong's charm? It's exactly the kind of shop I would imagine to find in the heart of HK. Modest and pragmatic, with a certain urban sense of efficiency. Complete with canto-television playing behind the counter, you can almost picture yourself in a Robynn & Kendy music video. Order something sweet, enjoy the complimentary tea, and smile.
author: Vincent P.

description: Good spot for late night Hong Kong style snacks, desserts, and beverages if you're in the Richmond. Food is decent and they play Hong Kong TV shows/videos on their TV. Don't expect really fast service like your typical Chinese restaurant and you'll feel fine. They may get busy late night on weekends.
author: Iris H.

description:
I'm giving this a 5 stars for being a family stop. When I grew up in SF, there were so many more places my parents could take us to.  I'm grateful that my parents didn't lock us up in the house. There were arcades and even the restaurants had machines of some sort to keep us occupied. When we venture out to the South Bay there are still malls for families. Now, the closest thing you're going to get to that is Stownstown or one of the Science Halls. Our desperate search for the description "kid-friendly" only shows how far the community has veered away from a culture where families belong. We have been taking our son here since he was 2, and people don't stare at him like they want to critique our child rearing skills. Anyway, this place is open late and the desserts are terrific. The wait staff are always phenomenal and they are always patient when explaining the menu choices. My husband and son only eat chocolate and the other dessert bars do not serve chocolate. I'm a mango pudding fanatic, so it works out great for all of us. Since we always come here after swimming, we order the noodles or fried chicken to share.

Sorry folks! My chocolate waffle pic didn't do that tasty bite any justice.  I was slurping down my Super Mango Pudding.
author: Evelyn K.

description:
Location: Its quite a small store, with limited street parking. 
Food: there are variety of dessert offering at this place. During the hot weather, I usually the mixed fruit ice dessert or ice cream waffle. However, if you prefer something hot, I think that mango sago or hot egg/ custard drink might be good choice! They all taste good and unique
Service: Their service is typical Asian! Not professional, but friendly and helpful
Price: The price is cheap compared to other places in San Francisco!!
author: GiaLinh N.

description:
Ordered egg puffs, taro sago, and almond-sesame paste. The food came out fairly quickly. Everything was extremely disappointing. The egg puffs looked promising with its crispy, golden exterior. Took a bite and chewed. The texture of the center was gummy and wasn't light and crispy like i expected. The taro sago was mostly sago with no actual taro pieces. The almond sesame paste looked nothing like the photo. It was bland and watery. Didn't really taste like almond or sesame. I was hoping for a paste (as stated in the name) but ended up disappointed. 

One star for accepting credit cards, one star for open until late. Will not come back.
author: Nina X.

description: I tried the sesame paste with red bean mochi, and it's a little sweet for me. My friends tried some cold desserts, and they are refreshing and not so sweet as mine.
author: Yunzhu C.

description: I absolutely love this place. I think i can say that it's my favorite dessert place in SF. I had the papaya with snow fungus and it was SO GOOD. Tastes exactly like how my mom would make it. The waffles and egg puffs here are also really crispy and fresh and the milk tea is exactly how I like it. Many boba places make their milk tea really sweet but at Kowloon Tong, their milk tea taste exactly like the ones you would get at a Hong Kong Chaa Chaan Tang.
author: Carmen L.

description:
I was pretty skeptical to coming here with a couple of friends after shopping downtown. We had to put our name down on a list because all the tables were full so we waited for about 10 minutes. 

I ended up ordering the honeydew sago while my friends ordered the eggettes style thing, some popcorn chicken, mochi balls with sesame inside, and mango sago. If you spend $20 and check yourself along with at least one friend in via facebook, you get free ice cream waffle sandwiches (a must try!). I requested green tea ice cream and it comes with 4 plump sliced waffles (usually $5-6). Everything was so delicious and honestly have no complaints. 

After reading other reviews on how service was slow, I wasn't expecting much. Boy was I wrong! The things we ordered were rolling in and all our food was out on the table within five minutes of ordering!

Typical desert place but it really needs more credit than given. Great prices and awesome vibe. See you there!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Come get high with me!

Sugar high that is   =D

SF doesn't have a whole lot of HK style dessert cafes to choose from, but Kowloon hits the mark with:

- their hot off the steamer egg puffs
- creamy ice cream sandwiched between crispy waffles
- ice cold HK milk tea that's not too sweet
- warm mango and sago dessert with coconut milk
- delish salt and pepper chicken wings!

This place is very casual, cheap and perfect for big groups like ours who came in on a random Sunday night looking to carb up before our very intense AND competitive bowling game. I'm sure I've forgotten to list all the other sweet things that we ordered (there were 20 of us who showed up) and our cost per person came up to -- ready for this? -- $11 including tip. YAY for cheap eats!

Oh and another tip: check in with the yelp app and spend $25 to get free ice cream waffle sandwich.
author: Janice C.

description:
Good place for dessert, almost always crowded, lots of variety for HK food/snacks/dessert. 
I recently got the watermelon juice and it was delicious. I usually order a super mango pudding cause it has ice cream, fruit, and mango pudding and I love all these things! :D No a big fan of their egg puffs or waffles though. But I do like that they have fun ice cream flavors like green tea and mango.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: Don't sleep on the mango sago albeit being classic and plain to most. Straight fuego considering the price :)
author: Emmu Z.

description: I used to go to this place often but when I last went, it was a horrible experience. My cousin and I came in with boba that we bought prior before coming to the restaurant. There was no sign saying that no outside food or drink was allowed so we thought it was okay. Then one for the wait staff came to our table and rudely asked us if we could leave or have them take our drinks. After we allowed them to take our drinks, the waiters were absolutely rude to us. They messed the two things we ordered which were so simple: popcorn chicken and waffles ice scream sandwich. The popcorn chicane was cold and small. The waffle ice cream sandwich had the wrong ice cream even after we told the waiter the ice cream we wanted twice. Even after we were finished we had to wait and ask for them to give back our drinks. I DO NOT recommend going here.
author: Sarah A.

description: So good, would told recommend the ice cream sandwich! You get free if you spent more than 35!
author: Lan T.

description:
Been here twice. Not that impressed. Prices are too high given the quality. Ingredients such as the grass jelly (涼粉) and glutinous rice balls (湯圓) taste like pre-made or even store bought. Fruits tastes like it came from a canned. 

For what they charge, one would expect much better quality ingredients.
author: Cheung L.

description:
I was doing some work nearby this past weekend. I came here Saturday and Sunday for a sweet treat after my meals. 

The quiet location is on 7th ave. and away from busy businesses of Asian friendly Clement St and high-traffic Geary Blvd.  I like that!

On Saturday, my debut and looking at the menu posted on the glass table, I had #63: the "Mo-mo Cha-cha". As some of the people who read my "quick tip", the name of the treat sounds hilarious. But the $3.50 sweet treat comprised of thick and sweet taro soup, pearls and red bean with a taste of citrus. As funny as the bowl sounds, the warm treat was seriously yummy! Saturday's treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=LCjUOLQu0RYZRUm-HcMWYw

From other yelpers, I was told that the Ice Cream Waffle sandwich is one of the café's top sellers. And that is what I took the following evening after my dinner. For $6.00, you get a choice of ice cream (I got vanilla) sandwiched in a pair of freshly made waffles. The huge treat is a simple bonehead sweet treat, but it was really yummy like yelpers aforesaid. Sunday's treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=YU2nxG9Ws54Z_hfQUgXJEA

If you check-in with your mobile-device, you will receive that Ice Cream Waffle sandwich treat for free with a purchase of $25.00. 

As affordable as many of the sweet and savory dishes, it is going to take a lot to obtain that free treat... unless you have a group of people.
author: Matt G.

description:
Saturday April 2, 2016 8:00 pm was in Kowloon Desert Cafe and ordered an Iced Coffee with Condensed Milk.  Should have been fast, easy, sweet, and delicious...but.  Using Starbucks coffee the drink should have been on the strong side but the drink I was given was extremely weak and was lacking enough condensed milk to actually sweeten the drink.

To add insult to injury, the guy working there was rude, indifferent and very unfriendly.  It took almost 20 minutes to get 2 Iced Coffees with Condensed Milk.  The staff there has no interest in delivering any resemblance of customer and has no business in any service oriented business.
author: Wayne G.

description:
Let me start by saying, this is nothing special in terms of asian dessert places in San Francisco - let's be real, they're all the same. That being said, I do enjoy the fact that this place at least looks different from the rest; it feels like they actually took time designing the layout of the place.

Anyways, me and a few friends stopped by around 1:30am (it closes at 2am) and I was surprised to see that it was still pretty packed. We were seated pretty quickly and  the first thing I noticed was that the menu looked exactly liked another asian dessert place I've been too. Okay, it didn't look exactly like it but the layout was pretty much the same. 

One of the workers came back shortly after w/ cups of tea for each of us and was eager to take our order. We weren't ready at this point, but he kindly told us that the kitchen would close at 2am on the dot and we should order before then. I'm not the type of person to keep him pass hours so I urged my friends to order ASAP. 

I ended up getting the mixed fruit sago w/ mango puree. It was good, the size was normal and the fruits were fresh and ripe. In fact, i'm really happy that the mango they used wasn't sour; I understand that it depends on the season, but i'm pretty sure that mango season has passed so props to them for using ripe mangoes in their desserts. 

It didn't even take very long for us to get our desserts. The workers were also very quick to refill our tea. Overall, expect to find good service, decent desserts and a lively community late at night.
author: Wiseley F.

description: Very bad  service !!! Looks like they dont want the business at all. I mean if u dont want to work there then quit your job ! Stop making customer unhappy!
author: Joe T.

description:
3/5 because some items are delicious, not all, and are mostly overpriced. However, they do get credit for having pretty authentic Hong Kong-style desserts that I can rarely find in the bay area, especially in the East Bay. I've been here several times so this is a cumulative review, and I choose to come back because of the HK desserts.

Highlights:

Super B-Kid Grass Jelly. It comes with grass jelly, mixed fruit and ice cream, along with other items I couldn't remember. But all together, this is my favorite dessert at this place because all the flavors work well with each other. But beware that there is shaved ice in it so be ready to be freezing cold after eating it.

Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich. This one I have always enjoyed because it combined two great things that I love, ice cream and waffle. It's delicious because the waffle is crispy, but not piping hot that the ice cream melts. You can choose different ice cream flavors that go inside the sandwich, I like vanilla mango or strawberry.

Anything mango. I really like mangoes, and if you do too, they make their mango desserts pretty well. I really like the one with the mango ice cream, mango slush, mango, with sago and coconut milk. It's just an explosion of delicious mango, as you can tell.

They have egg puffs here, but the last time I had it it wasn't crispy enough. I think it depends on the people making it. If they don't get the proportions of water to waffle batter right, it's not going to turn out well.

Others:

I went there the other day and had some of their hot desserts and got the black rice sago and taro sago and both were less than delicious. The sago was overcooked and both dishes had no flavor. 



I think it's best to stick with the cold desserts that are known to be good. I am not going to venture out and try other desserts here unless there are good reviews for them.
author: Stanley C.

description: The salt n' pepper thing is my love!!!!!! Best desert! ever!! The pork is juicy and the tofu is crispy!!
author: Jingwen L.

description: food's not bad but nothing spectacular. We ordered mostly set meals. Pasta wasn't seasoned. Desserts were really decent though
author: Edward Huang R.

description:
It's a decent Asian late night dessert place. Sometimes there's a line Friday night, about a 15 minute wait. Then again I usually come here with a party of 5 or 6. 

But they have a yelp check in offer that is valid every single time! Always great to get a free dessert for checking in and spending over $30. Parking is easy to find at night, soo difficult during the daytime. 

I usually order their original tofu fa - around $3.75. Or their steamed egg custard - also around $3.75. 

Service is slow though but I mean the cafe is usually packed.
author: Kayla O.

description:
I'm a bit of a self-proclaimed Asian dessert connoisseur, so I've been looking forward to trying some HK Dessert here. Although I gave a 3 star rating, it's probably more of a 2.5. 

-1 Experience: I came in on a Friday night with a party of 9. After seeing how busy it was, we asked to split the party into two to get accommodated quicker. The waiter split our party, but informed both tables we will be charged a 15% gratuity. REALLY?! We sat away from each other, not even interacting with one another and we were going to be charged a 15% gratuity. That immediately put everyone into a terrible mood. Although they ended up not charging us the gratuity, they still gave all of us a really bad first impression. 

-1 Food: We ordered egg puffs, glutinous rice balls with crunchy peanuts and several orders of their ice cream waffles sandwiches.  

The egg puffs were completely bland and a bit tough. Honestly, I could barely even taste the egg which is kind of the main component.. Sad to say I've had better egg puffs at Quickly's.. 

The glutinous rice balls had a great texture, but they were doused with too, too, too much brown sugar. 

The ice cream waffle sandwiches were the only thing that we all enjoyed. I didn't check Yelp beforehand, so I anticipated your conventional Belgian-sized waffle. Instead it was a pretty dense waffle, about half the thickness of an Eggo waffle. BUT... It was cooked to perfection; it wasn't hard and overcooked or undercooked and too soft. It was just right and its texture complimented the high quality ice cream really well. 

Overall, I probably won't come back unless I'm already in the area. I'll give this place a second chance just to try their Mango Sago, because apparently that's their specialty.
author: Jassmine Y.

description: Taste is good , service is bad. They missed my two food order. I think no tips anymore for the bad service.
author: Stephen W.

description: Don't be fooled by all the nice pictures on this page. I'm pretty sure I could go to a supermarket and buy all these things for $2 and it would taste better. The service was also horrible. My friend and I waited by the door for the longest time with stares from the servers the whole time. No tip
author: Jessica B.

description:
DO NOT PARK IN THE SMART AND FINAL PARKING LOT!!! your shit will get towed... just like mine did. lol. man, that was a really expensive dessert tab. :/

anyway, this place has been around for quite some time - longer than all the other dessert spots. and prices here are el cheapo! yes, the service is so-so, but what do you expect? only thing i hate... the waiting for a table part. they're usually super packed, but i guess it hasn't been as bad lately. 

why i like this spot? the menu... there are so many freaking items to choose from! they even have a deal going on! if you check-in through yelp or facebook, you can get a free banana split if you spend $25+. what a good deal, huh?

the thing i recommend... fried soya tofu... mMm... ok, i know this isn't a dessert, but they have so many yummy snacks to choose from! the cherng fun with xo sauce is also good, if they don't burn the cherng fun.

as far as desserts go, i ALWAYS for with my mango sago with mixed fruit. you really can't beat this. it's healthy and the fruit is always fresh! gawd... i want one now. 

BTW, CASH ONLY!
author: Ann T.

description:
Don't be fooled by the check in offer! You can only get the free waffle ice cream sandwich if you spend $30, which is really hard to do here considering how cheap everything is.

Regardless, I still recommend this place for their yummy waffle ice cream sandwiches! Their menu is extensive and complete with savory food, egg puffs, hot/cold desserts, and hot/cold drinks, but my bf and I were most intrigued by the banana waffle ice cream sandwich so we went with that.
