At only $6.50, it comes as 4 sandwiches filled with banana and two ice cream flavors of your choice. We chose green tea and strawberry, which were a lot better than we expected. The ice cream was really rich and flavorful; the waffle was not the freshest, but it was tasty. 

Overall, we were pretty satisfied with our dessert - it was the perfect amount for two people. Service could improve a bit - we had to flag down our waiter a couple times, but not a big deal.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
This is probably my go-to place for sago and other HK desserts. The quality, I think, has gone down over the years, but it still does the trick when I've got a craving for egg puffs or sago! The egg puffs are always good! Service really depends on who's working, but overall they're friendly.

What I usually get is mango or strawberry sago and the egg puffs. If I'm a little more hungry I'll get the rice noodle dish...i forget what it is called in english, but it comes in some sort of peanut sauce with hoisin and sriracha on the side.
author: Aaron Y.

description: Definitely the place to come to for your Chinese dessert fix. They have a large variety of desserts that are generally difficult to find in the East Bay.
author: Teresa C.

description:
I came here for some dessert after a long shopping day in the city :)

There weren't a crazy number of people, and you seat yourself. The waiter gave us menus and we ordered. 

We got: egg puffs, butter toast w/ condensed milk, almond paste, mango sago, and I think some egg custard.

Everything was okay, nothing was spectacular. The best part was that nothing was too sweet. Everything was pretty light. Our waiter was nice and we left with a sweet taste in our mouth (no pun intended). I'd come back if I were in the neighborhood, but it's nothing you go out of your way to get.
author: Thuy T.

description: Got their chicken wing ramen and mixed fruits sago. The chicken wings were delicious, hot, and crispy. The ramen was just your run of the mill instant ramen, so it's nothing to write home about. I wish the chicken wings were a little less oily, but it's nice that they give it to you on a separate plate. The mixed fruits sago was averagely good. Nothing to write home about as well. The service was okay. Typical service at a Chinese place so kind of on the bad side, but whatever. It was nice that we got tea though, especially since we came in on a cold, drizzling night.
author: Sandy K.

description: Delicious ice cream sandwiches but poor service. One time our sandwich took 30+ minutes to come out. That said, love the variety of creative desserts.
author: Shruti T.

description: This dessert cafe was SO worth the wait! They were  short staffed but everything was forgotten when you tasted the unique desserts! We can't wait to go back!
author: Tina T.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, large shop, closes late (1am on Thursday)
Cons: value of desserts

Coming at 11:30 pm, my friend and I got a table right away. I got my water and my friend, her tea and water. It took about five minutes for our desserts to come out. The mixed fruit sundae I got was alright. It consisted of a single scoop of vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate ice cream with whipped cream, peanuts and balls of watermelon, honeydew and sliced strawberries, mango, and I think pineapple as well. It was okay for a dessert but because of the size of the serving, I definitely don't see the worth equaling $5.95. Overall, the wait staff is nice and eating here was a good experience, though we did sit near the door and there were groups of people smoking outside and the wait staff did nothing about that with their door wide open.
author: Alex T.

description: Nice place, employee all are very friendly!! They have legit Hong Kong style desert. It is a nice to goto at the night time whether you feel hungry for some solid food or simply want some tasty desert.
author: James T.

description:
I come here for its convenience and the fact that they have asian snack foods and everytime I come I get excited only to be disappointed with what I expect.

I have gotten the sagos here and they are very bland in flavor and the fruits and not all that fresh. French fries here do come out piping hot which I like but once again it was bland but just ask for some salt & pepper and it will do the trick! I have also gotten a salt and hot pepper fried tofu here and my expectations was that it would be deep fried crunchy yumminess with a handful of jalapenos mixed in but instead it was somewhat sweet in honey and had garlic on it which we improvised and used all its garlic and onions as a mix for the fries to make our own garlic fries. 

All in all it isn't bad nor is it the priciest but I come here often for the reason of its convience and it is open late.
author: Angela S.

description:
The place is supposed to open at 3pm, no one was here so we left to buy crocery and came back at 3:15pm. There are 4 tables ahead of us. 

By 3:40pm, the only waitress took our order. By now, there are 9 tables.

It was a rainy cold day and I really wanted some desert so we stayed.

4:20 pm, the first item ordered is served. Its supposed to be walnut PASTE, not soup. $4.75 for this ?

Worst thing was: the woman works there was like : what ? It's coming !

Anyone DARE to come here ?
author: Melody L.

description:
This is the first Chinese restaurant I have been to in SF that passes my "authenticity" standards. I honestly thought I had teleported back home while I was here. Or defied the time-space continuum to travel back to my childhood.

I grew up in little Hong Kong and let me tell you: There ain't nothing like Hong Kong afternoon tea fare. I used to dislike it as a kid because I found the mix of Western and Eastern foods confusing and bizarre. Now that I am older and understand geopolitics much more (which is fancy-speak for "I read The Economist from time to time"), I appreciate how perfectly the culinary fusion represents Hong Kong's rich, diverse history. 

Perusing the menu at Kowloon Tong, I came across old favorites like curry fish balls, macaroni noodle soup, fried spaghetti and "chicken egg pastry", which the menu translates as "egg puff". My friends and I only came for dessert, so we ordered the aforementioned puff, taro in coconut milk soup and ginger milk curd. The puff was very good--clearly freshly made--but could have been slightly sweeter. The taro in coconut soup is my favorite of the Chinese "dessert soups" and Kowloon Tong's version was very good. If I had to say one critical thing, it would be that it was a tad watery, which softened the pearls more than I like them to be. The ginger milk curd, though, was absolute perfection--and I am not normally a ginger fan.

Service was stellar: Fast and friendly while still being attentive. We were fortunate to get here right before the weekend crowd hit. Within 5 minutes of placing our orders, the cafe had filled up and crowds of people were standing outside in the chilly night patiently awaiting their turn. At prices that are comparable to McDonald's, you really have no excuse not to check this place out. I definitely plan on coming back for a full meal.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I went here for some late night dessert. I ordered the mango sago and the eggetts. The mango sago was good and it had a lot of large mango pieces. It was also very creamy. The eggetts were nice and crispy. The free cups of tea was very bland with no taste. 

Service was a little slow but the place was completely packed.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Perhaps one of the best HK-style cafes for authentic HK-style desserts. Though I've only trekked here a couple times, I can easily say that this place has mastered a majority of the signature beloved desserts unique to Hong Kong.

MANGO GO GO [MANGO GI GI] ($4.95): Best rendition of the mango sago dessert, hands down. Not overly sweet; Thick and dense liquid dessert, almost like an indulgent soup; Dessert contained mango cubes, pomelo shreds, sago, mango juice/puree, and coconut milk. Probably the closest match to the quality found at cafes in Hong Kong; Highly recommended

MANGO JUICE ($3.25): Fresh mangoes were clearly used; Not really the thick milkshake consistency since it is fruit juice; Unsure of whether the extra tad of sweetness came naturally from mangoes or was added with syrup; Good nonetheless

EGG PUFFS ($3): A-OK; Taste was okay though could have had more eggy flavor and a bit more sweetness; Texture was okay though it should have had crunchy exterior and chewy interior; Skipworthy

HK STYLE MILK TEA ($2.50): Didn't have this but my folk enjoyed it; Not overly sweet in the least bit (hotter tends to have less sugar); Strong tea taste; Good temperature control

COCONUT MILK STEAMED EGG PUDDING [DUN NAI] ($4.50): Made on the spot - Came out hot and fresh; Thick and creamy texture

SERVICE: What do you expect? Asian place will come with asian service and occasionally with an attitude. In other words, rude, ignorant, and tense service. Somehow, they didn't exactly exhibit any of these traits in particular though they didn't give us great service. 

DECOR: A run-down yet somewhat modern  place. Feels like a pho noodle shop. Lots of seating.

Kowloon Tong is definitely a good candidate for HK-style desserts and will satisfy all your HK-style dessert needs, sweet tooth's, and cravings. First timers deserve to experience this wonderful eatery if they really enjoy HK-style delicacies like I do. Just order right and you'll have a good experience!
author: Jacquie H.

description:
The mixed fruit tasted OK.
When the check comes, they put a lot of unordered orders into our check.
So, be careful out there people!
author: Clive I.

description:
Definitely a place to go to for late night munchies. They're open late and offer free desserts if you check in on Facebook or Yelp. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free banana split ice cream waffle sandwich with a purchase of $30 or more. On Facebook, you get a free ice cream waffle sandwich with a purchase of $25. My boyfriend lives close by so he is always going there and said they originally had it with a $20 purchase on Facebook. 

This place is always busy and there can be a long wait depending on when you are coming. It also takes a while for the food to come out but I would assume because they are so busy. The waiters/waitress are always running around like mad so it gets pretty busy. 

I've had their ice cream waffle sandwich, egg puffs, and sweet red bean soup (served hot). All of them are delicious. My boyfriend likes to order the fried chicken and fries and says it's totally worth it for the price you pay. The ramen must be decent also because my friends are always ordering it when we come here. They also give you unlimited green tea! You just have to get the waiters attention to get your refills.
author: Cathie N.

description:
I've never had a bad experience here before until now. I arrived with my best friend and they sat us down pretty quickly and took our orders. There were two large parties of maybe 6-7 each that came after us. 

They gave us tea which was the usual, and our mango sago(which is extremely delicious) came maybe 10 minutes later. After awhile I started noticing that so many plates of food were coming out so quickly to the larger parties. I thought where's our food?? 

We only ordered two milk teas - 1 hot, 1 cold, a mango sago, and a strawberry sweet sticky rice. The sticky rice was watered down and we had to ask for the hot milk tea... I tried to give them benefit of the doubt cause I've been here numerous times before. Turns out THE WAITER FORGOT and pretty much made it in front of us with the quickness and without much care to it.. "Excuse me we ordered a hot milk tea" "...oh" ...??? OKAYY. You could tell without having to see him make it that he didn't really care cause it was bitter af. 

I'm just pissed cause how can you tend to 12-13 people that came after a two person table? ...who didn't even order that much?

If you ever get the really tall waiter good luck because he had a little sass to his tone of voice, and he sucked at remembering our order.

I give 1 star cause at least the mango sago stayed consistent throughout my visits here, and the other for the sweet lady working her ass off making the orders behind the counter.
author: Agnes L.

description: Don't really like the desserts here. Ordered the red bean soup, mango sago and a few other desserts. They were all too bland and tasty at all. The mango sago doesn't have enough mango and sago. The red bean soup tasted very diluted also.
author: Qianqi L.

description:
Kowloon Tong is deserving of 4 stars solely because it hits the spot on a cold SF night.

-Menu is plentiful in its offerings: cold/hot drinks, cold/hot desserts, savory dishes, etc. I don't think I've ever ordered the same thing twice.
-Egg puffs are made fresh, so it may take a while to get to you.
-Your server brings you tea as soon as you are seated. They will try to refill your mug when they can, but it gets really busy in there after dinner time.
-Servers SMILE at you and do not rush you with the check just so they can seat a waiting party...do you know how rare this is for an Asian establishment?
-Parking can be rough, but if you get there while everyone else is still at dinner, you should be fine. 
-Prices are comparable to the other Asian dessert places in the city.
-CASH ONLY.
author: Olivia V.

description:
I've always wanted to come here and I finally did lastnight.

I've always been intrigued by asian desserts. Mainly anything with sticky rice, glutinous rice balls***, coconut milk and fresh mango.

We ordered:
-Fresh Mango Sago with Glutinous Rice Balls 5/5
-Sweet Red Bean Soup (hot) 4/5
-Egg Puffs 1/5 very dry and a bit flavorless
-Nutella & Condensed Milk Toast 4/5 the toast was a bit on the thicker side.

The service was okay. Our server was a bit distracted here and there due to all of the patrons coming in. This place gets pretty packed. 

Next time I do want to try there savory menu items.
author: Cat L.

description:
Boo! We had the sago with coconut milk but it was watered down so much there was no flavor at all. Tofu was crispy but the amount of sauce was enough for just a few bites. 

We had high hopes for this place but were sadly disappointed. I'd stick to the ice cream and waffles...things they can't cut corners on.
author: Xiao-long B.

description:
one of the few places that has authentic shave ice - Taiwanese/HK style. Not the shave ice with colored sugar water, but the kind with fruit, condense milk, red bean, grass jelly, whatever you want to put on it.

we got it with fresh fruit and the mango in it was FRESH and delicious. kids loved the waffle ice cream sandwich.

black sesame filled mocha in ginger sugar soup. perfect.

saw some waffles with round bubbles on them? gotta try that next time.
author: Sophia Y.

description: A lot of the foods here are really delicious- cheap too! But the service is AWFUL. Do not come here if you're short on time. Every item comes at a different time, takes at least 20 minutes to get the check and at least 30 to get food. I like the food so I keep coming back but my goodness.. the wait time.
author: Michaela R.

description: Deceptive advertising. The free ice cream sandwich is only after a $40 purchase. Horrendous prices for everything.
author: Markus S.

description:
From the last few reviews, it really looks like im whoring out my 5 star ratings. But its actually pretty hard to earn 5 stars in my book. However, Kowloon Tong deserves every bit of the 5 star because this is THE BEST DESSERT PLACE IN S.F.!

What makes this place the greatest is the workers there. I'm not sure of their schedule, but if you go saturday night (busy time so expect a short wait!), you can catch both Alvin and Brandon working. They're funny, polite, and nice and they make your hong kong dessert experience so much more enjoyable.

This is a dessert place, but they have other hot/snacky food too. Here is what i think

BUENO!
(1) Spam w/ egg Spicy Instant Noodle
Many of you probably think you guys could make this yourself at home. And you're probably right, but that doesn't mean its not delicious!

(2) Fried Chicken Wing
They do this really good here. Its super hot and they don't have super bready crusts so every bite is just skin and meat. What i like to do best is line a streak of ketchup on the wing for each bite.

(3) Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich
Hot crunchy surface first, and then you start biting into the cold, soft and sweet part of the ice cream. It numbs your teeth a bit, but its worth it. Butter on waffles make it a breakfast, but ice cream on it makes it an irresistable dessert.

NO BUENO!
(1) Milk Tea
I'm not a fan of their milk tea, because its not sweet enough i think. But people always get it so I guess its just me.

If you live in the San Francisco area, you most def. have to give this place a visit. It opens late so its a good place to go if you're chilling with your friends at 11 and have no where to go. After one time, you're bound to be a regular
author: Ringo M.

description:
Short Story:
A okay dessert place for an after hours hangout.

Long Story:
I came here with a few friends around midnight and the place was about 50% full.  It got more crowded as the night drew on.  I ordered the pork and chicken rice plate.  Man, a large portion of the pork was just fat and the chicken was super salty.  I guess you really can't expect quality food from these types of places.  Though even after factoring that in, I felt they could do a better job.

The service was below average.  Although they were busy, it took too long to get service.  The decor and ambiance was pretty standard for places like this, so nothing to write home about.

Verdict:
I'll come back if I need to...but won't be going out of my way to do that.
author: Michael W.

description: Good service, lots of people so a longer wait, but if you're in there to chat that's fine since it's a relaxing atmosphere. the Ice was ok.. but maybe because of the number of people it was rather clumpy and had too much condensed milk. the ice cream with eggets was good
author: C L.

description:
I only come here because friends wants to come. This place tends to fill up with locals and teens. Parking because of the neighborhood is really bad. And even find a seat inside can get bad. The larger the group the longer the wait. 

The service is pretty bad. They will get the first cup of water down, but refilling it is the problem. And when ordering more than 6 plates, they will always forget one. 

There is no flavor to the food. It looks OK and taste like it came out of a can. It is for people who wants to just get out of the house.
author: M C.

description:
Me and my friends came here kinda drunk after a concert. 
We ordered Mix fruit sago, mango gogo, super mango, strawberry sticky rice,  icecream waffle sandwich and noodles. 
I had curry fish balls udon. I didn't like the udon noodles that much because  the noodles were a bit too soft, but since I was drunk and hungry it was okey to eat. Curry fish balls were good tho. 
I like how their dessert isn't too sweet and has a lot of fruits in it.
The ice cream waffle sandwich is reallly good! The waffle is very krispy and they put a lot of icecream in it. I suggest sharing the ice cream waffle among 3-4 ppl.
author: Pinhwa S.

description: I like that this cafe is open late and the prices are very reasonable. I got an ice cream waffle sandwich in my moment of confusion. I don't like soggy waffles so I basically had to inhale the pieces. They were good!
author: Danielle C.

description: This place is a great stop for late night bites and desserts. They offer a variety of savory dishes such as calamari, fries, and ramen (instant by the way) in addition to an even larger variety of desserts. For those who are craving some decadent items, the Nutella waffle ice cream sandwich is delicious. On the other hand, lighter desserts such as the grass jelly served with fruit and a small scoop of ice cream are my go to. Couldn't give it 5 stars due to issues with service, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. Street parking can be scarce when it's busy and there are a lot of people inside this place late at night.
author: Brandon N.

description:
If you're looking for a place for dessert, this spot is ok.
Parking is limited, well, you know Geary Blvd. Food is acceptable overall. Tortoise Jelly and Chicken wings are my favs. However, don't try Grilled squid here, it is underperforming and not worth it.  I bet they had to grilled it overtime to guarantee the American safety standard, but it's not tasty anymore. 
They take credit cards.
author: Phuong P.

description: Vion was a very nice server/waitress. She was very polite and kind. She was very patient with our orders. I don't think I would have wanted anyone else as my server. She was very fast and hard woeki
author: Danny L.

description: The grilled chicken noodle soup tastes like shit, and the taro sago is basically coconut sago with hot taro sauce, kinda nasty. I also ordered a shark fin soup which was supposed to be have a lot of things in it, but what I got was a bowl of mushrooms! Feels like I'll never go there again!
author: Toby Z.

description:
This is a decent spot if you're craving late-night Asian dessert (e.g., mango sago, sesame glutinous balls, egg waffles). But compared to legit dessert places in HK (Honeymoon Dessert, Hui Lao Shan), it doesn't really match up :( 

As expected, this place gets quite packed after 9PM, but we didn't have to wait too long. The waiters seemed pretty frazzled trying to service all the tables, but the food came pretty quickly. On the bright side, they have a lot of options and "make-it-yourself" combinations. I usually get the mango sago with black glutinous rice. Sadly, it's a pretty small bowl and the flavor of the coconut milk is strange. One of my friends ordered the tortoise jelly, which tasted very diluted and was drowned in condensed milk. Overall, the portions and quality are not worth the price, but I will make due until I return to HK..
author: Leslie C.

description:
The food and desserts here are pretty yummy. 

I like their ice cream waffle sandwiches.
 
Their deep fried chicken and fries are tasty too.

Their tofu fa is okay, I'm not a very big fan of it due to the fact that its not very smooth and  its not very yummy because instead of syrup they put sugar on top of it.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Came in around 10:30 and it was completely packed, but it started to clear up around 11. We were seated after a few minutes, were given two teas and ordered the mango sago, red bean shaved ice, and chicken wings. The mango sago was sweet, just how I like it, with huge mango chunks and pretty much all sago mixed with coconut milk and mango juice. However, the red bean shaved ice was more like ice from a snow cone and didn't have much flavor. But when it melted into the condensed milk it was a little bit better. After that we were craving some more filling food so we decided to get the chicken wings which came with five pieces and lots of garlic, green onions, and peppers. It wasn't very spicy and all the toppings made it pretty tasty. 
Apparently you can also reserve a table if you wish, since I saw a sign, but I'm not sure exactly how that works. There are also some cute Asian coin machines where you can get some toys in the corner. I would suggest this place for a casual date with your significant other or some friends.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: parking can take a few minutes to find but is normally easy. No wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: clean. Nothing fancy. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: pretty good desserts. The food is surprising not bad considering that you're at a dessert place. Ice cream waffle sandwiches are good. 

_____

Overall Experience
4/5 Stars 


_____

Last Words
I like this place.
author: Elliott N.

description:
Sesame filled glutinous balls - the sesame is more bitter than sweet, seems expired.

Sweet sticky rice and sago with coconut milk - it's of watery consistency and more sago than anything else 

The tea taste like detergent.

I'm done with this place.
author: Catalina C.

description:
Great dessert selection for a reasonable price. They serve complementary tea but he service could be better.   
Food doesn't come out together when in a group, which means you may be waiting for the rest to arrive while your desert begins to melt... 

You also have to waive down waiters just to make an order or get the check. 
But the dessert is great!
author: Laura D.

description: I recently went to this place to purchase the green bean dessert to go (look dau sa). There was not a single customer in the place around 2:30 pm or so. I waited about 10 mins. for my order. I don't know why it took that long since they basically just reheat it back up. It was a very small plastic container which cost about $6.50. It just tasted ok - nothing to write home about. I wasted my money. Rip off. I will not be coming back to this place again.
author: Karen C.

description: This used to be the only Hong Kong Dessert place in the city.. And when i mean used to be I mean over 10 years ago, ok maybe over 15. I remember coming here when i was in High school, (don't bother calculating my age) . Over the years I felt this place was going down hill and more and more Hong Kong dessert places started to pop up around the bay.  I would admit i haven' been here in over a long long period of time, so i hesitated  to try this place again. I can see that the ownership has changed  and that the servers are so much nicer now.  I usually get the Momo Chacaha which is a hot dessert with taro, beans, and sago.  I also like the steamed milk custard with ginger. My friends usually get the chicken wings here, and they love it.  There is usually a wait here for a table so be prepared to shiver outside in the cold
author: Belinda C.

description:
Egg Puffs - No flavor.
Rice Noodles - worst than dim sum rice noodles
Sesame/Almond paste - watered down.
Sesame glutinous balls with cracked peanuts - doughy

My Verdict: I do not recommend.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Soy sauce chicken wings were BOMB. Mango go-go was yummy. Black sesame rice balls in ginger soup was not the best that I've had but good. I would love to come back again and journey through their menu more.

The service was fast and he was attentive. 

The ambience was really casual and EXACTLY what I wanted in a HK style cafe (snacks and dessert). I felt super comfortable and at home. It's a place that I'd like to return to.
author: Lillian Y.

description: I don't remember how many times that I come here with my group of friends. This is my favorite dessert place in San Francisco. They are open late around 1am and 2am. There has alot of delicious dessert but I can't eat all at the same time. I always recommend my friends to come here and yeah they always satisfaction. And don't forget that check-ins yelp to have free ice-cream sandwich when your order above $35.
author: Travis N.

description: This place is amazing! Came here late night with my friends and this place has everything that you could possibly be craving for! I ordered the spicy ramen noodles with fried chicken wings. The portion was just the right amount. The taste of the ramen and chicken wings were just right too; not too spicy, not bland, not salty, and perfectly crispy. I usually go to restaurants that serve too much for what I can actually finish, then I feel bad for wasting food. The waiter was awesome too! He checked up on us periodically and was so nice. I will come back soon for their desserts!
author: Christina C.

description:
My absolute favorite dessert here is the ice cream waffle sandwiches.  DROOL!  I think the reason for the average reviews is the service... it really does suck.  They have terrible service.  But they have a decent variety of desserts and fruit options.  I always go to this place when I have cravings for the ice cream waffle sandwiches.  They also have a waffle sundae that my family usually likes to order and share together.

There's almost always a line if you head there past dinner time so plan accordingly.  There's also little to no parking so its usually only locals who are visiting or the lucky or unlucky few that spend a significant amount of time circling for a parking spot.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Cheap prices, nothing too amazing, but snacks are solid.

Egg Waffle/Bubble Waffle:  This was really good!  The inside had the good eggy consistency with a crunchy outside.  I wish they offered fillings, that would really bump it up.

Curry Fishballs:  Tasty, it's fine!  I used the curry as dipping for my Tofu.

Fried Tofu:  Really nicely fried with a soft center.  Came with a really weak soy sauce, and some XO sauce.

Sago + Black Rice + Coconut Milk:  This was a huge disappointment because the coconut milk was SUPER weak.  It didn't have much sugar or texture.  When I want coconut milk on my sago, I want the thick, creamy and sweet kind.  This was like watered down skim milk.

Strawberry Juice:  Nice and fresh!~

Tortoise Jelly:  Strange filmy top, bitter in a bitter kind of a way, not in the herbal way.  Not bad though :)
author: Alice S.

description:
There are so many options here that it's hard for me to decide what I want.  Something cold?  Something hot?  How about one of each?  And maybe another one, too.  Oh...and that, and that, and I must have that, too.  :)

I love that they serve snacks like they would from a night market in Hong Kong.  We got the curry fish balls (a little bit too sweet for my liking, but I still ate them!), the sesame rice rolls (first time having them, the more I ate, the more I liked the dish.  Try it!)  and the popcorn chicken...which were really just chicken nuggets cut up and deep fried.  I would skip the latter, but try everything else.  

For dessert, we ordered the tofu pudding with almond and taro sago.  Both were delicious. 

Would be making another trip back here in the future!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Quaint late-night dessert joint with relatively easy parking and above average Asian desserts. Even though Kowloon was second choice, it turned out to be a great place to sit down and chat-up with friends. We waited for 10 minutes for a table of six.

Sadly, if you check-in on Yelp you only get the free waffle ice cream sandwich if you order $30+. But if you check-in on Facebook the free treat comes no strings attached. We ordered the spam egg sandwich, salt and pepper chicken wings, mango puree, and iced coffee milk tea x2. Nothing life-changing but good solid dishes. The waffle vanilla ice cream sandwich on the other hand was absolutely delicious.

What I recommend: 
-- check-in for a free ice cream waffle sandwich
author: Andrew W.

description:
They messed up our noodle order three times and almost gave us two of the same order. LOL. It was a total of seven of us and combined, we were able to get free waffle ice cream sammies! 

The red bean sago with black rice is more watery that expected. I thought it would be like the coconut milk and black rice dessert at Golden Island, but it was nothing like that. Satisfying anyway, but I'm not picky about my food. 

The manager is nice :) We also found parking right outside of the cafe easily.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Pretty neat place serving Hong Kong style desserts. The menu has a lot of traditional dessert items and has snacks/food you will find in a HK cafe. We ordered the egg and milk custard and they were pretty good! It takes 15 min but it was worth it. Better than Golden Island in Sunset. Service was mediocre. They forgot to put in our order for egg puffs and so we didn't get to try it. 

The Yelp offer is for orders over $30.
author: Tina S.

description:
When you walk into a place and see "super mango pudding", you gotta get it.

When you see that you get a free ice cream waffle banana split sandwich with $30 purchase, you gotta spend $30.

When you walk into a place rated 3.5 stars but is  packed at 10pm on a Friday night, you try it.

Pretty much everything that we ordered here was solid, and they have something for every mood. Sago, egg puffs, waffle/ice cream sandwiches, sesame ball tang yuan, etc.

I can't vouch for the food, but the desserts are definitely the way to go if you're in the area!
author: Andrew C.

description: We waited for a long time for a very simple order, think they messed up the order but made one after our reminder. There was no apology for the long wait & seems like they did not care. Don't think I'll visit again.
author: Yang D.

description: Slow service..... How does a cantaloupe shake take longer than a freakin ice cream waffle like don't you just blend the cantaloupe with freakin milk and freakin ice cream and like ice like hello.... 10 years later.... No cantaloupe shake....and when it came to me it taste like freakin milk. Gross, just plain disgusting.
author: Francis D.

description: Great place. Reasonable combo prize. Taste almost as same as I was eating in hong kong. Love he instant noodle and desserts :)
author: Orient N.

description: Classic hangout, just like the ones tucked in my memories of old Hong Kong - before the return to the Chairman. Lots of old favorites, too many to personally reminisce in a single visit.  Mo Duc Tan!
author: Jackie C.

description:
First visit here, been wanting to come here for dessert for a long time.....after such an exhausting day at work, we drove over this evening to enjoy some traditional Chinese goodies.....

We ordered egg puffs, very very good......

Mango pudding....with fresh mango chuncks and condensed milk.......

Mango pudding fresh fruits, with strawberries, melon, and mangos.......

Little peanut balls.....white soft mochi like with peanuts......

Chicken wings and rice.....canned veggies....just ok, but all of the above were excellent.......

Very crowded, place was packed with all younger folks, we felt like elderly there....

If you check in on YELP, you get a free waffle and ice cream, that is 2 full size waffles cut in 1/4's and then stuffed with ice cream, we got it, but had to return it, was too full too even attempt to try it......
author: Leslie Y.

description:
Back again! I decided again with the egg waffles and the B-Kid Grass Jelly.

The complimentary tea they serve is perfect for the cool SF nights, the B-Kid Grass Jelly was interesting. It had melon balls, fresh fruit, condensed milk on top of grass jelly. For some reason I felt like it needed a little shaved ice or something, whatevaaa.

My friend's got the Waffle Sundae, Waffle Ice Cream Sandwiches and the Instant noodles with Luncheon meat with Egg and mann did they all look so delicious. At least they're honest, I'll be sure to try something different every time I'm back.

Wonderful place and the servers are always so nice, minus the gawking eyes of the other customers ... srsly is there something on my face? No ... it's an Asian thing- ma' bad.
author: Janet N.

description:
Came here for the first time on a late night with a party of four.  I wanted to order the rice crepe dish thanks to the tempting photos from Yelp, but unfortunately, they ran out so I opted for the fried tofu as recommended.  I will say please pass on that dish.  These fried tofus came in small cubes with two type of sauces, one is hoisin sauce (thank goodness for this sauce otherwise those tofus will be much more difficult to swallow) and another bland dark sauce.  The tofus had a different texture, more crispy on the outside then soft and bland.

One of my friends ordered the pan fried noodles which seemed amazing next to my dish, but overall it was just ok.  The other two friends rated the soup noodles ok as well.  One of them also ordered the mango dessert (because she saw a youtuber once ate it lol), and she regreted doing that. 

This seems to be those types of late night restaurants that ones will appreciate and wouldn't mind during those desperate times past midnight. I might come back in attempt to try the rice crepe!
author: Nel L.

description:
This place is so yummy. Try everything you can and for sure order the Waffle Ice Cream Sandwich. You can get more than one flavor in it (strawberry and vanilla). Come in a group so you can share things, but not too big of a group or you might not get seated promptly.

This is an ideal spot to end the night since it's open late. I came here right after going to Spices II--pretty good idea since my mouth/stomach was burning from all the spicy food.
author: Marlon T.

description:
The menu looks almost identical to Dessert Republic in San Mateo, except DR decided (probably after copying KT) to add noodle bowls and rice plates to their menu to kick things up a notch (including buttons table side to signal waiters for specific commands).

Unfortunately this is yet another MEHtacular HK dessert shop in the 2.75 range. Not impressive, but not so bad that it is horrible.

KT, DR, and many other one size fits all dessert shops fall more or less into the same trap....variety trumps quality. In Hong Kong such shops exist that also range in quality, but the really good places would focus on no more than a few items, and do them repeatedly since the dawn of time (like Jiro Ono with his sooosheee) while maintaining consistency. It is very hard to nail down everything in an establishment like this, and even achieving proper 50% coverage would be considered lofty expectations.

With a menu this broad, it has to be believed (for the faithful) that there has got to be some zubic zirconians in the rough in a pile of rocks. Unfortunately I ended up with more rocks than pseudo gems.

Mango juice - they weren't kidding, freshly "squeezed" mangoes. Super cold even though they claimed they didn't use ice, but it was nice and thick and didn't taste diluted, and it wasn't sweetened either. Saw lots of boxes of fresh yellow "Manila style" mangoes in the back corner, so this shop at least uses the real deal. The biggest difference again is that anything mango tastes so much better in Hong Kong because they import premium mangoes from the Philippines. This is another reason why HK dessert shops here that serve mango based offerings will never reach the quality and taste...unless perhaps they use the seasonal organic mangoes grown in Indio (California) that is only available for a very short time each year that is truly excellent. The effort at least has to be appreciated, vs using canned mango pulp.

Eggettes/egg puffs (gai daan jai) - Looks decent, but is missing the luster and shiny gold color that would have improved this. Crunchy, and texture is not bad even on the inside, but hardly any egg flavor.

Steamed rice rolls (ju cherng fun) - rolled up ho fun, kind of like Vietnamese banh cuon...well they don't make them in house for sure. A bit oversteamed, and the three kinds of sauces were not so interesting. No chili sauce. And worst of all, I ate it with a fork. DR at least goes the extra mile to provide skewer sticks (like giant long toothpicks) to replicate the HK pushcart / street experience.

Iced HK milk tea - uninteresting, not some multi leaf blend and tea lacked robustness and depth. Similar to maybe Golden Island Cafe version.

The good thing is that KT takes credit cards. Although cashier at first credit card swipe attempt said my card didn't work, and asked for another (either another card, or indirectly hinting at cash payment). I asked her to try again and it worked. Persistence is everything. I looked around, and didn't see the credit card minimum sign (like how that is hidden at HK Lounge 2).
author: Ken K.

description:
Awesome hours and different cheap snacks. 

Service isnt the fastest but you're here to just kind of relax and hangout anyway right?
author: Peter M.

description: Love this place. Good place to hang out with friends. Not the best quality of all food selection. There are a few good things here. The desserts and the fried wings are good. They do certain hong kong dishes that no one else has. Fried rice crepes with peanut sauce. These are great snacks during the middle of the night. Miss this place a lot.
author: Tony G.

description:
I always come here for a late night dessert with friends..but nothing really stands out to me here.  I had the mango pudding which only had a hint of mango taste! Do not get the Shaved ice because it just tastes like gross ice. 

I like their chicken wings, but that's because you can't go wrong with chicken wings unless you burn it.

The best thing they have is the free waffle ice cream sandwich when you check-in. Get mango ice cream with that! Its yummy!
author: Emi K.

description:
This is my go-to dessert place. They give you a free ice cream waffle sandwich if you order over $30 so my friend and I (2 ppl) always gorged ourselves till we reached $30 dollars. We achieved this with 1 drink each, 1 hot dessert each, and noodle dish each.

-sticky rice with coconut milk-hot (5 stars)--I really love the black sticky rice. It has a mild sweet flavor to it.
-red bean ice drink (4 stars)--average flavor. No complaints or anything to really rave about.
-macaroni noodle with spam, egg, and curry fish balls (3.5 stars)-- without the curry balls,  I feel the broth is a little bland, but when you stick the fish balls in, the curry flavor really permeates throughout the entire dish.
-ice cream sandwich (5 stars)--this is the dessert we aim for every single night. You can mix and match flavors which is a plus. So far we've tried, chocolate, vanilla, mango, strawberry, and green tea. My favorite? Mango :P
author: Geraldine C.

description: The desserts are amazingly good. I definitely recommend getting the mango sago and ice cream sandwiches. Kowloon is definitely my favorite place to go late at night with friends. The only thing is that the food can be a bit pricey; but overall, great dessert place to go with friends.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Came here with a group of 4 after dinner (~9PM), and this place was quite full, we had a short wait before we got seated. 

We got the mango sago, ice cream waffle sandwich, egg puffs, HK milk tea, and a watermelon juice. Generally, I don't like to eat desserts that are too sweet, but I felt that the mango sago could've been a little sweeter. Other than the mango the sago didn't have much other taste to it, which was a bummer, I feel like if it was just a bit sweeter it could've been much better. The ice cream waffles were nice, but then again it ain't that hard to make some good ice cream waffles. The egg puffs on the other hand were fantastic, it was crispy on the outside, chewy and soft on the inside. I think these were the most delicious egg puffs i've had in a long time.

Personally, I didn't get the watermelon juice or the HK milk tea, but I heard that both were quite good. Overall, this place is quite decent, and I've yet to find another dessert cafe nearby. Until then if i'm feeling up for a late night dessert session I'll definitely be giving this place a look.
author: David C.

description: What I love about this place is that they open late.  And if you check in you'll get a free ice cream sandwich (not sure if they still do it)!  I've been here for several years now and it always satisfy my late night cravings.  I'm usually here for their desserts, the ice cream waffle sandwich and eggpuffs are always a good choice.  It can get pretty pack at night, but the wait is pretty fast.
author: Len L.

description: Desserts were good, service verrrry slow, ONE guy working the counter, ONE guy in the back.
author: Lisa W.

description: Workers are so friendly. Once you go there often, they will treat you as friends and get to know you more. The food was great. The late hours were nice for those, like myself, who stay out late and want a hangout spot with food.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
This review is mainly for the Ice Cream Waffles! I usually come here with my friends late at night, so by the time we get there the wait is usually a good 10-15+ minutes. It takes some time to get seated and served, but it is understandable due to the amount of others that are there. 

The ice cream waffles are bomb! Make sure to ask what flavors they have if you don't know what they offer already; you can always get more than one! For the price of the ice cream waffles, the portion is huge. Unless I am super hungry still, I usually never finish it. 

If you are going with a somewhat large group, make sure to check-in for the free ice cream waffle deal!
author: Brian T.

description:
I tasted home when the red bean soup hit my taste buds. They serve some real good quality desserts! We also ordered egg puffs and the steamed papaya with white fungus. They were great! 

We got in around 9pm? And then it started to get really crowded. REMEMBER TO WRITE YOUR NAME ON THE TINY WHITE BOARD WHILE YOU WAIT IN LINE! 

Yummy food!
author: Jessie C.

description: Black Sesame and almond hot dessert is good.  Popcorn chicken tastes dry and with lots of flour.   Milkshake tastes like ice cream with milk.
author: Stanley L.

description:
It's really nice that they offer a free waffle sandwich but it's not worth it to really try to spend $25 here. 
Popcorn chicken--a lot of the popcorns are just chunks of batter. Pieces are tiny.
Milk tea is watery.
Entrees are very greasy.
Not sure why it's so hyped up, servers are always too busy to give you adequate attention :/
Would rather go to Naya cafe.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Waffle sundae was ok..the waffle was cold! sad...the ice cream wasn't great..it's like watered down cheap ice cream..the only thing that was good was the chocolate..it comes in strawberry, vanilla, chocolate with cream and nuts and drizzle of fudge..along with like 4-6 slices of waffle..

then the waffle ice cream sandwich..these were big..for some reason the vanilla ice cream had more flavor in these...it was ok..since the waffle weren't warm..

the super mango pudding..the ice cream taste nothing like mango..more like iono something else..cantalope..the pudding wasn't sweet..it's like they left the sugar out..the fruits..eh..weren't sweet either..

i'll try the hk style waffle and egg puff next time..i think they make the egg puffs on the spot..so it should be warm..

location is ok..overall service is nice..free hot tea..and they close late..
author: Minerva L.

description:
not that great. especially for the wait and service. i don't think it's "cheap" either. 

and there was a girl sitting with a small dog. 
ya this place let animals in. 

grosssssss
author: A O.

description:
After returning from my study abroad program in Hong Kong, I was going through some major HK withdrawal. I especially missed the food and desserts. So when my friend told me about Kowloon Tong Dessert Cafe, we were dying to try it. 

It was a long ride to KTDC but when my friends and I got here, it was a bit disappointing because there wasn't a lot of people there. It was about 7pm. But we were on a dessert mission so we started going crazy with the menu. We decided to order the egg waffle, the steamed rice crepe, coconut milk taro sago, and the banana split waffle sandwich. BUT then one of my friends spotted the check-in deal.

We added up our 4 dishes and it totaled to be about $17 so we all agreed that we should order one more dish to get our FREE ice cream waffle (because we just needed to check-in and tag a friend on FB to get the deal). And that is what we did. We ordered a red bean soup with peanut filled glutinous balls (I really wanted to try this). Thus, we got 2 more desserts with a total of 4 desserts and 2 snacks :) Gym time later.

Most of the food was decent at best. The egg waffles were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It wasn't too sweet either. The rice crepe was OK, the noodles didn't taste that fresh, like those you can buy at Asian markets and the sauce was bland. The coconut milk taro sago didn't taste like coconut (to my friend's disappointment) and it was a bit starchy. 

The red bean soup was so disappointing. There wasn't a lot of red beans so it was liquidy (I like my red bean soup with LOTS of red bean). The glutinous balls were OK but the peanut filling was nowhere near as good as the ones I had in Hong Kong.

Now the real winners of KTDC were the ice cream waffle sandwiches. We got the banana split waffle sandwich and the vanilla ice cream with bananas were so delicious. For our free ice cream sandwich we decided to get green tea and mango ice cream filling. AWESOME ICE CREAM. There's something about their ice cream. It's probably one of the best ice creams I've had and their waffles were soooo good. Crispy and sweet with a tinge of maple syrup flavor. 

I wouldn't come back here any time soon because their food is not out-of-this-world-amazing, but their ice cream sandwiches are fantastic. I'm bumping up my rating by a star because of their excellent ice cream and waffles!
author: Judy H.

description: The food is okay over there, but I love their service. Those staff are very nice. And that is why I would give 5 stars
author: Gloria Y.

description:
In terms of dessert, I can't say that the food was disgusting. They offer an extensive menu ranging from drinks, smoothies, ramen, fruit sago, and the list goes on. You can even get a free waffle ice cream with Yelp or Facebook check in. Within our group we ordered fruit sago (s), aloe and honey drink, and a mango-go-go, nothing outrageously fancy or delicious- your typical Asian dessert joint.

However I will note that this place distinguishes itself in poor customer service. Upon being seated, we weren't given any attention. While the waiter rushed around to hand out cups of tea to all other patrons he seated, our group of 5 were the only ones who did NOT get tea, not even after we reminded him otherwise. 

After flagging him down to take our order, he averted our gazes, and kept looking at the door WHILE we were telling him our orders. Not so surprisingly, we had to repeat ourselves several times for him to get our orders right. 

We were not checked up on even once during my short unpleasant stay and our tea never came out either. I don't believe there's a need to bash the customer service here, I'm sure you can sum it up yourself. Kowloon Tong Dessert? Thanks, but no thanks.
author: Ada C.

description:
Looks strange from the outside, but serves really good food. Only asians but us, so that's gotta mean something :) I was honestly surprised, had Udon noodles with hot pepper pork chop. Really tasty but spicy and they didn't hold back on the garlic. It was plenty on that.

Nevertheless try it, they serve some delicious stuff.
author: Eric S.

description: Service was horrible.  Order taken, and while the drinks came quickly the one desert item was never delivered.  The restaurant was not busy and so I ma not sure what would be the explanation, except the basketball game was on and the server seemed more interested in that than checking on his guests.  Would not recommend or come again.
author: James H.

description:
We had 6 ppl come in and only order 2 drinks and one dessert. They didn't complain but rather still gave us all complimentary teas and kept refilling them.

Very welcoming place.  Awesome for a casual catch up with friends.
author: Angela Y.

description:
My go-to place for late night "I NEED ASIAN DESSERTS" munchies, and it's mainly because the desire for Asian desserts becomes the realization that they have ICE CREAM SANDWICH WAFFLES, which are beautiful. Then I forget all the reasons why I was there in the first place because I'm too busy eating an ice cream sandwich waffle while the rest of my party is like, "Why did we order two?" and I say, "One whole thing is for me. I thought you guys were splitting the rest." And I'm usually right. I usually urge the boyfriend to come with me around 7-9pm, before the rush of people who like going out later at night. It's pretty quiet around 7pm, so if you don't want to deal with a crowd, that's a good time to go.

Sometimes I get that snack time food, too. Mainly spam. And the boyfriend always looks at me like I'm crazy for it, but damn it, spam, eggs, and rice is awesome. It's a good way to pause in the middle of an ice cream waffle sandwich. The other non-ice cream sandwiches (things like chicken sandwiches) aren't all that great; super fatty, hard to eat as a sandwich, on cheap bread, and served with those crinkle-cut fries you get from the frozen aisle at Safeway. The noodles are quite tasty, though!

One thing I will always remember: the mugs are deceptive. They're really good at insulating heat, so when they serve you tea, I highly suggest not drinking it right away. It's boiling hot and you wouldn't be able to tell from just holding the mug. Seriously, save your mouth from sure burnination.

Oh, and the black sesame hot dessert is good, too! I didn't like it too much in the red bean soup, but in the black sesame, it was lovely. One of the spots that I always forget about when I wonder what to do for that 7-9pm gap and I want to get something cheap but still have a nice sit.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Get drunk in San Diego, sober up at a Roberto's.

Somehow getting drunk in the city, I always end up here. I can't explain it, I don't know really where this place is, I just know for the last few years everytime I visit the city, somehow drags me here after drinking.

I like the strawberry ice cream sandwich between two waffles. Really good.

I usually get the fried chicken with fries. It's nothing special but damn good late at night.

The waffles are always pretty bomb.

Shaved ice is pretty decent. They top it with fruit. 

Place is pretty win and has been around for ages.
author: Jeff S.

description:
The mixed fruit waffle ice cream sandwich is so damn good!  Strawberry ice cream with kiwi, honeydew, strawberries, and one or two more fruits sandwiched into warm chewy waffle slices.  Bless who ever thought of the idea!  While I had Kownloon bookmarked for months due to the pics of the ice cream waffle sandwiches, my curiosity for alternative ice cream sandwiches began in the summer when I saw the bf's dad smack ice cream in between 2 slices of bread..I thought he just didn't want to dirty a bowl, but then bf told me, "That's a Filipino ice cream sandwich."  I tried it later on, ehh, it was aight.  Eventually I tried it with warm Pan de Sal...better!  And a couple weeks ago I made my own creation, vanilla ice cream crossiant sandwich!  Don't hate, it was yummy! 

Bf got the ice cream waffle sundae, which had strawberry, mango, and chocolate ice creams.  It was good, but mine was the winner!  We went around 4:30 on Sunday afternoon with only two other tables occupied one was a big party. I advise you to a get an afternoon or early evening dessert to avoid the crowds.  Our waitress was friendly and provided good service.  Prices are reasonable, but this place is cash only like most HK cafes.  Despite not taking card, I give it a five for all of the above reasons....and for that waffle sandwich which totally made stopping by on a rainy day worth it!
author: Cat C.

description: The first time I came here I remember not liking it (I think I ordered cantaloupe sago). Whenever I was craving dessert I would opt for golden island or creations over Kowloon. But recently friends have been wanting to come here for dessert more often and I'm glad they did! I tried their mango shaved ice recently and I was amazed it was sooo good I ate the entire thing in just a couple of minutes.  The shaved ice came with mango juice/purée that they serve with their sago, shaved ice of course, lots of fresh mango, and a scoop of ice cream on top. There was also a sauce poured over it but I couldn't tell if it was condensed milk or coconut milk.  Either way it was sooo good and refreshing.  We've also tried their waffle ice cream sandwiches, banana splits, ramen, spicy crispy chicken, and French fries. Their "crispy chicken" is just chicken nuggets, but their fries my favorite! Crinkle cut and fried real crispy!! I can eat a whole order by myself.
author: Linz C.

description: I had gone out to get some dessert with some friends at Kowloon. When we got there business was booming! We had a great set of options available. When the food came it tasted rest and the service was nice. I would suggest Kowloon for college kids and adults who want to get some good tasting food for a good price in San Francisco!
author: Alec T.

description: The menu is extensive, the tea is hot (but poured scarcely), and the food is strangely fusion for a Chinese dessert cafe. It's not fusion in that it combines other cuisines. It's fusion in that it combines desserts into one plate (e.g. ice cream, bananas, and chocolate syrup packed in between waffles). Checking in on Facebook/Yelp with a $30 purchase gets you a free ice cream waffle sandwich though! Service is definitely slow, but they're super accommodating for whatever kind of party you have, and they let you chill there for a long time. Way better than Creations.
author: Danny C.

description: Came back for the 2nd time in 2 months. Food was not as good as my visit 2 months ago. Server was not too friendly
author: Tommi N.

description: I always go here with a group of my friends. The people that work there are very welcoming and super nice, me and my friends would stay there for hours and catching up and talking and they wouldn't kick us out and they would just keep giving us more tea which was very generous of them.. The food is pretty good. I always get the ice cream waffle sandwich. Its so good. A lot of my friends would get the Mango sago, and they all loved it. I also got the Chicken and Fries. The fries are okay you can't really go wrong with fries and they are crispy which I like and also, the chicken is really juicy which is good. I like this place because it opens late and its affordable.
author: Christina T.

description:
My friends took me here for my first time because they rave about how great everything is at this place. They go here ALL THE TIME! When we arrived, seats were all taken but after signing up, we only waited about 5 minutes before we got seated. 

Tried the mango sago with glutinous balls and omg it was really good. I haven't had asian dessert in so long and I'm so glad I got to try it. My friend ordered the Tofu Fa, which she ended up not liking because she wasn't used to the consistency of the tofu, but I liked it. It reminded me of this dessert in the Philippines but it didn't have boba pearls in it. Now, I wish I can get asian dessert up here in Portland, so now I'll have to come back!
author: Faye F.

description: This place is my go to late night dessert spot! I always get the egg puffs and their pan friend noodles with luncheon meat. Last time I was here, I tried the egg puffle which was really good since it combines 2 things i really like. Egg puffs and ice cream. This place is great if you want something sweet late at night.
author: Alice P.

description:
Worst service ever. Needless to say, I will not be returning.

My party was seated fairly quickly. We were not quickly attended to. Then to make matters worse.. we did not receive our orders of dessert until after 45 minutes. During that time, all the tables after us received their food, not dessert, cooked food! I'm pretty sure it does not take 45 minutes to throw some sago and "fresh" fruits in a bowl and serve it!
author: Jenny C.

description: There is a lot of variety here, but it doesn't matter for me. Hot, cold, hungry, thirsty...I always go for black sesame rice balls in some kind of milk (hot). I've had it in coconut, in almond, and my mom even tried walnut. All were delicious. My dad typically goes for the curry fishballs (he's a savory kind of guy, even for dessert) and he says they are pretty decent. Prices are reasonable too.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I came here with a couple friends after a night of clubbing. Definite plus that they are open until 2am on Saturdays. I tried their daily special with chicken & pork with black pepper sauce and spaghetti, mango pudding, egg puffs, fried squid balls, and waffle ice cream sandwich. Nothing really stood out however it is a good place to go for late night Chinese food.
author: Melanie H.

description:
A neat small desert placed tucked in on the corner of the new China town on Geary. The desert here are quit good. We ordered the Ginger Milk Custard, Ice Cream with Waffle, and also a fruit bowl. All came quickly and to perfection. 

I didn't know that that they served food, if so I would of ate there as well. 

Till next time.
author: Yao Z.

description: It was okay. I had the mixed fruits sago. The sago itself was plain and a bit watery. The fruits were fresh though. The check in deal applys to purchases $30 and more. Wish I had knew that before. Ah well.
author: Lena T.

description:
Desserts galore!

I would most definitely recommend trying the ice cream waffle sandwich, the waffle with peanut butter/condensed milk/butter/sugar, gei daan jai (egg puffs) and hak ji ma wu (black sesame paste) here. I have yet to try the snacks such as the salt and pepper chicken wings, but I may try the entrees or snacks the next time I'm here. Kowloon Tong looks like they specialize in desserts for sure.

If you go with a party of 4-6, and if you have a smart phone, check in on Facebook or Yelp and receive a complementary ice cream waffle sandwich if you spend more than 20$. And yes, my dad shoved his smart phone in my hand and told me to work my "young peoples' technology magic" to check in for our party of 5 and tag a friend. 

We ended up getting a waffle mango+green tea ice cream sandwich, and all the other stuff I previously listed. Their ice cream waffle sandwich and black sesame paste dessert are their most popular items and I suggest ordering their specialties and customer favorites when you visit Kowloon Tong.

Service was a little iffy, but it was packed on a Saturday night, so I'll be understanding.

Great place for dessert!
author: Sheena T.

description: Good place but service sucks. Fobby dude with glasses sucks at what he's supposed to do. My friends and I come here a lot and he usually does a pretty bad job, but today was even worse. At first he started off good, seating us, then giving us our tea right off the bat. We looked at the menu for a good minute because we already knew what we wanted. We sat patiently, watching him take other people's orders, serving food, and chit-chatting with his coworkers. We finally reached the last straw when 15 minutes passed without tending to us at all. Good job guy.
author: Derald A.

description: Amazingly delicious, lots of variety and good quality late night spot! It's truly a gem in the city.
author: Ivana M.

description:
My boyfriend always take me here for dessert or for a snack. So far, I've always left this place quite satisfied :) There hasn't been wrong with anything we ordered yet, the only thing I'd change would maybe be the fruits, some times they're not in season so they're not as sweet as I'd like them. 

I think I tend to like the snacks more than the desserts I order for some reason, even though I go in craving for dessert. lol I love their hong kong style french toast, something people should definitely find.
author: Harriet W.

description:
If you can ever get service while you're here, the ramen is pretty good for the foggy evening (albeit not really special). Definitely go for the mango sago as it is bomb. Pretty much any of their desserts are fabulous, actually.

But honestly I get the stink eye from the waiters every time I come here.
author: Bonnie G.

description: We went last friday and got the egg puffs and i got the sesame paste. Both were great! Good food and I recommend both.
author: H G.

description: They're open until 1am which is 5 stars in itself and the food was awesome as well. Great tasting iced hk tea/coffee. Also ordered the egglets and the waffle sundae which was clutch. Definitely hit the spot. The recipe for the waffle batter is goldddddd. Also, the sundae came with peanuts but they exchanged it for a new one at no cost...earned them a nice tip ;) 5 stars, would definitely come again.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Deep fried peanut butter french toast.  My friend would not stop talking about it and how she craved it from when she was in Hong Kong.  It sounded like a heart attack but we split it among five people.  

Service was a catastrophe.  The french toast came out first without peanut butter inside.  My friend refused to have peanut butter on the side so they remade it (hopefully without a side of loogie).  It was okay, but I wasn't a fan.

We got eggs and spam on bread...reminds me of my childhood.  lol

They have some toy vending machine with Hello Kitty and Domo.  $1 but the machines really suck and tend to get stuck so we had to call someone over a few times.

I don't think I'd make the effort to come here again...
author: Nancy P.

description:
It's alright, decent food. Don't really have a favorite at this place but if you close your eyes and just randomly select something, I'm pretty sure you still can't go wrong with it. I really like this server that's always so cheerful and talk with so much energy even if it's 1am. He literally shoots sunshine out of his body.

Definitely a place to go to for a little pick-me-up either through sweets or this waiter.
author: Elaine Y.

description: One of my favorite dessert spot for that late night sweet cravings!! Don't forget to check in and get your free waffle if you spend 30 dollars or more!!!
author: Donna S.

description:
Cute dessert restaurant. It gives you that Asian cute vibe, and youll know youre in an Asian restaurant(tacky interior and bright ornaments). But anyways, food is great, i ordered the mango sago and it was delicious. I also ordered the glutinous balls with peanut sauce, not a big fan but my sisters liked it. 

Id avoid coming at a busy area because the service can be slow and you have to wait for the food and ordering it much longer. I mean like much longer. I came both times when it was empty and crowded and i tell you, it is not worth the wait! But yeah, its a good place to have asian desserts. Wide selection and it wont disappoint.
author: Cavin T.

description:
THE DRUNKEN ADVENTURES CONTINUE..

Came here numerous times for dessert, or sometimes just to sober up. 

There egg puffs are awesome, but make sure to ask them for some condensed milk too. The waffle sundaes are massive, best to share with another. I especially like the red bean sesame balls. Everything else is pretty legit. Although I hate instant ramen noodles, for some reason, it's always an option worth considering when I'm here.
author: Albert L.

description:
My homegirl, Cindy C., came home for the weekend, so we decided to head over to Kowloon Tong for dessert. I'm not the type of person that likes to go "desserting," nor am I a huge fanatic of Chinese desserts. It was a Friday night and the place was packed! We waited about 15 minutes until we were seated. CIndy C. had the strawberry sago and I decided to try the watermelon juice. We also shared the ice cream waffle sundae. Seriously, it was so dumb of me to order watermelon juice. Is it even watermelon season yet? It wasn't even sweet. And at almost $4 a cup, it was such a rip off! Really, that's my own bad, but I still think $4 for a cup of juice is a bit excessive. There was nothing special about the ice cream sundae. A nice treat, but I wouldn't go back to Kowloon Tong for that. 

Service sucks too. Our cups of tea were brought to the table next to us. They just sat down and the servers assumed we were together. If  we were together, wouldn't we have sat at the same table?!
author: Audrey T.

description:
I can finally update my review on this place after a few more tries! 

It's August and you know what that means?!?! MOON CAKES!! But that has nothing to do with this review.. haha. After all the wonderful sunshine the state has endured, the fruits have become fruitful... yay!! 

PARKING: 
Street parking. May be hard..depending what time you come. Hit/miss. There's usually one or two open spots around 8pm. Also, there's not many people around this time. Starts getting packed around 9:30 pm. 

FOOD: 
For my latest visit, I ordered a mixed fruit bowl and the fruits tasted so fresh and yummy! It was delicious!! You should definitely order it around fruit season .. comes with honeydew, cantaloupe, mango, watermelon, and strawberries! :) If you don't know what to order, this is always a good choice .. cause who doesn't love fruits?! It's good and it's healthy! You also know what to expect :) 

Egg puffs are always a popular choice too! When it first comes out fresh, tastes soft and crunchy! This is probably one of the few places that I've eaten it at in SF since my last trip to HK in a long timeee.

The previous visit, I ordered the Mixed Fruit Sago and the sago tasted a bit watered down.. 

SERVICE: 
The servers are always friendly and they try to be as quick as possible with everything. When it starts to get packed around 9:30pm, it kinda slows down a bit but they're still good cause they still check up on you! Since I've been coming in around 8 pm, the customer service is always great cause the food comes out super fast! 

One thing that has changed from my review is that they now accept credit cards. I'm not sure if a minimum order is needed though, so you should ask beforehand. The bill between my friend and I was $18 and they accepted her card.
author: Mandy G.

description: The sago desserts are freshly made and delicious. I've also tried the almond paste and ice cream float, both of which are delicious but not nearly as good as the sago desserts. The service is attentive and the waiters and waitresses often offer hot tea and water. There is usually a wait but goes by quickly.
author: Ruby K.

description:
You can seriously find me here once a week and it's mainly because of it's convenient hours, accommodating for large parties and has a lot of Asian desserts that I grew up eating. This place is busy everyday after 11p and midnight. Mainly kids (high schoolers and college kids?) tend to come in packs and it creates a really nice chill vibe. 

The service is pretty bad though. And I am not even exaggerating. Two youngsters tending to all the tables and 1 in the back making all the random desserts. This is the type of place where you can just wave them down and ask for things. 

Desserts: 
Mango sago (icy, has mangos and tapioca)
Ice cream waffle with cookie and cream ice cream
Steamed egg or milk (plain or sesame): Steamed milk is almost like a warm pudding and you can add different toppings listed on the menu

Savory: Random stuff from chicken wings, noodles, ramen, spicy chicken, fries etc

Note: Has a Yelp and facebook offer (so check it out because if you have a large group; so can snag a free ice cream waffle). Always a goal of mine when I come here. 

Parking is pretty easy; its smack dab in the middle of a residential area.
author: Amy L.

description:
For the longest time I didn't know the name of this place because I had only seen the Chinese characters so I would always refer to this place as "the dessert place w/the green awning." I had bookmarked this place to try but little did I know that I had already been here! The decor has changed since I first went here (which is great because they had wobbly and beat up tables w/very sticky counter tops) prior so the new decorum is an improvement.

I had bookmarked this place in order to try their ice cream waffle sandwich since so many people have raved about this place. The waffle came out nice and crispy and the ice cream wasn't icy and really creamy (just the way I like it!) The cool thing is that they let you pick two flavors if you want! We chose strawberry & green tea. Yum!

The eggpuffs here are hit and miss. Sometimes it's crispy, sometimes it isn't.

Sesame or peanut filled glutinous balls w/crushed peanuts, if you want something slightly sweet w/a touch of salty.

Their black sesame paste is also pretty good on a chilly night if you don't want something cold.

Some drinks I like to get here as well: oval-hor, HK milk tea or HK milk tea w/coffee. You do receive complimentary hot tea when you first sit down but these drinks bring back a lot of childhood memories and are all done really well.

Big K Grass Jelly has a whole bunch of fruit and agar jelly cubes on top of vanilla ice cream w/grass jelly at the very bottom.

Not the best Asian dessert place, but something different and not as packed as Creations or Golden Island as much (it does still get pretty packed). Parking isn't the easiest either, but it's SF.
author: Kitty K.

description:
I've been here a few times and most of the time they only have one/two people working. This is not a problem until it gets extremely busy like on Friday and Saturday nights. 
Anyway, their service is okay. Meh, typical Asian joint. I don't expect much and they don't prove me wrong.
Food is good though! I love their ice cream waffle sandwiches. I know it's so simple and doesn't require much skill, but I've had it first here and I loved it.  The eggettes are similar, not much skill required, but nonetheless, hot, fresh and tasty.
Other desserts are good. I mooched off friends' orders and they never failed.
author: Athena L.

description:
Came twice in recent weeks. Open late.

Signs says if you checkin you get some freebie.

The waffle ice cream sandwich for under $6 is good for two, or four if sharing other desserts. 

They have spam noodle soup, but you can get it pan fried.
author: qirk z.

description: It's pretty good. I came here to try it out, and I liked it. It wasn't as packed when I came here. I tried their Fruit Bowl with saga, and their banana and strawberry smoothie and I enjoyed my meal! Pretty good for a dessert place that even old cute grandparents come here! So cute!!!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Got the steamed milk custard with almond paste. It was really good and smooth. I wish there was some more almond paste b/c I ran out so the ratio is a bit off for me, but still so good. My friend had some sticky rice dessert that I tried and it was good, as well. I really like the desserts we had because it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet like the typical American desserts. 

The service was great. When I was shocked it would take 10 minutes she said she will quickly put in the order now. Def. plan on coming back... all the time.
author: Vicki T.

description:
My usual Thursday night out with my friends to eat a light dessert and mingle. I love their watermelon juice, it is so fresh and sweet. It used to be a $1 but not it is $2.99 so I don't order it anymore. I love their spicy instant noodles with preserved pickles and pork. Their noodles aren't fully cook but I like that because it is still soft and crispy at the same time. They give you tons of preserved pickles and pork on top of your noodles. Even though I usually get spicy but it isn't  spicy. They used to put a lof of pepper in there but not anymore. Their chicken wings are also really good. It is a bit oily but really crispy. 

Their dessert aren't that bad either. I like their mango sago. It have just enough mango and coconut milk in there. Their waffle ice cream sandwich is also good (free if you check-in and order over $25).
author: Nhung C.

description:
Hmm...how have I not reviewed Kowloon Tong?  Perhaps because I discovered it before Yelp existed.  I was introduced to this spot by college friends and have always thoroughly enjoyed it.  

An extensive menu, moderate prices and relatively quick service make Kowloon Tong a popular spot for dessert.  Mango sago is usually my go-to choice, however need to keep in mind mango season and when it's off-season, instead order the sesame and almond paste dessert.  They've got waffle ice-cream sandwiches, fruit based desserts, grass jelly, you name it! 

Need to remind myself that they also have a savory section as well so that next time I have the whole meal here.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Been coming here for over eight years and still love the desserts.  Egg puffs and waffles are my must have orders, sometimes with ice cream too.  Both are crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.

Most of the time it's crowded at night on the weekends, but there's little to no wait usually.  They don't have much selection in terms of "real" lunch/dinner food, but that's not a big deal given all the restaurants close by on Clement St.
author: Erick L.

description: Food and dessert are fine, but poor attitude of the service. We just sit and wait for to go order and I do paid the tips , but waiter impolitely told us we have to leave the table if other customers come. Feel soooo bad !never back this place!
author: Yang S.

description:
3 stars. 1 star because it's open late at night. 2 stars because I love HK/Asian desserts. 3 stars because they have some interesting desserts other places don't. 

I've been here twice now and each time the service has been pretty slow and the place has been packed late at night. I would say that the service is mediocre at best and the prices aren't really that great for what you are getting. The quality of the food is just so-so and nothing special. It's fatty, stale, too sweet, not sweet enough, arrives cold, etc... The one time something arrived extremely fast, we hadn't ordered it yet and were planning to get the green tea ice cream option. However, the manager and waiter told us we had to take the one that was already made. Let me make this clear: we hadn't even ordered it when they brought it to our table and forced us to take it (and charge us!) even though we were going to order a different variety. 

I don't live in SF and I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, even with the freebies with the check-in. There are better options, even late at night both within and outside of the city.
author: Farrah N.

description:
Love this little Taiwanese dessert place. It gets really packed inside and I can see why. All the desserts are so cute and Taiwanese.  The Asian dessert competition around this area is pretty stiff and this place keeps it real

 They also have some bomb chicken wings.
author: James T.

description:
Lots of USF students. Often long wait. Food takes forever to come out. 

But, it is good and cheap. We go there to hang out, but it's not something that we would crave or miss.
author: Brenda S.

description:
I come here all the time. Really, the desserts are what brings me back. Hard to find a better selection of desert in all of San Francisco.

The food (while a limited selection) is also quite good, though not great.

The biggest problem here is that the service can sometimes be very slow.
author: Andrew E.

description: Best damn Mango Sago!
author: Mabel Y.

description: After getting off working at 12am, all I wanted to do was enjoy some yummy desert and snack. When my bf and I got there, there was no line. Both the waitress and waiter looked at us and ignored us. After using their bathroom, I told the waitress that we needed a table for two and she said okay but didn't seat us still.
