We stood by the door for a couple more minutes until I finally asked the waiter if i could sit at the empty tables available and he said go ahead -_______-  After ordering food, the waitress so happens to miss the curry fish balls I ordered. I didn't even bother mentioning it to her because I was annoyed. The food was ehhh and the portions are small. Inattentive workers who make it obvious that do not want to be there. The only good thing about this place is that they're opened late on a Sunday
author: Michelle H.

description:
I really don't know why i still go here -_- every time i come here, food is okay but the service only gets worse. We came here after dinner, trying to get some sweets to wash off our bbq flavored mouth, and we did not get any tea/ water. We purposely did not ask them to see if they'd serve us any later on... And well... No tea at all. We left without drinking anything. Yea, yea we could've asked but it was just like one of those moments where you're just like "forget it, just finish the food and leave". It was not worth the effort "trying" to call a server over. 
Overall, i think i'm pretty dang generous for giving them 3 stars! I hate to be mean so i'll give you a so-so.
author: Verdina P.

description:
I actually found out about Kowloon Tong from a friend. He raved on and on about how late they were open and how great their waffles and ice cream were. I was shopping in the area, so I decided to stop by before heading home. Parking was a pain, but I managed to find one. The cafe was a little dingy-looking, but whatever.

Their menu was pretty extensive. They had all sorts of miscellaneous snacks: pudding, fruit, ice cream, ramen, spam, rice, fries, crepes, boba drinks, chow mein, custards, and the list continues. I decided to get the waffle ice cream sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=cTjX6oUDlvBPJjrJEGxpiQ). It was exactly what it sounded like--four huge pieces of fried waffles and vanilla ice cream sandwiched in between. It didn't taste as wonderful as it looked. I was pretty disappointed with how plain it tasted! Boo!

Prices were inexpensive and customer service was great. I could probably see myself here after a drunken night. I'm pretty sure a lot of their customers come here drunk, since they are open so late.

P.S.
Cheers to my 300th review! :D
author: Lien T.

description:
I like this particular dessert place because it's quite spacious, thus less wait time if any.  When its packed, the turnover can be slow cuz them peeps there will chatty chat chat and never leave! U feel me? Lol  But they do offer a lot of food selections in addition to dessert so you can actually eat dinner here.  

I usually order the steamed milk or egg with either ginger or almond flavor. If I'm feeling fancy, I will do the bird's nest one.  Does it's job and it's not too sweet. The wait time is about 10-15 min. 

Checked in on FB and got the Ice Cream waffle sandwich for Free.  Surprisingly it was pretty good. The waffle was done just right. Very crispy on the outside but not overcooked while the center was still moist. Ice cream was bland...not the gourmet kind but I wasn't expecting it to be. it's free so can't complain too much! haha

Service: yes you will need to wave them down for service. They are not being rude, that's just how it is there.
author: Cathy M.

description:
With the return of hot weather to the bay, I've been craving desserts a lot lately. This place definitely satisfies that craving and is a great place to hang out with friends while you're at it.

Recently I have been ordering the waffle sundae. It's a fairly sized sundae with vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry ice cream in it topped with slices of a waffle. Tonight I also ordered the egg puffs. I haven't had much luck lately with ordering a decent egg puff, but this place provided me with something nice. A while back I also had some of their snack food like chicken wings and fries which were pretty good too. The prices are pretty standard for a Hong Kong dessert cafe.

In terms of service, in my experience they're pretty attentive to their customers. Even though it gets pretty busy, they do pretty well with getting food out quickly and refilling tea. I also liked that they didn't try to rush me out despite having people waiting outside to get seated. Sometimes places will hand you the check rather early to try to encourage you to leave sooner, but this place didn't do that to me and let us stay in here and just chat until we asked for the bill. Sorry to the people waiting outside though. =X
author: Allen C.

description: When it comes to dessert joints, this one is my favorite. There are so many choices and everything's a hitter! I might be a little over excited, but nothing displeases me here. What's also great about this place is that they close late so it's a wonderful spot to catch up with the homies under a more than reasonable time frame. I don't recall ever waiting for a table (as odd as that sounds) because this place gets packed, but it'd be worth it to me. Can't wait for another catch up session with the girls!
author: Allison C.

description:
Heeeeelllllooo and Happy New Years! 

I thought i would make this my first review of the year 2011, one of my favorite fobby dessert places. Kowloon is tucked away in the inner Richmond off of 7th ave btw geary and clement. It is easy to miss but very lively during the nite as it is open very late. People passing by probably are wondering why there are so many Asians outside a random cafe late at nite. haha

My Two favorite things to get at Kowloon are :

HK style waffle sammy: Yummy ice cream sandwiched in btw two crisp delicious HK style waffles is HEAVENLY! 

Mixed Fruits Sago: fresh fruit, super light and healthy but most importantly yummy!

This place is the way to go for dessert, with many things to choose from to satisfy your dessert palate. A few things to note:

-After 9pm Kowloon will be PACKED!

-CASH ONLY

-waffles for the waffle sammy can vary in size, big one nite and small the next but still worth it! 

-Can be a healthier alternative to fatty American desserts!

fobby definition of the day: Sago

Sago is a starch extracted from the pith of sago palm stems, Metroxylon sagu. They are produced commercially in little pearls like tapioca.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Decent place for some nice Asian dessert.  They aren't always great but sometimes it hits the spot.  My usual favorite Taro with Sago dessert isn't the best I've had.  But on my last visit I ordered a Steamed Egg with Ginger Juice and it was surprisingly good.  Not overly sweet, egg was smooth, and with a strong hint of ginger.  But it took forever to come out even though estimated time was 15 minutes.
author: Karen L.

description: Kem ko ngon, phuc vu chanh~ va lau, vai mon trang mieng hongkong thi cung duoc nhung minh khong co goi...canh ga chien thom vi co nhieu toi~ va hanh...Den day nhieu lan nhung khong lan nao 100% thoa man
author: Nga N.

description: 5 stars for their ice cream waffles! I think I am a bit obsessed! It's such a simple dessert but I really really like their waffles!!! It was crunchy and sweet! It goes so well with the vanilla ice cream. I also tried their super mango pudding. It was okay.. Wasn't a fan of the mango pudding it was super smushy but I think that's how it's supposed to be?
author: Nguyet T.

description:
Free banana split I've cream waffle sandwich when you check in and spend a certain amount. they also have free wifi. funny servers. - kinda

i love hk desserts!
-hk style french toast with condensed milk
-mixed fruit sago

bunch of other stuff i cant recall what they are called in English :X
author: Kristina L.

description: A nice small little cafe. The waiter is funny and friendly as well. Food was great. Returned a few times already. Never a mistake. It is a little packed there sometimes and the noise level can get very high. Other then that the place is great for desserts!!
author: Anan K.

description:
Not a bad dessert place to go to, like creations. They have many similar items on the menu but they do incorporate ice cream into their desserts more than creations does.

I ordered the Mango Madness and I was thinking how can you go wrong with a name like that?? Sadly, I was not too impressed when I ate the dish. The ice cream was wayy too icy which makes it have that cheap taste that I am not looking for. I would expect the ice cream to be creamier but I was disappointed. Their fruits that they put in it did not taste too fresh either so it was an overall disappointment.

I want to come back here and try something else and hopefully next time I will have better results.
author: Spencer E.

description:
Hong Kong desserts!

CLEANLINESS: 4/5
SERVICE: 4/5
FOOD: 4/5
+ Steamed milk pudding

We stopped here for dessert with the cousins on a weekend and it was pretty empty. We came on a rainy day, so that probably contributed to it. I ordered the steamed milk pudding and it was pretty good. Nothing special, just tasted like it should. My cousins ordered some of the fruit desserts and they looked pretty good! We got a free waffle/ice cream dessert for spending at least $25 as a total. A nice little perk!

I would come again if I was craving some HK desserts!
author: Desmond C.

description:
Their fried chicken is so good! Always piping hot and the right amount of salt...

I also love their mango sago, waffle ice cream sando, mixed fruit and black sweet rice, hot milk/ egg custard

Theirs snacks are yummy as well always bring friends here to chat and snack
author: Tiff L.

description: First time in sf this was one of the best customer services I got friendly waiter smiling and he gave us his best recommendation
author: Iris M.

description:
Dear Kowloon, 
~~~~scratch that~~~

Dear Brandon, 

My friend and I come here probably 5+ times this short Christmas Break.
Why?
Well you are a very enthusiastic and full of surprises every time we come. We don't really come for the dessert but more so for the customer service. 
.....I have never had so much fun at a dessert cafe ever...

----Service-----
Well, this "sexy" (he calls himself that) guy has so much energy when working and talks to the customers on a different level. He spoke to my friends friend from Japan in a full on conversation. We then find out he majored in Japanese... In addition, he likes to learn languages that are sexy... like French. So go on and speak to him in Japanese and French!
***There was this one time we came in and he offered us chocolate!***

Ok now with the real dough of the restaurant. 
-----Food-----
Their dishes are smaller than the AMERICAN way but are very tasty. 
The waffle ice cream sandwiches are good and different but however it may get melty fast! So eat them while they are hot and don't worry about your friends not getting their desserts yet!
Attached are a few pictures of what we got.

NOTE ALL CUSTOMERS!
`````````UNTIL JANUARY 16~~~
--Open till 2am
--Chicken wings and french fries for a Magnificent price of 2.99 :)
--Offer free Hot tea in these cool mugs that are doubled layered to prevent from burning your hands!

Last night will probably be my last time until my next break. 

But... You should give Brandon a raise for his hard work!
author: Tony C.

description: Slightly overpriced and they make you sit down for service but good desserts and friendly staff. We had egg puffs and a few other dishes and all were worth the wait!
author: Megan H.

description:
Even from a distance, you can immediately see that this place is almost always busy. Often times, people are waiting outside to be called for seating, which might deter people from going here. With that said,  expect to be talking with your friends for a significant amount of time before your orders arrive once you do get in.

In terms of taste, the sweet items are usually well balanced, especially the ones with real chunks of fruit. Nothing tastes too over the top. Savory items are good if you're into delicious chunks of greasy goodness, and I don't mean that in a bad way!

The pricing is decent, you get what you pay for and can definitely get a lot of a reasonable amount of money.

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's nice once in a while.
author: Pedro A.

description:
Desserts were standard, nothing phenomenal. There is really only one thing to say about our experience:

What do you mean you don't have boba?
author: Emmeline A.

description:
Open late.
Cheap eats.
Chinese dessert.
Free tea.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
Kowloon Tong...the stand-by late night dessert joint for my friends and I.  Also more fondly known as the "yeah, I think I WILL spend $5.00 on ramen I could make at home because it comes with an egg and meat here, and it tastes better when I pay for it" cafe.  And mind you, I don't even say that sarcastically...there have been a number of times I've used that exact logic in my head when deciding on what to order (yay...?).

Beyond the noodles (which is exactly like the ones you can make at home, so what is there to say?), they really do have some pretty good dessert items.  I just recently discovered their tofu fa (pretty good), but I generally go with their sago desserts (comes with choice of fruits with fruit puree and sago).  Definitely refreshing on a warm day, and more on the light side too.  The peanut butter toast with condensed milk is good too, but I haven't found one around here that's comparable to what I had in Asia though.  Which is pretty odd, considering it's just toast, peanut butter, and condensed milk.  And of course, you can't forget about their egg puffs, which it seems just about every table will get an order of.  Well, we do at least...but then, we're also the same people that order those $5 bowls of ramen.  

Also, I can't think of the name of the dish, but I know one of my friends really likes the rolled rice noodles with the peanut and xo dipping sauces...although, I guess that's more of an appetizer than a dessert.  
If you're looking for something more like a snack though, I would probably avoid their soy sauce chicken wings.  Not that they taste bad, just that it's pretty generic.  I think I've had the exact same thing at about a half dozen other Chinese delis in my lifetime, and those were generally more flavorful.  

Service has generally been good, although it might drag a little on a busy Friday or Saturday night it seems.  Still not terrible though, even if there is a crowd.  But just as a heads-up...be careful with those metal tea cups they give you.  They're so deceptive!  There's been a couple of times now when I've grabbed the cup thinking the tea was just warm, and ended up burning myself.

Mmmm....now I'm in the mood for some Asian desserts...
author: Mike L.

description: This place is decent. As a Torontonian, we have many of these places back home. I approve of this place for their HK style deserts which is quite rare in the Bay Area. I usually get their Super B-grass jelly and a cold HK Style Milk Tea! Recommended place to go after dinner and you will usually get a seat or wait no more than 15 mins.
author: Brian L.

description:
I've been going to this dessert spot since i first moved to the city about 6 years ago. It's really a hit or miss. It's usually packed when I go there or pretty full after 9pm and late into the night. There's not many hong kong style dessert places to choose from and frankly, this is one of the better ones.

This review is solely based on my most recent visit, this past sunday. It was a typical weekend, an asian drama was playing, and they were swamped and people crowding outside. We must have beat the rush because we were seated quite promptly. I was really glad to see that they decided to use ikea glass cups, rather than those plastic mugs they had to fill boiling hot tea in. I love getting the tea, but it's just does not sit well with me when it comes in a plastic cup. I literally taste the plastic. *yuck

Anyways, food was mediocre. Chicken was overly dry, strong smell of garlic on the wings, and my ginger milk curd had way too much ginger. Omg, i think i felt it burn down my throat. It also took them extremely long to refill our tea and bring us the bill. Still one of my go to places for an asian dessert fix, but their service really needs some work. Doesn't seem like the quality of food is getting any better thought. That's unfortunate.
author: Amimee D.

description: Great place to have sago and make sure not to park in the smart and final area because they will tow your car.  The service is fast on weekdays but weekends can get really busy.  Great place to have some Asian desserts!
author: Danny C.

description:
Kowloon Tong has quicker service than most Asian dessert joints in the city.  They DON'T have an extensive menu, though it may look like they do, many dishes are simply a slight variation of another dish.

I've had the mango sago here, and a ramen dish.  Not too bad.  The sago wasn't too icey.  The waffle cookie invention looks pretty good.

They even have traditional American dessert here, like a banana split.
author: Vivian H.

description:
It's a nice kick-it spot for you and/or a couple of friends. Especially during the night when parking is free and there's plenty of it. Just be aware this place might be packed and noisy.

Decent prices and decent tasting dessert; I'm not familiar with their specialty here so I went with the honeydew juice with sago. It wasn't mindbogglingly delicious but not terrible either. I would have enjoyed more of the sago than the watered down honeydew juice though. 

For me, this place is A-OK.  I may come back next time to try their toast or waffles but only when it's of convenience.
author: Tina O.

description:
I came here a few times last year. I like the desserts and how late it's open. Dishes I liked ordering was the waffles with green tea ice cream. Waffles are golden and crispy. The green tea ice cream taste so so. The steamed milk custard is delicious and perfect for a cold night. Good place to hang out with a few friends and talk. 

Service is a little slow. But last time I was there, I think it was just one person cooking.
author: Tes Y.

description: I probably wouldn't eat here for actual food--it says right on the menu: they serve instant noodles.  But, it's one of the spots I can find various desserts I once sampled in Hong Kong such as "Glutinous Balls" with crushed peanuts on it.  Plus this place is CHEAP AS HELL.  I'm a fan.
author: Ralph B.

description:
***** 5 stars *****
I looooooooove this place! I went to this place today, it's all about Hong Kong style!
I really miss my hometown right now!:(
I got a "XO Sauce Pork Rolls"(not sure the name) and "Super B-Kid Grass Jelly".
Wooow! It tastes so great!! Must try, must try!!
And the staff is extremely nice! 
There has wifi and TV. TV is showing some Hong Kong drama but it's not too loud!
Anyway! I will come back!
author: Kassidi L.

description:
Lucky for us, even though we went around 11pm on a Saturday evening, our party of 8 were seated rather quickly. The waiter was quick to bring us tea as we stared at the menu.

My friend and I ordered the Mixed Fruits in Mango Puree with Grass Jelly and Green Tea Ice Cream. I must say, the mangoes were extremely sweet, extremely satisfying. Our craving for a sweet dessert and her craving for grass jelly were satisfied rather easily with this dessert.

However, one of our friends ordered a shaved ice, of which was the last order to arrive, much to our surprise. We were all more than halfway through with our desserts when her shaved ice arrived.

Service was mediocre, considering how it took quite some time to get their attention for questions or for the check.

Dessert place: simple and sweet.
author: Bonita K.

description:
The thing I miss most about San Francisco is the dessert. Specifically, I miss Chinese dessert places that open until the early morning. There's nothing like sago at midnight or almond paste with good company. When I moved to SJ, my world came crashing down when I realized everything closes by 11. Thank the mango pudding gods that SF is so close by. 

The majority of my high school money (and a good chunk of college funds) was spent in dessert places, so to relive my youth, I took my BFF to Kowloon Tong. We ordered almond/sesame paste, udon noodles with 2 eggs, and ice cream bowl with fruit. It came out to be around 18 before tip. 

Everything was okay, nothing special and the noodles were beyond salty. Either dessert prices went up in SF or this place is pricier than the other places on Geary and Clement I frequent more often. I didn't feel too rushed, but I could tell the waiter didn't want us around, as there was a line waiting.
author: Tiffaney L.

description:
My friends and I usually come here only on weekends and there's always a long wait  especially at night. Nothing that special about this place except for their ice cream waffle sandwiches. You get a free one if you order over $25 and check in on yelp so that's pretty cool. I would say their service is average or slow at times, but hey what are you going to do? I know what it feels like working at a busy restaurant and having a full house.

Overall, this is your average asian dessert place. Long waits on the weekends, but good ice cream waffle sandwiches.
author: Vivian H.

description: I love this place. Authentic hongkong dessert, which I long for! They also have snacks like curry fish ball.
author: Yoanna Z.

description:
Came here one day with some peoples, about 7 of us - - around 12:30 am. Generally, i did not like it. Sorry but it probably was just a bad experience..

This place is quite small nd HOT . I'm guessing from all tha body heat. Tha menu is under tha glass that is on top of tha tables so if you are not in a position to view tha menu then there WILL be head turning nd angling to be done! 

Our food/drinks were bad. Or maybe we just ordered tha wrong things. BE CAREFUL what you order nd REALLY THINK ABOUT IT . We hated all of our orders except maybe one or two. To quote a friend who got tha shaved ice mango, "Worst desert created by man." =/ It was just ice nd sliced mangoes that they charged her $4-5 for...My other friend's honeydew smoothie was really watered down BUT atleast they allowed her to change it to a green tea smoothie. It was alright; not good but not bad either. There are others but I don't feel like writing anymore...

i really don't recommend this place but maybe it was just a very bad first experience. It WAS around 1 am, is what my friend keeps reminding me when it comes to these type of things... dam broken record. So for now, My Favorite over Kowloon.
author: Michael N.

description:
A default spot for those who are not sure what to do late night.  Been here quite a few times.  

Top Picks for Dessert:
1. black glutinous rice + mixed fruits
2. mango a-go-go
3. waffle ice cream sandwich
- most of the dessert here is pretty average i wouldnt come here expecting much

Service:
- BRANDON (!!) is has the best customer service skills ever!! me and my friends were getting a little impatient and wondered why our food wasnt coming out after 20 min, but somehow he sweet talked us and put smile on our faces.  throughout the night he made us all laugh with his clever jokes 

Atmosphere:
- loud, busy, and warm - i appreciate a place that is open late in a city that sleeps early.

Overall Impression: average dessert at reasonable prices, spending a late night with your friends laughing: priceless
author: Tina A.

description: Yummy egg puffs. Crispy on the outside, a bit chewy on the inside. The texture is just right. Highly recommended.
author: Frances W.

description:
I started going to Kowloon Tong since I was in high school. It was great in the being, the dessert were affordable and it had a good after dinner portions and the service was always friend and fast. 

But as time progressed, if it was your first time this place would seem AMAZING! but the second and third time, each time something becomes amazing to a disappointment. The service becomes a little slower, the food becomes a little less unique and less amazing. I mean, its great when you just want to grab something quickly and spend some time with your friends. Other than that I wouldn't recommend this dessert place, there are other places that have better service with the same choice of dessert items. 

Kowloon Tong's prices have gradually became more expensive, for a small tiny bowl of inexpensive dessert it can cost you ~5+. I don't think its worth it at all, and the seating is so cram in there, you just want to leave right after you finish your food. They use to have a better seating arrangement but they try to accommodation more people so the tables are now either closer to each other.
author: Amy T.

description:
We miss you Batz! (a friend who used to live down the street)

One of the most dependable Hong Kong dessert cafes that are filled with Asian brethren late into the night. 

They have all kinds of HK favorites: Fruity ice cream sundaes, glutinous balls, (according to Mona C.'s review) falopian tubing, swallow's nest/spit, and a free cup of tea with all orders above $5. 

Enjoy!
author: Will C.

description: Best egg puff in SF! I always have it to go on nights that I have to stay up late. The food is nice and comforting.
author: Jane W.

description: My friends and I all got food poisoning from eating a mango sago dessert there. The fried chicken was undercooked. Service was also really awful. We asked for a refill on our tea 3 or 4 times and they kept forgetting. Wouldn't touch this place again with a ten-foot pole.
author: Tina C.

description: The food is actually 6.5 out of 10, and the service is not that great to be honest. True experience, hope that helps consumers out there.
author: Simon L.

description:
Mediocre service and demanded a tip?!
Food was good, but the attitude given by the female waitress was really unnecessary and intolerable. 

Understandable if the party was more than 4/5, but a party of 2 and having to tip without appropriate service is just blasphemous.
author: Johnny A.

description: Great dessert and very reasonable prices. Service is mediocre, but you pay for what you get.
author: Diana L.

description:
2.5 stars

This review is for their Peanut Butter French Toast and Original Flavor of steamed egg custard.

The PB French Toast = 3 stars. It's rare for me to find a decent PB french toast in LA..so to be able to eat it here in SF it was satisfying, but not enough. 

The steamed egg - original flavor was not that good. It was quite bland  (perhaps i forgot to ask for ginger juice).. but even then the steamed egg was not smooth enough. I've had better and here at Kowloon Tong... the steamed egg was a bit hard.. it should be more smooth.

Now you cant compare any of their items to Hong Kong's - it's not comparable. So i'm only comparing to what i've had in California.. and this place is decent. If i really am craving for peanut butter french toast.. i'd come back here.

So why the low rating? Service. The waiter was so rude and so slow. Granted he was on his lunch break, but u know what? you have to realized you're in the restaurant business, so you have to drop your food and attend your customer. You can't just tell your customer "i'm on my break, i'll be w/ you in 15min" (and yes, he's the only waiter at that time). But how hard is it to get the order from your customer and then give the order to the kitchen..AND THEN continue w/ your break? I mean your customer will have to wait for the food anyway...so continue your break while your customer is waiting for their food! 

And when he was talking asking what we want, he was chewing while talking? gross.
author: Cherie T.

description: Opens until 1 am and 2 am on Fridays and Saturdays so I come here pretty often. Nothing here screams amazing but it's your typical Asian dessert spot and they open late. It usually gets pretty crowded and loud here so don't come here if you don't like that. The staff is nice and gets the job done. Overall, nothing amazing but it's a nice late night dessert place to visit with a group of friends.
author: Abby C.

description:
Yep, very same seedy region of HK as setting for Theroux's novel...and same MTR HK stop on the blue/green line. Lemme take a stab: owners wanted this place to hold mystery and intrigue? 'yeh mao' (late-night "cats") coming with no good on their mind?!

I am in total agreeance with the comments re: customer service here. Yes, they open until the wee hours, and sure they sure do offer a lot on their menu, and yes, they have some skill in preparing these authentic yummies that are a dime a dozen in Hong Kong... 

but people!!!! you can't be treating us like we aren't there, when we've come to offer you our $... at least talk to us, and please, please, if you say you open at 1700, then please be there and don't give me some draaaaawn-out Chinese excuse about why you couldn't make it.... it just isn't cool.

Yes, we want to advocate for our Asian brothers/sisters out there, but really.....I'd like your food and drink soo much more if you didn't look so robotic, and if you even feigned some sort of personable traits...

Alas, your sweet offerings are a cut above, and I certainly did like my steamed milk with mango whatchamacallit....and you did thank me for my patronage and ask me to come back....and I think I did see the faintest hint of some creases about your lips...

I may come to say hi again, and practice more of my Canto with you.
author: Jana C.

description: If you read my post previously posted please disregard.  Wrongfully scorned.  It was the other dessert spot on Noriega that I had that particular experience.  This spot gets a 3.5 star rounded up from me for a more consistent experience.
author: Colin M.

description:
Eh. Slow service even when there's no one in the cafe... dessert was so mediocre I might as well be eating ice. I got the Mango sago, and it just felt like cold mango dunked in evaporated milk and sago. There was no smooth consistency or taste, no blending of flavors. My mouth was not happy :(

Unfortunately, most dessert places in the Bay Area just don't cut it when it comes to Chinese style desserts.
author: Christal Y.

description:
I think just the fact that they're open til 2 AM at a residential area, they're ahead already by two stars. 

We had the POPCORN CHICKEN (2 orders),twas definitely not your typical TapX popcorn chix with all dark meat (puke). This was not as breaded (good). They asked for medium spicy but I wasn't sure if it really was coz when we tried it, we packed on more hot sauce and hot pepper. Maybe our tolerance is just higher. 

I had the STEAMED MILK CUSTARD. It was extemely good! Hit the spot at 1 AM. The only thing is I wish they put it in a more enclosed container so the heat stayed longer. Not that it needed too, wiped that thing so fast! 

My friend had STEAMED EGG CUSTARD, very hot. Similar presentation as Milk custard. I tasted a bit. Not too sweet which is good at that early in the AM. 

We got EGG PUFFS (2 orders), they were hot and they taste way better that way. There's actually some more freshly baked semi batter inside and not just air like other places. 

Last and not least, since we posted on FB and purchased at least $20, they gave us a waffle ice cream sandwich. And all that for approximately $23 for four people with tax.
author: Mkcc C.

description:
my table ordered 3 desserts and only 2 are ok: steamed milk with sweet rice/tapioca with mango

Clean place but not many service. I didn't get a refill on my tea. btw, the tea is pretty good.

Not sure if i will go back.. the quality of food is getting bad
author: Sue S.

description:
- Current special deal (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=ycOO6bXJXAnwuAibENJUhQ).
- Everyone gets a cup of hot tea, or water if requested (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=alWHDV5w15NL3oIOEa5jnw).
- The $2.50 hot milk tea (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=zIV9p2rRoB4l3mztQADifA) is my standard order.
- The glutenous balls in red bean "soup" (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=UbcCbaTLQGv6o-tTt6tQEg) was like VNese "che".
- FWIW, some friends always, always, order the strawberry ice cream waffle sandwich.
- The egg puffs are okay, not so much once it cooled off.
- The rice noodle rolls is pretty good. It comes with a Hoisin sauce and Sriracha dip.
- The pan-fried rice noodle rolls with XO sauce was just ok, not that special.
- Sampler platter (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=1U3riiH-bvPdh4-XpQtHzw) was on the dry side but was temperature-hot. It came with a couple of side dips; ranch and something Tabasco-like.

Average place for HK desserts (no, not because of the food/drinks, which are as good as anywhere): too busy late at night (omitted dirty tables); running lights above are like heat lamps; high-schoolers at times.

However, two reasons the place is top-of-mind when looking for healthy desserts: a) opens late and b) central location from anywhere in the City. But, go early if have a group and don't want to wait - before 10:45pm, as it's not crowded at those times (note, summer hours are until 2am every night).
author: Peter L.

description: I love their ice cream waffles, and any other dessert/snack/food they have here. I love their late hours too. Recently their sago and noodles don't have the same taste as I use to adore, but I still do love their ice cream waffles. They increased their deal with free waffle ice cream too, but I will always order that regardless. The service is pretty slow, which caused it to lose a star, and their workers are not so attentive. I remember sitting for awhile before they noticed we were trying to ask for the check to leave. Service could be better, but definitely love the late hours and dessert!
author: Amanda C.

description: Went for a late night dessert run... The sago was good but the glutinous balls with sesame were terrible.
author: Ozzy T.

description: Now this is the go to dessert place that my husband's family love to go to when we have rare chances to get together.  Also, when you check in you get a free dessert!  OH YEAH!  Go early though cause it gets packed!
author: Mary B.

description: If there was negative stars I would put it here. The dessert is at best mediocre. They advertise a free sundae waffle but do there best not to give this to you. Meaning having you order 30$ then tell you you are qualify to have it then run off ignoring your service. This place was lucky we gave tip. In addition to that the only place that has AC is the bathroom. The bathroom environment feels more comfortable than the whole restaurant. Everyone look like they were suffocating in a hot box. To summarize, mediocre desserts with extremely poor service. Not a good experience.
author: Baldwin W.

description: Loud place and slooooooooooooow service. I thought the menu was versatile, appetizing and the desserts I ordered were tasty. I started with a lemon tea (came mixed with honey) and a waffle sundae which came with a scoop of chocolate, vanilla and strawberry icecream and whipped cream.  (I added strawberries) The sundae was tasty and gone in under a minute. I wrapped the order up with the eggettes with nutella and whipped cream. Also devoured. The waiter was accommodating with the add ons I requested which was nice and the prices didn't alarm me. I would just recommend a swifter wait staff. I probably won't return.
author: Kristy F.

description: Great dessert place to hang out with good friends late at night. Their egg puff dessert is one of the best in SF!
author: Evan C.

description: I came here every week , my little brother love their ice cream , food looks very good and taste very good. And itis very cheap!!!!!
author: Sincere H.

description:
This place is such a joke. I still come and eat  here though,. but I laugh at myself every time I leave. 

SERVICE IS HORRIBLE. Horrible that I can't believe this place still gets business and they are so CHEAP with napkins, sauce, etc. 

But I know why everyone still comes, including myself,. they open late night and it's a place to hang out at if you don't want to be hanging at the bar.

I was so annoyed because now they start accepting credit cards. Awesome right?! So my party and I wanted to pay half the bill on the card and the rest in cash. IS THAT SO HARD TO DO? They said NO we can't do that, it has to be one or the other. Incompetent much? 

SMH everytime.
author: Chanel L.

description:
Great place for a variety of Asian desserts and drinks! The menu is quite extensive, but I think some dishes are probably better than others. We ordered the sesame soup balls, which were ok. The menu said that it would come in a paste, but it was more like some sort of watered down soup. You only get three balls in one order, which was a bit disappointing as well. The taste was passable though.

Also, they don't have pearl milk tea (surprisingly)! Is that not Cantonese enough? Considering all the other desserts they carry, you would think that they would also serve this popular drink. However, they do have HK milk tea and coffee/milk tea. The use a lot of condensed milk, which is definitely to my liking!

Other dishes I saw others ordering that looked potentially yummy were egg puffs (with condensed milk!) and what looked like an ice cream sundae dish in a hallowed out half a pineapple....will try to make it back again during happy hour to try some of their other Asian desserts!!
author: Audrey L.

description:
This place is alright, came here because it was the only place I could find that open till 2am 


I think there is a new owner? either that or everything got upgraded, including the new menu. The place def look very clean compare to the previous years when I used to come all the time. 

We got the egg puff, salt and pepper chicken wings, crispy chicken, ice cream waffle, and some other dessert I have no idea what it is called in English. 

the egg puff was burnt and super dry I will rate 3.5 stars but because I'm nice for the place opening such a late time i'll round it off to 4 stars
author: Calvin N.

description:
Only place that's nearby, had the porkchop, had the wings n fries, Mango n rice balls, mango n sago, egg puffs, soy bean drink, and waffle sundae, the steamed egg tart, and papaya dessert. 

All was just mediocre except the papaya and egg puffs were good. Service is bad (except for one guy) and cash only unless order over $10. 

Pros: free Internet and sometimes, TVB is on. The EGG PUFFS
Cons: the food and the service
author: Lily S.

description:
Typical Asian dessert place, but it's no Creations.

During my last visit, the service was very slow. Why have only one waiter during peak hours?? 

I usually order sago or gluttonous rice balls here. Last time, I ordered the mango sago with mixed fruits. Let's just say the watermelon wasn't so great. It was very bland.. but then again, it also wasn't in season. At least the sago base itself wasn't icy like it had been a couple times in the past. 

One thing I do like from their menu is the waffle ice cream. So good. 

Overall, I prefer Creations, but I wouldn't mind this place either. I just like Creations more. A LOT more.
author: Leslie C.

description:
Good things first:
- as per another yelper's review, I had the banana split waffle ice cream sandwich. Great choice.
- my cohort always gets the brick toast because it somewhat vaguely reminiscent of Guppy's. 

Not so good:
- I had the french toast my first time there. Don't do it unless you're looking for an inconspicuous method of prolonged suicide by way of coronary artery disease.
- I walked to the bathroom and passed the kitchen. Huge bag of chickens defrosting.... on the very dirty kitchen floor. Not a fan of salmonella creeping through the grid of grout. I wanted very much to vomit.
- Second, during a "I hope they redeem themselves visit," I saw room temperature eggs on the floor - granted they were in the thin cardboard egg crate. Maybe they should get a longer curtain for the kitchen, lol.

Considered very much to let them have a strike 3 opportunity with me and come back a third time - but they struck out that same night.
The bill came out to $9.66. Most places with a credit card minimum of $10 let it go, since it's "close enough." No, not them. They tried to force us to order more potentially hazardous food, but after reviewing the menu about ten more times I just asked if I could pay the difference - an extra $0.34. Tell me why they put $10.20 on the card?

Math's not my strong point, but come on. I'm not an asshole, I tipped them anyway. 

Here's another tip:
Food Safety regulations require food to be stored at a minimum height of 6" above the floor on a clean shelf. Defrosting poultry should either be in a bowl on the appropriate shelf on in the refrigerator at 41F or less, in a shallow bowl under cold running water in the prep sink, or defrosted as part of the cooking process [boiling water, roast pan in the oven, etc.].
author: Rosavida C.

description:
Arrived here at 11pm on a Saturday night, we had to wait maybe 10-15 mins for a table, but it wasn't too bad. There were only 2 visible servers. The female was pretty good and attentive, the male... not so much. We asked for our tea to be refilled about 10 times from the guy. He either kept getting distracted by other customers, or we'd see him with the tea pot and he'd pour for other tables, but not ours! 

Otherwise, the food was good as far as late night snacks go. We ordered 3 egg puffs from here, one of the mango/tapioca desserts, a honeydew smoothie, and some chicken and fries. The egg puffs were decent, but  they may have been a little overcooked, at least to me. I like the waffle-type texture, but these were a little too crunchy. Otherwise, since I was still hungry, the chicken and fries were pretty good, definitely satisfied the appetite.
author: Veronica C.

description:
04/13/2013

My friend with the same initials as I, introduced me to Kowloon Tong years ago. And till this day, this is among my favorite dessert houses in San Francisco.

Great place to hang out, chill, chat, and of course to eat anything sweet. They do offer savory food, but I think this place is better known for their desserts.

*Super Tortoise Jelly (watermelon & honey dew balls, mango, vanilla ice cream, and tortoise jelly) - a must have!

* Mango Sago - my friends favorite go to.

* Nutella Stuffed French Toast - no maple syrup needed, really delicious!

* Glutinous Balls (Tong Yuen) - really good.

I love that tea is continually refilled, and they don't rush you out. I feel bad sometimes knowing that I'll be there for at least an hour or so (it doesn't take that long to eat or drink anything), I don't mind ordering something / giving Kowloon Tong business.

Oh, one more thing, they finally accept credit / debit cards! That alone, won me over even if I've given Kowloon Tong the highest possible score.

YUM!
author: Alex C.

description:
Hong kong style dessert yumm!

Tips:
*Cash only
*High school/college students on break hang out. Lots of buds getting together or gals for drinks and desserts. 
*Very cozy little place. May have to wait for the table if you don't get here at the right time
*2 favorites: Waffle ice cream sandwich and the Super Mango Pudding were delicious!!
author: Betty C.

description: The dessert was sour.  I guess the coconut milk was overheated or milk was expired.  Anyway so far the dessert were not nice and not good experience at all.  I guess they have too many customers.  The food standard is turning down. Funny thing was... when we asked the waitress about that sour taste from.  She said maybe microwave 'ding' over-timed.  Oh no... that s why i give it 1 star.  That s even not fresh made? And no aplogize at all.  They seems like so mean to us.  We dont want to have food poison so asked them change it. Their faces were not nice to us.  Anyway I dont think so we will come back again.
author: Gayi L.

description:
Food it alright. 

Had a too friendly server. Do not order anything with a banana after you told him you have trouble deciding.
author: Jess W.

description: I usually come here for the late night desserts.  Coconut milk sago with a side order of egg puff is what I usually get.  Hot or cold it hits the spot.  The only thing I don't really like about this place is the employees arrogance or cockiness.  Its like exactly the same in Hong Kong.
author: Domino P.

description: Best place for cheap eats around Inner Richmond. They don't open until afternoon, but they don't close until early morning! I've had everything from the Mango Sago to the different kind of noodles, and have never been disappointed! If you're looking for amazing food, you're barking up the wrong tree, but the service people are nice and the place is great for midnight hunger with friends. It's got a lot of traffic from local USF students though, so expect a crowd! You may have to wave a server over when it does get busy, but they're always polite to accomodate.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Amongst the various Dessert places/late night asian food places in San Francisco, I've been a loyal fan of Kowloon Tong since years ago. Why do i love this place so much? Besides the fact I love late night dessert, it's a good place to socialize with friends and hang out.

Food:
I'd recommend trying a bunch of stuff there:
1) Strawberry sago: I am a big fan of strawberry and if you like strawberries, I'd recommend the strawberry sago. It is served with strawberries and sago pearls (mini tapioca balls except they taste much lighter and you can just slurp them up like a vacuum cleaner). It has a not too sweet and not too plain taste and serves as a light, refreshing dessert.

2) Egg Puffs: Yea, typical, I know but they taste even better when you drizzle all that condensed milk on it.

3) Ramen: They offer a variety of noodle choices paired with toppings. My personal favorite is the spicy instant noodle with luncheon meat (this is not the same as spam) and fried egg (come on, of course you need a fried egg in your ramen!). It has that delicious sodium-filled taste that makes you want to eat it even after a huge dinner with a minor kick to boot (this can vary depending on how wel you take spicy).

4) Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich: Usually when i go, I go with a group of friends and we do a facebook check in (spend 20$ or more dollars and you get one for free). It is a literally waffle sandwich with ice cream of your choice in the middle divided into 4 usually equal pieces. The waffle has that good savory taste to it paired with the sweet taste of the ice cream.

Random notes: This place gets packed on Friday and Saturday betwwen 10 and 1 (for one, this place is open longer than a majority of the dessert places around the area and everyone just loves getting late night food/dessert in the city) so be prepared to either get their earlier or wait.

Recommended? Yes, I'd highly recommend going at least once in your life and you may find yourself there on a weekly basis afterwards.
author: Dylan T.

description: Good place to hang with friends after dinner or just to meet for a casual outing. Try the sundae waffles, ice cream waffle sandwiches, mango sago, and taro in coconut milk with sticky rice (a hot dessert that warms you up on a cold day). Service can be a little slow, but not bad if you are not in a hurry.
author: Lyndi S.

description: Kowloon Tong's location is nice especially if you're having a craving because its in the middle of the neighborhood and is open pretty late. Their ice cream is average. We got green tea, mango, and vanilla served in the waffles and in a banana split. The service was fine. It was packed but they do their best. I would definitely come back to see what their pudding desserts are all about!
author: Jaclyn N.

description:
1 star for service 
1st No one greeted us 
2nd waiter brought tea over with an attitude 
3rd
We asked about the free ice cream waffle with yelp checkin. Waiter said the bill has to be over 20$ to get the free waffle and he wasn't sure. Then we ordered one more dessert than we would have and thinking ok it's over 20$ then we asked again. Waiter said oh no we can't because it has to be over 25$

Umm... Ok... Why didn't you just make sure that it has to be over 25 in the first place rather than telling us something you are not sure of. 

-3 star for desserts
We ordered glutinous balls, mango sago, steamed milk w/ purple rice, mango pudding.

Steamed milk was the best among all the things we ordered. The rest were just ok. 

The glutinous balls were on the hard side, wasn't as chewy as I expected.

Pudding taste like those made with pudding powders that you get from ranch 99.  

Mango sago had too much mango syrup on the top.
author: anni h.

description: I like this place with great deserts.  I like the taro coconut & black sweet rice with coconut.  We will come back again, but need to prepare to find parking
author: Bob D.

description:
Came here with some friends for some dessert one night.

The weirdest thing I found at this place was that they charge different prices for hot and cold drinks. Cold drinks are actually MORE. That made no sense to me. Are they charging us for the water and energy it takes to make ice or something, yet aren't charging us for the energy needed to take warm up a drink. Odd much? How Asian can you be to charge for EVERYTHING?
author: edward k.

description:
Hands down Kowloon is the best dessert place in the Richmond District! I have been to this place twice, one because it was open late night and the second time just to try it out again.

The first time I went around 12am, nearing their closing time, but they still managed to squeeze us in. Even when it was past 12 they still didn't kick us out!

The second time I went with a group of 7 people and we ended up ordering 3 waffle sundaes and 1 milk tea. I guess business was kinda busy because they messed up our order so we ended up getting 2 waffle sundaes and 5 milk teas. We told the owner and he made a jokingly said he would rather drink all of it and puke than give it to us for free. He ended up giving us the drinks on the house, how sweet!

Most of the stuff here are great for late night snacking, especially since the prices are super inexpensive. I would order one of everything if I could!

Definitely a must every time I hit up the Richmond!
author: Olivia B.

description:
The ultimate neighborhood place to be at! I'd say I'm a pretty regular here since it's so close, but everything about it makes it the perfect HK place to be at: the food, the service (and staff there), the chill atmosphere, and of course the tv that continually plays authentic HK shows. It's a good place to go if you just want to chill or hang out, have dessert, or even if you don't know where to go!

They open late so they do late lunch/dinner and of course desserts. Their EGG PUFFS is probably the best ones you'll find in SF, unless you're into the doughy/thick ones, which isn't what egg puffs are supposed to be like.

Note that the later it gets the more crowded it becomes, so get there late, but not too late. They can accommodate large groups and couples which is a plus, and if you have a group you can even gets deals by checking in at yelp!

I rarely review anything on yelp, but this is my favorite neighborhood place, and is worth checking out
author: Allen L.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, and I'd have to say that the first thing that upsets me is that it's understaffed. It gets quite busy during the late night.

The last time I came here, I was with a table of 7 girls. Some of us got our orders in a good amount of time, but most of us got ours like 30 minutes later. Again... they're pretty understaffed. I understand that the economy sucks, but geeze, one person serving all tables? 

I got the waffle sundae. It was okay, but considering the wait it wasn't that worth it. I've been here on several other occasions when it wasn't super busy but even so, their desserts aren't magnificent. They're only okay. All in all, I'd come back, but it wouldn't be on top of my list.
author: Sheila X.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ Good Service

- Cash Only

[W] So today we found out something quite interesting. For all you "Snow Frog" lovers out there we finally figured out its secret. It has nothing to do with snow and probably nothing with frogs either. Mona always loves eating the Snow Frog dessert but we were both wondering what the heck it actually is. So we called the waiter over and asked him to explain to us what it is. He asked us if he should explain it in Cantonese or English and we said it doesn't really matter. Luckily he explained in English because if all those Chinese people were listening in, it probably would've grossed them out. 

So....getting to the point, Snow Frog is actually a fa.....lo....pi....an....tube haha. Now, when the waiter was explaining that to us, I actually had to have him repeat himself literally 3 times before Mona was like "he said FALOPIAN TUBE" haha. Now it kind of makes sense since when you look at the actual dish, it's soft and clear. The waiter didn't really tell us which animal it was actually from. No wonder why they always took so long to prepare this dessert dish. I was telling Mona, "maybe when you order 'Snow Frogs', the cook is in the back is gutting a dead woman for her tube" haha. Kinda disgusting but that was my first thought. I'm glad they call it "Snow Frog" because nobody wants an order of fallopian tube lol. 

Now you guys know the secret of Snow Frog desserts so uhm Happy Eating? So uhm 3 stars for me but 3.5 because I got a good laugh. 

[M] The purpose of this review is to gross you all out so that I can have all the Snow Frogs to myself! Wahahha~ no I'm kidding :P My favorite is the Snow Frog with Coconut Milk.  It's really good but this place doesn't give as much "Snow Frogs" as Golden Island does, and it's more expensive here too. You should really give these fallopian tubes a try! :D
author: Mona C.

description: The food here is mediocre. Got the mango sago with glutinous rice balls. Definitely like the one from creations more. They made a mistake with our order and gave us something we didn't order but they fixed it immediately which I really appreciate.
author: Celia Y.

description: Very average cha chan ting. ice cream sandwich was not bad but.. i can probably get this anywhere else. Prices are a bit high and decor is whatever. Don't really understand why people would line up for this place but to each their own.
author: Ruby C.

description:
After dinner with 2 of my girl friends this past weekend, I was so excited to go to Candybar here in SF for drinks and dessert. But they happened to be closed on this particular Sunday, when they are normally opened. I was super bummed out! 

As a result, we ended up at Kowloon Tong Dessert for your typical Hong Kong style desserts.

Our server for the evening was Alvin.  Normally I dismiss servers at these HK dessert places as they normally don't care about service, but Alvin is an acception to this stereotype.  He noticed the three of us taking pictures of each other and cheerfully offered to take a picture for us.  

While I'm not big on HK desserts, I settled instead my usual: The Waffle Sundae.  Joy and I shared this thing as it's clearly enough for 2-3 people.  It comes with 5 to 6 pieces of Waffle triangles and 3 different flavors of Ice Cream. We opted for the Green Tea, Strawberry and Mango flavor, and ordered it without whip cream.  

Candice ordered the Coconut Sago with Tapoica and the three of us shared an order of Egg Puffs.  

Egg Puffs are my favorite here with a nice vanilla flavor, and not overly doughy for my preference.  They also had a nice crunch to them as well that night. 
  
Our Sundae arrived--only to notice that it had whip cream, when we requested for it without.  We flagged down Alvin.  He quickly and sympathetically apologized and offered to have another made for us.  He also asked if we wanted to keep the present sundae, which was declined.  But this is definitely a first for me.  

I've had my share of negative experiences in Asian restaurants where they continue to pursuade you to keep the order or fight you to get you to believe it was your fault for not mentioning, or something of the sort.  But Alvin was so accomodating, and made sure our order was correct the next time around, and sure enough it was.  

My only complaint about the Waffle Sundae, is that the ice cream seemed to be topped with some sort of nasty crushed burnt peanuts which really ruined the sweetness for me.  But other than this, I enjoyed my sundae.

Candice on the other hand, with her Coconut Sago and Tapipoca found her dessert unedible.  It was so bland and bitter with absolutely no coconut flavor.  Rather, it tasted of plain warm milk with tapoica.  She found it more pleasureable to try to see if she could take all of the tapioca balls out of her dessert just for the fun of it, as only one taste of it was enough for her.  Silly girl! 

Service on this particular night was truly great for the first time here.  Both Alvin and the other server working that night were very friendly and continously refilled our hot tea.  We also found out that it was Alvin's first day working at Kowloon Tong, so I quickly praised him for the wonderful job he was doing!

All in all, while I was really excited about our original plans to go to Candybar for dessert, I had an awesome time chit chatting it up with my friends here.
author: Cass J.

description: the service here has kind of gone down hill. super long waits to get your check and super long waits for your food :(
author: Nancy W.

description:
I been here lots ... Great place to basically just hang out after work or just kinda relax and eat sweets ... 

Its always pretty much packed, with a bunch of different conversations going on all over the place but that's what makes this place what it is... 

Service is not to bad espcially for the ground that they have to cover ... food comes out quick and is, most of the time, very good and it hits the spot ... price is very moderate as well ..
 
The menu is huge! I try to try a little bit of everything but being a white boy who grew up in New Jersey I have no idea what half the stuff is I just point at what looks, or sounds good and go for it ... most of the time I enjoy the new texture or flavor of whatever I pick .. but for sure the toast, waffles, shakes, noodles, and custards are very good ... 

Definitely a place to go back to, and great now I'm hungry again ...
author: Anthony S.

description:
A fairly average place, but my friends like to come here often because it has a lot of space for larger parties (we've come here with ~10 people and usually seated within minutes) and it is open till late. They also have real food and desserts so a little bit of something for everyone.

I usually opt for the ice cream waffle sandwich because I'm a huge sucker for ice cream and anything ice cream related. The ice cream isn't the most amazing out there, nor is it awful though. It's fairly standard. The waffle is similar to an eggo waffle, and the texture of the sandwich with the ice cream is really good. I like getting the green tea flavor, but you can choose up to 2 flavors to share. They cut the sandwich 4 ways. 

My friends like to get other things, and they usually seemed satisfied with their picking. 

Protip, they also have a special if you check in on yelp or facebook and spend a minimum, you get a free waffle ice cream sandwich!
author: Lena Y.

description: I've always been a fan of Hong Kong Style desserts because they don't overflow sugar and butter into their treats like american cakes and cookies.We got a grass jelly dish and fruit dish, which was  tasty and refreshing but I really loved the waffle with fruit and ice cream A perfectly lightly sweetened treat that flowed together so well!  They give you free tea and this place is open untili think 1 AM  for the night owls.  It's the perfect place to visit if you're craving an (almost) guiltless dessert!
author: Kelly S.

description: The waffle was pretty good. Nice and crispy. Haven;t tried the other food yet.
author: Jacqueline N.

description: Ok gave 5 stars, but first be warned that the food isn't great, but it's acceptable. I give it 5 stars for it's price, location and how late they are open. Service every time I've gone has been okay, not great, but just okay. It's a good cheap hole in the wall place mainly for dessert, so to me it's 5 stars because it's a good bang for your buck place.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
I came here the other night with some friends. The place was really busy. 

I ordered a Green Tea milkshake. It was creamy but was lacking a lot of green tea flavor. 

Everyone that went had fun though.
author: Eric M.

description: This place is terrible! Bad Service! Took an hour for my friends to get their stuff, and i got was shaved ice! SHAVED ICE! How long does it take to make shaved ice....RIDICULOUS i tell you. Ended up canceling my order since it didnt come out yet. NEVER WILL I RETURN HERE!
author: Mark P.

description:
It's 1 am in SF and we're hungry. Where to go?
Kowloon Dessert Cafe.

Upon entering the cafe for the first time and looking at the menu, my jaw dropped as I saw the long list of desserts and salty goodies.

"um... Can I one of everything, please?" was my initial thought.

It was quite overwhelming at first, deciding what to pick. Thankfully, the waiters were very patient and smiled as they immediately gave us free tea. Bonus points.

After much deliberation (and I had quite a dilemma here!), I finally chose a mango flavored cold dessert with sticky rice and a variety of fruit. It was pretty good so I ate that thing in a couple of bites. Afterwards, my friends and I shared the popcorn chicken which tasted funky. The chicken wasn't cooked thoroughly and it wasn't crispy enough. Don't get the chicken here. Also, the waiter somehow lost one of my friend's order, which he didn't receive until 10 minutes later.

Kowloon Tong is a great place when you're out late with friends with nothing to do. Food wasn't too spectacular, but really good when you're craving for something sweet late at night.
author: Janet H.

description: Service is fast and food is cheap and good. Owner is an amazing guy who owns another dessert place on ocean ave. Been here a bunch of times and will be back more
author: Emily L.

description:
I'll give them props for being open on the day after a big holiday unlike some other bigger dessert cafes around the neighborhood.

I still LOVE the ice cream waffle sandwiches. But I didn't have it on this particular day. I ordered a mango sago with coconut milk and was disappointed. I prefer more coconut milk mixed in with mango puree. But the mango pieces itself were very sweet! I think Creations and Golden Island cafe still wins with their mango sago. Golden Island may put a bit too much ice sometimes though.

The condensed milk and peanut butter toast was okay. I must be too spoiled by the toast I get at Guppy's Tea House down SoCal!

Service was great though!
author: Samantha L.

description: Had walked by this street a bunch of times before my friend introduced us to this place. Great place for a quick dessert.
author: Sara Z.

description:
Summary: Fun casual place for dessert w/ friends.

I've come here a few times. The place is always fairly busy, and the desserts have always been pretty good. Fun place to hang out with friends.

Would come again.
author: Gary Y.

description:
tip: check the walls or yelp for check-in offers

lots of dessert combinations to choose from (sago, fruits, black sticky rice, fruit purees, etc.) 

came here about 8-9 years ago, and most recently 4/2012.  good to see this joint still holding up.  there's a loyal following here so expect crowds at night.
author: Jacky K C.

description: I can't seem to get enough of their Waffle Ice Cream sandwich!  It's ice cream, sandwiched between 2 waffles...so simple! yet sooooo good.  The waffle is nice and crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  I don't know what kind of ice cream they use, but the strawberry is creamy and delicious!
author: Thien N.

description:
My best friend and I usually come here once every three months when we have a big sweet tooth. For this reason, we both get their ice cream sundaes, which in my opinion is better than the ice cream sandwiches. It's top with whipped cream if you're fan of that. The waffles are pretty crispy, unlike other places have soggy waffles. The choice of ice cream flavors are usually, strawberry, green tea and mango. I believe they have chocolate too, but I never get that. 

Word of advice if you're in  big group don't bother coming because the place isn't that big and a lot of teenagers go there. Also, the service isn't bad at all, but the desserts take a while to come out.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I come here for a late night dessert stop and I usually only get ice cream with waffles. Their ice cream is soooo delicious and doesn't feel out of a carton at all. But the waffles, I could probably get the same taste from an eggo. 

As for their shaved ice--it's more like shards of ice. Service is kind of slow, even when it's not busy. But I do enjoy the tea they give you in [usually] cute cups. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but if it's on the way, why not!
author: Sheri N.

description:
This is a place I frequent often with my friends as we live nearby. I don't think there's anything special about this place compared to other dessert restaurants. Everything is extremely affordable and the atmosphere is great to catch up with old friends or just kill time. Most of the servers know Chinese, which is always a plus if you feel more comfortable speaking Chinese. 

BEWARE: Long lines at peak hours and horrendous parking. Look for Yelp Check-In deals!!
author: Steven T.

description: when i heard deep fried french toast, my hopes were high. Not quite sure what I was expecting, but I have to say I was a bit underwhelmed by it...I'm a big fan of peanut butter but this was unimpressive. It's hard to explain but nothing bout it stood out...
author: Alexander L.

description:
My friends and I have been to most of asian dessert place in the city, and I'd say that this is one of my favorites. You can't go wrong with any of the ice cream sandwiches (my friends and i love to order multiple flavors and share), and the peanut butter toast with condensed milk is really good as well. 

The only thing that has been missing nowadays is one of the workers, Brandon. It has been awhile since my friends and I last saw him! We're all pretty sad when we visit and not see him working because he was such an amazing worker (really nice, a people person, and basically knows customer service!). After the first time he served us, we bumped our chests with our fists and threw out a peace sign to him as we left (yeah, we're kind of weird like that haha). But hey, he actually did it back! :D
author: Kirsten H.

description: The best egg puff ive ever had. But other than that this place is eh.....not that many variety or atleast not that many things that i wanna try. Didnt really like the sago thing and the waffle ice cream sandwich is just normal, nothing special
author: Jenny N.

description: I love that they're open late!! Perfect for late night dessert cravings! I had their red bean mochi ball, mango sago, egg puffs and fried chicken. Oh my lawwd. I looooove fried chicken and anywhere with delish fried chicken is sure to be a destination I'll think about and return to haha. I honestly think this place has got to be one of the best sago places in SF. Try it for yourself! They even take card, which is a plus because lots of dessert places are cash only. :)
author: Jenn T.

description:
If you're looking for a variety of desserts (waffles, ice cream, pudding, grass jelly, fruits, etc.), drinks (juices, tea, milkshakes, etc.) or just an afternoon or late-night snack (sandwiches, noodle soups, chicken wings, fries, etc.) this is the place to go!  The prices are very affordable and the service is decent. It gets quite crowded after 10pm since they're open until 1 or 2am, but not in the daytime (opens around 3pm). Don't park in the Smart and Final parking lot or you'll get towed. You can easily find parking a block away on Geary.

Reviews (what I've tried):

SNACKS:
Egg Puff - $2.50 
     (crunchy edges but soft center, made almost perfectly!)
Peanut Butter and Condensed Milk Toast - $2.50 
     (I think they actually make this with a waffle and not toast, which is even better! definitely worth the cost of it.)
Deep Fried Chicken Wings - $4.95
     (very good! not TOO oily.)

NOODLES:
Fried Egg & Lunch Meat (a.k.a Spam) Macaroni  - $4.25
     (good for a snack but may not be enough as a meal...nonetheless, it's good for it's price. Instead of Macaroni, you can also choose instant noodles, soup rice noodles, fried noodles, fried rice noodles ($1 extra), or spicy instant noodles.) 

HOT DESSERTS:
Steamed Milk Pudding - $3.50
     (this one was definitely just average. I've had better. It also takes awhile to make...I waited over 20 mins for my order of this.)
Coconut Milk Black Sticky Rice - $3.50
     (this one is also average but it might just be due to my lack of enthusiasm for black sticky rice.)
Homemade Peanut Tea - $3.50
Homemade Almond Tea - $3.50
      (All the "homemade" teas do not really taste homemade. They taste more like the instant powder packets you buy at the store. Regardless, they still taste good but may not be worth it's price since you can make this at home.)

COLD DESSERTS:
Mango Go Go - $4.25
     (delicious! very fresh tasting!)
Waffle Sundae (over the Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich) - $4.95
     (I definitely recommend this one! Comes with 4 pieces of waffles and a bowl of ice cream. Share with a friend unless you're really hungry.)
Mixed Fruit with Mango Puree (w/Grass Jelly) - $4.25
     (Another recommendation of mine! It's healthy and the fruits are very fresh! The best part is the puree! Instead of Grass Jelly, you can also choose sago, black sticky rice, or little glutinous balls.)
  
FRESH JUICE:
Watermelon Juice - $3.25 (current special: $1.95)
     (made from real watermelons so it's very fresh!)

Overall, I would recommend ordering cold desserts over the hot ones.  The snacks are also delicious! Best of all, everything on the menu is quite cheap!
author: Angela F.

description:
I love love love this joint for late night dessert menu. 

Their waffle ice cream is amazing as it comes with the ice cream of you choice. They have green tea ice cream! The hot crunchy waffles melt the ice cream such that it becomes an ooey gooey goodness. 

And their rice crepes is good too. Pan fried to a warm perfection. And it comes with 2 delectable sauces of hoisin and peanut.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I want to thank whoever took me here first.  In all honesty, I'm not exactly sure WHO that WHO was, but you deserve a BIG hug and kiss.

NEW developments:
-NOW TAKE CREDIT/DEBIT CARDS!!!!
-New things on the menu (just noticed 4 new SAVORY dishes on the menu 10/20/2011)


So bullet pointed review.  

What I like:
-HK style cafe with lots of things to eat, both sweet & savory
-number of cold and hot desserts
-OPEN late
-Staff is really nice
-restrooms are clean (yah, I'm a germaphobe)

Some not so pleasant things:  
-No true waiting area and the place can get busy, which is not so nice during really a) cold and b) rainy weather.
-loud (sometimes conversation is difficult)
-BUSY  I mean busy.
-parking is hit or miss in this area depending upon TIME

Some suggested dishes:
Mango Madness
Condensed Milk Toast
Egg Puffs
Milk Custard (with coconut sticky rice)

Dessert price ranges anywhere from $4-5 ...and appetizer like snack food at about the same price.

Nom Nom Nom
author: Hiromi N.

description: Not bad, lots of the desserts that my parents would give me when I was little and a few other ones that as a I didn't try as a kid.  On the most part not bad, and really quick.  Really good for that sweet tooth fix without feeling guilty about over indulging later.  Love that it's open late at night too.
author: Christine W.

description:
One of my favorite dessert places!!

Not a bad location, great parking...not really much to say. Compare to others I've been to, this one just stands out to me.

Mixed Fruits Strawberry Puree Sago
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MghLPYkUVwScN1fdoBZPKw/l

HK Style Waffle w/ Peanut Butter & Condense Milk
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/rEQxQs6TH4ISDfI_Ih19Rg/l

(Monday, August 24, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description: Delight! Ice cream with fruit and grass jelly. Most appetizers and desserts they serve here is yummy. Like the fact they come around and give us nice hot tea consistently. Customer service is pretty good here too.
author: mui d.

description:
For late night cravings, Kowloon Tong does the job. Fairly uncrowded and quick service. My boyfriend and I came around 11 at night on a Friday and shared a mango ice cream dish, egg puffs, and popcorn chicken. All were great, save the chicken. Too much starch, not enough spice let alone chicken. 

Come here when everything else is closed and you have a asian dessert craving that you just can't shake off.
author: Patricia Q.

description: Love to drop by every once a while. Great late night snack that is a mix between traditional and modern Asian desserts. I love the egg puffs here!
author: Jannet H.

description: I have been coming here since college and always good quality HK style dessert and good customer service!
author: William C.

description:
Date/Time:  Saturday - 9:30pm
Occasion:  Continuing the birthday celebration
Party of:  Nine
Location:  Bright little dessert place on the corner in the Richmond hood.  Fobby music videos playing.  Limited seating.
Ordered:  Mango Sago and chicken wings
Total incl gratuity: ~$?

Great place to go to after dinner or if you're simply in the mood for some fobby times and asian desserts.  So, what would a girl nostalgic of her Hong Kong adventures order?  Sago, of course!!  When I looked over the menu, the bestie and I were ecstatic to see the sago on there.  The mango sago was a must!  When it arrived, it was icy sago goodness -  perfect, chilled, and not overly sweet.  A little different from HK but nonetheless good.  (Man...I am so missing HK right now!)

Anyway, the BF ordered chicken wings, which is kinda strange because we had just finished dinner.  Although, I do have to say that I am glad he did.  I got to try their hot and crispy wings.  Definitely a must order.  Give it a few minutes before you dig in because they come right out of the fryer and the dripping oil will burn your fingers.  Otherwise, they are delicious.  The meat is juicy and moist and they are fried to perfection.

They are open till 1am so a great place to go just to hang out with friends and munch on some goodies.
author: Jess C.

description:
If you're looking for a late night hangout, consider coming here. I've had their fruit sago's and eggettes. Both are terrific if you are looking for something light.  If you enjoy home style desserts but don't want to take the time out to make it yourself, this is the perfect place for you.

The environment is suitable for children and roomie enough if you have a stroller. Enjoy something sweet!
author: Kristina S.

description: one of the best Chinese sweet dessert place in the city, the staff is very friendly. not only the dessert is good, Also excellent fry chicken and soy sauce chicken.  the sweet walnut is puree is excellent
author: Ed Y.

description:
My search for the best Chinese dessert place in SF brought me to Kowloon Tong.  My progress so far: Golden Island (Outer Sunset) has inched out My Favorite Café (Outer Richond) as my actual favourite café. I was really excited to see how this place compares. On first impression, the décor is not as modern as Golden Island, but also not as dingy as My Favorite Café.

While it took second in terms of the décor, food-wise it's a distant third. My mom and I shared a HK-style waffle, HK-style French toast, black sesame glutinous balls in black sesame paste, and an egg custard with coconut milk and black sticky rice.

The HK-STYLE WAFFLE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=dwAkwX5ah5LUSLo7ljUr0g) was filled with peanut butter and condensed milk (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=am0awgm_JZpTBUBXfffFFQ), one of my favourite food combos. There was a decent amount of both and the ratio was perfect. The waffle itself was very crispy/crunchy, which can be a good or bad thing depending on what you like, but I prefer mine with a touch of softness.

The FRENCH TOAST was pretty good and had a really nice golden eggy crust (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=g6LZYfaAoeaa59Wg9Gmz1A). They use one slice of thick bread instead of two thinner ones with kaya jam in the middle, so it needed a lot of syrup for moisture.

From the Yelp pictures, their BLACK SESAME PASTE looked really good. The pics must've been touched up by Mariah Carey's photoshoppers though because in person it was lacklustre (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=IR8bY8Sfp7EpnMV_-em8GQ). Instead of being densely black in colour, this one was slightly translucent and looked like it was made from a mix. Although I'm pretty sure they make it from scratch, they definitely don't use enough black sesame seeds so the flavour wasn't very strong. But, at least it wasn't too sweet. The SESAME BALLS (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=Fs81IFxLa7fRizSV_ZHPtA) could've used more black sesame too. There was too much dough and not enough filling :(

The most disappointing was the EGG CUSTARD. Blandest custard ever! No coconut milk flavour and (I can't believe I'm saying this) could've used more sugar. The crunch from the black sticky rice at the bottom was nice though (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ?select=LlckTpv2YSghYh-fTfEWJQ) and the custard itself had a really nice creamy consistency (maybe from the coconut milk?)

Overall, it was OK. It's just not as good as MFC or Golden Island.
author: Steph L.

description: Their ice cream sandwich was okay. I think there's nothing special about it. And also, We ordered fried squids and she only gave us one dried squid. The customer service sucks too...
author: Yuri S.

description: They have the best fried chicken wings, waffle ice cream sandwiches, and egg puffs! I've been going to this dessert place for years and is still one of my favorite dessert places. However, I can't give them 5 stars because their sago with mixed fruit has really gone down hill. There are more coconut milk then fruit puree and the lack of mixed fruit on top is depressing. I remember when they use to pile plenty of fresh fruit on top and made it really worth it. Sad, that is why I no longer order it and just order the top three items I listed earlier.
author: Cindy C.

description: grapefruit mango with sago is one of the worst in Bay Area. Too much ice, not proper amount of sago, poorly cut fruits. Entire things not properly blended. Emm need to try somewhere else.
author: Miranda P.

description:
came here for a late afternoon date
