the place seems nice, avg customer service ...

we ordered quite a lot for 2 people and had take-out for the leftover
Alike other places, it was crowded ..
author: Ngoc N.

description: Typical HK dessert restaurant. I've been here so many times but the past 2times it wasn't up to expectation anymore for some reason. My fav usually mango sago when mangoes in season. Egg puffs usually good but I have to ask for condensed milk on the side or else it would taste pretty bland. I personally love their chicken wings, always crispy outside and moist with flavors inside.
author: Myy T.

description: Love their Asian desserts. I try to stop by whenever I'm in the area. I usually go for the egg puffs and the sesame balls
author: Lien N.

description: Came with 12 friends for the first time to try this place out, This was around residential area making it a little complicated to spot, but we got there. When We first arrived we saw the cafe, it was very little but, one of my friends recommended to us saying it was a great place to chill with good desserts so we did and the desserts were average pretty much..This place is almost equivalent to Oakland's Shooting Star Cafe I recommend that place to anyone! If you're around SF this would be the place to go to for desserts!
author: Winniethepooh C.

description:
The waffle ice cream sandwich was good! Their many assortments of mango desserts are pretty good too. Everything is reasonably priced (around the usual price of other dessert cafes).

It gets a bit crowded at night, especially on the weekends. Service isn't too bad, but sometimes it's a bit slow.
author: Angela W.

description: Mango Sago. That's all you need to know. Can be busy at times and service varies depending on the person. You walk in, get seated, they bring tea and you order. Pretty simple. It's average cleanliness. I don't bother with the other stuff but I hear it's alright but I just go for sago.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Late night snack craving! This place is packed with not only Asian desserts but Asians in general. 

This is a good hot/cold Asian type of desserts for you. Lots of items on their menu from smoothies, sago, egg puff to steamed milk/egg custard. 

I had the steamed milk custard with ginger juice and it taste like tofu.

I took a star off since this is the type of place where they don't refill your tea or water, it's only available upon request.
author: Haley C.

description:
We went there on a Saturday night, and the place was like "packed sardines". No room to sit  no room to stand! So we decided to take our order to go, which still took a while given the amount of people in the restaurant. 

The desserts and beverages we order were great, just what we needed on a late night ins SF. The waiter who took are order was nice and quick.The location of the restaurant is by itself, without other restaurant near by, in additional in its a dark quite street, so you'll see the only restaurant light up on the block. Other parts of the block its more residential homes.

Overall, I would come back, and will try to find a not-so-busy time to return to sit down and eat!
author: Paulie L.

description:
Two stars for the good past, minus three for the terrible present.

So my friend and I wanted to get dessert after our terrible dinner experience and decided to go to Kowloon Tong, since it is such a great place for dessert (especially the waffle sundae). 

However today...worse experience ever. Let me start with the good though...

The strawberry and banana smoothie= pretty good. Expensive ($3.75) for the size of it though...

Now onto the dessert I ordered. Red bean glutinous rice ball with coconut milk taro sago. The coconut milk and taro of it was totally bleh! I honestly cannot describe the odd texture of it; it's like they just use powder or something to make it (and I've had sago many times for FREE at restaurants and it didn't taste this bad). The worse part though was...

THERE WAS HAIR IN TWO OF MY GLUTINOUS BALLS. Now, I'm generally the type of person who pushes the hair to the side and continue with my meal cause whatever, just one small piece of hair right?

NO! This thing had a WHOLE LONG STRAND of hair in it! I bit half of it and as I was pulling the other half away from my mouth, I couldn't because of the hair that kept it together! Okay, whatever, just one bad one. Onto the next one, BAM! Another piece of hair in it. What the hell? 

The waitress working at that time mostly overlooked everyone unless they 1). Just came in or 2). were about to leave. Finally, another worker came in and I called his attention to the problem. He said he'll tell someone about it. Okay...he goes and whispers something to his coworker who only smirks/smiles and does NOTHING. So I stared at her like...are you kidding me?!? She finally got the hint, I suppose, walked over and asked if I wanted another serving to make up for it?

Uh...okay, dude honestly. If you went to a restaurant and you discovered TWO LONG PIECES of hair in your food, would you want another serving of it? Probably not because there's a huge chance that there might be hair in that plate also!

I don't think I'll be coming back here again...not for a long long time any ways. Terrible experience.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
One star because this place has good and friendly service. My friends and I went there for a quick dessert a couple of weekends ago. We were seated off to the side of the cafe. The seating area was pretty cozy, not too claustrophobic, and the noise level was perfect.

Another star because we ordered egg puffs, a waffle sundae, and sago, and all three were delicious. The egg puffs were light and not too heavy, the fruit in the sago was yummy, and the waffle ice cream definitely satisfied the sweet tooth craving.

Add another star because the tea was light, not too overpowering for a simple drink, and perfect with any of the items on the menu (even the ice cream).

And yet another star because the waiter was pretty amusing. He was attentive, friendly, conversational, and a little weird... but weird enough to warrant another star for this review...

The last star also goes out to the waiter, because he also told my friends and I that he was growing out his beard to be like Brian Wilson and not trimming it for a long while. Not too shabby, since I just went there again yesterday and it seems like he's keeping his word about it.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Poor service- forgot to put in order on a slow night. Couldn't even get two waters to the table. Had to repeatedly ask for it. No apology for forgetting.
author: Angela A.

description: After stuffing ourselves at Off the Grid, we headed here on the way back to my sister's apartment. Around 8pm, the place was deserted. We ordered the mango go-go, mixed fruit ice cream waffle sandwich, milk tea, and citron honey tea. The milk tea was good, but tasted more like sugar than tea. The ice cream sandwich was very good! It was one giant waffle cut in half, stuffed with lots of bright pink ice cream that had frozen and fresh fruits. In the picture, we all thought it would be really fake fruits, since the ice cream was extremely artificially coloured. It was bright as Pepto Bismol, but good thing it didn't taste like it! I had a piece of it and was even more stuffed than before. So when my mango go-go came, I only had a few spoonfuls. It had large chunks of fresh mango, tapioca, and pomelo in coconut soup. Delish, but I took 90% of it home. My sister liked her citron honey tea too. All this was about $20 after tax and tips.
author: Leslie P.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Strawberry paradise thing or was it Strawberry Passion?= watermelon juice strawberry ice cream, bits of shaved ice chips, melon ball, watermelon ball, strawberry, mango :) Perfect combination. 
2.) Mango madness equiv was not as satisfactory to me.. gon stick to the strawberry one :)

SERVICE:
Table service, but HK cafes make me feel bad for them bc they give free bottomless free tea, so they hafta refill it constantly. They run around for not much pay. Buuut yea I do love the bottomless tea. This place has been pretty attentive, except this one time. But I'm guessing it's just a one time thing. The guy prolly had a really long night. Also I love how they open so dang late!!! 

ATMOSPHERE:
Very casual...just a lowkey hk dessert/cafe :) 1030
author: Angela L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! You can find me here more then.. well any other dessert place.

The ramen is good! The eggettes is GREAT! The service is amazing! ;)
author: Kalok L.

description:
my fave dessert spot. i come here every week!

there is something for everyone. hot desserts, cold desserts, noodles, ramen, egg puffs, sago, ice cream.

must i go on? just go and visit this place.
author: Cicely T.

description: Really good eggettes and steamed milk
author: C Y.

description:
Typical asian dessert spot. The wait here is extremely long on weekends. Portions are small and the food/dessert isn't all that great. I normally order the strawberry madness because to me, that seems the the best bang for the buck( Asian dessertwise). 

Service here is EXTREMELY slow. One would think, why would it take so long to throw a couple scoops of ice cream, cut up some fruits, and throw it on a plate? Multiple times, they've either messed up my order or forgotten about it so I had to go there just to watch my friends eat. -1 star for their service. Expect to wait AT LEAST 30 minutes for your dessert after sitting down. AT LEAST.

***Parking***: stupid hard to find, day or night. Good luck

CASH ONLY!
author: Johnny G.

description:
When we walked in, there were only 2 tables with customers, but 3 or 4 tables with dirty dishes. The lady working was standing there, watching tv, but didn't even go clean up the dirty tables.

I ordered a mixed fruits mango juice based sago. It came out looking different from what I always have at any other dessert place. It looked more white than yellow. I asked the guy who just came to work. He said they added coconut juice on top. So I mixed it, and there's the yellow part, but there's still more coconut juice than mango juice. Uh...hello? I ordered mango juice based, but coconut juice based! As I'm eating this order right now, I can't really tell what it tastes like. Mango? No. Coconut? A little bit...

I've been coming to this place for a few years now. I've never been so disappointed in them. I don't think I'll be coming back here in the near future.
author: Peggy C.

description: the place is always crowded, and there is never enough space on the table for the food. But me and my bff still come here for their variety.
author: Jan H.

description:
Great for late night dessert or snacks, and it's pretty cheap. I love the ice cream waffle sundaes but I'm not a fan of their sago. In fact, I make an effort to remember NOT to order sago here, because it's rank.

One waiter, in his attempts to be helpful, asked my friends and I if we "were struggling." It was a rather distasteful way of asking us if we needed help with the menu. After that, he came back to point to things on the menu, as if we could not understand either English or Chinese. Strangely, we had not even been in our seats that long to even require help ordering.

On another occasion, my friend, who is lactose intolerant, accidentally ordered the mango madness (I recommend it!), which has ice cream in it. We kindly asked for it without the ice cream, and from there, a hectic kind of ten minutes unfurled. Two waiters came out to tell us that they don't do those kinds of customized orders, and then another came out to tell us that we could order something else. After all the unnecessary discussion (Why couldn't they just scoop out the ice cream?!) we stared at a new blended fruit bowl, eyeing it for spit and loogies.

Oh well. Late night dessert has its ups and downs, I suppose.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I've come here twice for dessert.

Pros:
(+) I haven't been disappointed with any of their desserts, I don't remember what my friends ordered, but we finished every last bit of it.
(+) The egg puffs were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and not as sweet as what I'm used to.
(+) In addition to being free, the ice cream waffle sandwich was the best thing I had that night. Maybe it tasted better because it was free.

Cons:
(-) Parking is horrible.
(-) It was really crowded both times I went, making service slow.
(-) The china could use an upgrade, all of our desserts were served in chipped bowls.
author: Serinda O.

description:
good late night HK snack place.  

What I usually get: 
egg puffs
fried chicken wings
XO noodles
Peanut butter toast

mmmmmm....so unhealthy but it's oh so yummy!
author: Christina L.

description:
This place is located near Clement street near Kaiser hospital.  The owner is Chinese, where they play TVB dramas on the screen in the back. Their specialty is mainly desserts or snacks. Every now and then, they have special deals, which included a Watermelon juice extract drink which tasted good. 

I would come back again since it's open past 10pm daily, and I'm comfortable even if most of the crowd is under 25.
author: Rob L.

description: Great dessert spot. Their fruit and desserts good. They do however run out of items on the menu sometimes and who likes that. Their service is okkk, just ok. The food makes up for it though.
author: Donilon A.

description:
This place is way overrated for its mediocre food. Had the Mango Madness and didn't expect ice cream in there but that wasn't the worst part.. I could taste the ice chunks inside the fruits. Egg puffs were not that great either. Had the Papaya sago once and the sago is so plain and the only papaya in there was papaya sauce. 

Definitely not worth the wait at night. Also, it looks like they keep a small staff on-hand and when it's busy, the service is pretty poor.
author: Sophia K.

description:
So you want to see asian people huh? Come here at 12 am and you'll feel like you're in China.  This is where all the local kids come for a late night snack and to socialize.  The food is okay, nothing special.  I usually get the egg puffs, fried noodles, and chicken with fries.  One big plus is the free hot tea, especially when it's desperately needed on those chilly SF nights.

*Warning - service is HORRENDOUS.
author: Alex G.

description:
(See pics)

I must be on the sugar rush, maybe it's the already missing feeling of Hong Kong and that I need to fill the void, or the withdrawal of the already overdose of Hello Kitty that I have had in Hong Kong...

Walked in around 6pm for dinner. Yes, dinner. I was very hungry after having had only a bagel and a coffee all day.

I had the Chinese style French toast, Hong Kong style milk tea with coffee, and for *dessert* I had steamed milk custard. The French toast was like the double decker! Good they skipped the peanut butter (who thought of that *recent* addition totally ruined the taste and authenticity.) It's good and with okay syrup (not the thick kind which is more common in HK.)

Occasionally I have servers coming with the wrong drink and will remember as soon as they put the drinks down. This time it's the same. The server put down the milk tea, then immediately said it's supposed to be milk tea with coffee. She went and dumped half of the tea and trumped it with coffee. The drink was so so and a bit watery... very unusual for a Chinese cafe to make this oh-so-common drink wrong!

Now the steamed milk custard was the highlight of the whole meal! Top part was so liquid it's silky, milky and sooo smooth. Bottom was more cooked and solid.

This place offers many different kinds of Hong Kong style fruit desserts and are mostly okay but on also on the lighter (a bit on the watery that is.) But then never will any place be close to what you can have in HK, obviously.

A side note, the two servers were having fish and rice for their dinner around 6:30pm when it's at its slowest time. They open until 2am on Fridays and Saturdays and 1am on other nights so it's a good late night place to have your sugar craving. But it does get very busy around 10pm.
author: T L.

description:
This place reminds me of DnA or ABC in Chinatown. Super Asian and the decor isn't even that nice. We had to wait like 30 minutes. This was around 9pm. The waiter was pretty cool and nice though. 

It was really hard to decide what to order. We ordered the waffle ice cream, the egg things, manga sago, strawberry madness, etc. The desserts were pretty good. 

I guess its a good hang out at night if you are not into drinking. You can just sit there forever and talk.
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is where my friends and I would kick it for late night dessert. It is also extremely A-Z-N. But compared to other dessert places, this place is reasonably priced and has a wide selection! 

I usually like the fruit sago desserts and the egg puffs. The waffle ice cream "sandwich" is good too, especially with green tea ice cream! 

During the summer, they extend their hours EVEN LATER. Crazy.
author: Diana L.

description: Came here with friends today because we were craving some dessert.  We all got the Mango Sago and Waffle ice cream sandwiches. The Mango Sago was somewhat disappointing because most of the mango slices were quite sour and I felt like it wasn't worth it. However, the waffle ice cream sandwiches were delicious and very much worth it. The waffle was crunchy and light and the ice cream was very flavorful and rich. Next time I come here I'm for sure going to get the waffle ice cream sandwiches again! The tea was pretty good too, bonus points for that!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Oh god, the number of times I've been here...

I started coming to this place in high school, mainly because they're open really late.  It's a nice, clean and lively spot to come to at the end of the night when you want somewhere to sit down with friends.  Among the things I've had:

- Waffle Sundae: Four slices of waffle on top of few scoops of ice cream (different flavors).  I really liked this, and if I'm not mistaken, one of the scoops of ice cream is green tea flavored, so that's a plus.  It's also not that expensive.
- HK Style Waffle: Two waffles sandwiching a layer of condensed milk, sugar, peanut butter and something else (more sugar?).  This I like, but it can get pretty sweet.  I usually order it without the condensed milk and sugar and it tastes just fine.  Also pretty cheap.
- Soy Milk: A humongous cup of soy milk (must be four or more measuring cups' worth).
- Steamed Eggs/Steamed Milk: pretty good, mild flavors and you get a decent portion, but be prepared to wait, as it takes a while to make.
- Rice roll w/ Hoisin Sauce: pretty, pretty good if you're a little hungry after dinner and need that extra push into fullness.

This is a good place to go if you're a night owl and enjoy pretty good Asian desserts, and I've never actually had to wait that long for a table nor had trouble finding parking (I guess it depends on the time).
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
Waffle sandwiches are soooooooooo good! Get the Peanut Butter Toast too! This place is super authentic! 

They are always watching some TVB cantonese show on their big screen plasma TV, it feels just like Hong Kong! LOVE it!
author: Amiee H.

description:
I love kowloon! It's a neighborhood favorite for people who enjoy their late night HEALTHY?? desserts ! The place is almost always open up late and even stay open later during the holidays. I have ordered various items on the menu, and have enjoyed almost all there food. 

They also have pretty good specials here especially the $3.50 chicken wings and fries which are originally about $5! 

I enjoy having the egg puffs, ice cream and waffles,, any ramen here the most! The tea that they serve is also very good! I would come here just to drink the tea. heh

Kowloon is the place to be!
author: Victoria L.

description: WAFFLES PLUS ICE CREAM.  It was done perfectly, and the noodles were boss also.  Definitely coming back.
author: Allegra Z.

description: Out of 6 different dishes we ordered,.. Only 2 were decent... The tofu pudding served smelled and tasted spoiled, the ice cream waffle was ok however the mango ice cream tasted like it came out of a bed bath beyond hand sanitizer bottle... Bk grass jelly was completely blan... No flavor what so ever..  Even the tea was warm, not even hot... My orders were constantly mixed up. They kept handing me my friends orders and when it came time for my order, it was handed to my friend? WTF.... May be it's the week day but this place used to be good... Don't know what happened... 1 star for food we ordered.. And the other star was for the nice decoration of the newly design place
author: V W.

description:
I don't really crave the food/desserts here in particular but I do crave HK desserts in general... and this is the closest I can find.  So it does the job!

A couple friends and I decided to order the following things.  And believe it or not, this was only for four people!!  We're big pigs.

-Watermelon juice: Tasted to standard.  Big cup.  
-Mango puree/chunks with sticky rice & ice cream ($5.25): BEST desert of the night!  Ice cream is an extra $.75 but just having mango and sticky rice is good enough.  This reminds me of the Thai version of the dessert except the sticky rice is black and loosely held together.  Even though the menu didn't say, I think they did add some coconut milk to this.
-Pork chop with egg noodle ($5.95): There aren't too many salty items on the menu but this was a pretty decent portion.  Satisfies the hunger but I probably wouldn't order it if I had other options nearby.  You basically pick your main carb (egg noodle, rice noodle, macaroni, etc.) then you pick your topping (pork chop, fried chicken wing, fried squid, tofu, etc.).
-Coconut milk taro sago (hot): This is my comfort dessert... something my mom use to always make.  They put the right amount of coconut milk and the taro bits are nice and small.
-Tortoise jelly: This wasn't as bitter as I've normally had it.  Nice, firm gelatin consistency with the right amount of syrup.
-Waffle ice cream: Always good but the portion is huge; make sure you're sharing it so that you can get something else too.  The waffle comes out warm and crisp.  No eggos here!
-Coconut milk with sticky rice: My friend got this and I didn't try it but it looked like #2 without the mango.

Keep in mind that the menu prices on the table are probably outdated.  Our bill ended up being just a little higher than we expected.  When you first get there, they give you each big metal beer-barrel cups of tea but it turns out that they charge you $1.25 for each of them without telling you!!  Gosh, charging for tea is lame.

Parking is wretched here because you can't park in the Smart 'n Final lot but there aren't too many spots on the street.  You'll just have to keep circling.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I can not believe I have not yet written a review for this place! I think the food is just decent.
My extremely close friend works here and he will knock your socks off with customer service. Plenty of people think he's weird, but the charm is in the entertainment that is provided with your meal. You are definitely going to know just which one is him, so please tip accordingly!

I have had a little bit of everything here, my favorite is still the waffle sundae! I would really suggest bringing someone Chinese who knows their dessert because there is a large selection. It is a great place to get all the Chinese desserts you never wanted to sit at home to make.

Keeping true to my Yelp, the food is just decent. Don't expect Buckingham's palace or anything, but it's a great place to hang out, to be with friends, and just have some delicious desserts. See you there ;)
author: Winè C.

description:
Despite all the low reviews of this place, I adore Kowloon!! Why...?

This place is open LATE.

HUGE yummy ice cream waffle sandwiches (ice cream flavors: green tea, mango, strawberry, etc).

SUPER MANGO MADNESS! (fresh fruit chunks, mango pudding, and two scoops of mango ice cream)

Grass Jelly Desserts....mmm :9

Hot and Cold Red Bean soup!

Ramen!!

Complimentary tea served in a keg like mug.

AND THE BEST PART OF ALL...THE MENU IS HUGE. 
There's something for anyone and everyone here at Kowloon.
author: Heidi C.

description: I've only ordered their egg puffs, and I was slightly disappointed. The egg puffs were a bit overcooked and were crispy throughout, rather than being crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It also took quite a few minutes to get my ordered made--probably why it felt overcooked. While it didn't taste horrible, it also didn't seem right.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Back in high school, I used to come here practically EVERY NIGHT with my friend. And the reason why we kept coming back so often was because their food and dessert were the best in the city. 

Unfortunately, the last two times i've been here, the dessert lost it's appeal. The egg puffs tasted funny, the rice noodles weren't hot like they used to be and my taro sago tasted like dish washing water. 

I'm not sure what happened to kowloon tong, they used to be so good! But I probably won't be coming here anytime soon, they've let me down twice already.
author: Jess s.

description:
3.5 stars

There's nothing like some HK-style fruit dessert to ease the guilt of gorging on a Chinese banquet dinner. Nevermind the ridiculous amount of food I just ate because now I am having this bowl of fruit which is healthy and will help me stay regular (ignore the evaporated milk and corn syrup). Personally, I wasn't crazy about the black sticky rice...but I would probably get the mixed fruit again but with sago instead. 

I was really fascinated with the waffle and ice cream they have...the waffle is exactly how I would want it, very crispy and just thick enough to hold up with the ice cream in between. Also got to try these little ricefour balls coated with ground peanut...nice and simple, perfect chewiness. The "chicken egg things" aka gen-dan-zai were fun to munch on and have a very strong egg flavor, with lots of chewiness. I could have a few of these little things, but soon grew tired of it after about 3.

There are a ton of options here, so I would definitely recommend exploring to find out what dessert appeals to you. Shout out to Fong for suggesting Kowloon Tong for some post-Bay Fung Tong gluttony action!

p.s. WHY is the price listed as $$$? That's wrong. 

p.p.s. This is where high schoolers hang out (or maybe they're in college, you know those youthful Asian genes).
author: Steph P.

description:
This place is packed during the weekends, regardless if its rain or shine! they have a large variety of desserts here to choose from as well as noodles and other snacks. This is not my favorite place for dessert, i think it's because i got sick of the selection. The service here is super slow, because they're always under staffed! at peak hour you see 1 waiter only and they are usually SUPER SLOWWW..... i use to come here quite often and noticed that workers here don't last very long. They're turnover rate is so quick, yet they keep on hiring slow workers. 

I like their XO sauce steam rice noodle, its pretty good. My usual orders are B-Kid grass jelly, it has grass jelly with mix fruits and a little bit of sweet milk added for flavor. it's really good! their mango madness is great for mango lovers! 

the good thing about this place is it opens late.. so if you're looking for a late night gathering with desserts involved, this is the place to go.
author: Jenny G.

description:
SO two years ago I thought this place was a... meh. 
But I've been coming back ever since, and then I fell in love with it. 

The brothers who work here all the time are super nice. Great service! 

We always order egg puff, waffle ice cream sandwich... I always get a hot milk tea for myself, sweet sticky rice with coconut milk, and steam egg. And they are all very good. 

They also have more savory options now. I tried the chicken steak with black pepper sauce... They always fill me in.
author: Marlis T.

description:
Ok, I'd give this place 4 stars if it weren't for the fact that there was a dead fly found on the table when my party went last night. The place itself isn't as nice as a typical Americanized dessert place but isn't as shabby as your local Chinatown restaurant. I also felt bad for the waiter that night because he was a one-man team catering to a full house. I know how that feels like =/

But they get a big STAR for opening late nights, even on week days. Where else in San Francisco can you satisfy a craving for WAFFLE ICE CREAM SANDWICHES on a Monday Night? Kowloon Tong got yo back.

They also do have a wide variety of assortments, salty and sweet. You pick. Wait...let me pick for you, start off with salty and then finish off with the sweet.
author: David W.

description: Well I gave this restaurant 4 stars because my boyfriend and I like to go see one of the waiters there his name is Eric. His a very funny and  sweet guys. As for the food I say 3 stars. Their desert is good but that about it. They also have food n ramen but never really satisfied me. I usually order the wings, French fries and a desert. Those are always good. Nothing can go wrong with wings and fries right!? They also close pretty late so every time after the bar or club I like to stop by there to get something to eat! Even though, the food isn't the best but it is still one of the place that I love to go.
author: Jenny C.

description: Their egg puffs is the best! Fresh puffy, crispy and thin not like other place their egg puff feels like microwave heated. Being a huge fan of Kowloon is that they open late! Other than that their dessert was decent. But still is a nice place to hangout with friends at night.
author: Zhe C.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends on a Saturday night at around 10pm. There were plenty of parking spaces nearby. This place is packed! We walked in and for some reason, it smelled like hair dye. Weird? I think so.

Anyways, there were 6 of us and only a couple of open seats. I saw the waiter move another party of 4 to another table so that they could accommodate us. Honestly, that was a bit rude. The party of 4 looked like they were already settled in chatting it up when the waiter told them to move. My friends and I could've waited for another seat to open up. I felt bad for them and would've been pissed if that happened to me!

Anyways, the menus are encased in plastic. Like many Asian dessert places, the menus were crowded with all these desserts. A bit overwhelming if you ask me! It didn't take us long to decide though since we came here for their ice cream waffles. Since we were full from our dinner, we decided to get the banana ice cream waffle, a nutella and ice cream waffle, and I got the nutella ice cream waffle as well. The boys didn't order anything, they probably wanted to keep the figure. ;)

The waiter gave us some complimentary hot green tea in mismatched tea cups. I guess the default ice cream is vanilla? My waffle came with vanilla ice cream that looked really yellow. The waffle itself was not very warm, crispy, and tasted eggy which I didn't really like. I originially wanted strawberries with my nutella ice creamwaffle, but for some reason they didn't have strawberries. The prices are reasonable. A big waffle for under $5 is a-okay.

I don't know if I'd come back to this place. Probably not, but we'll see!
author: Joyce E.

description: Very good food with lots of options, free tea, and busy, friendly atmosphere.  got the salt and pepper tofu with the classic waffle sandwhich, waiter gave us the sandwhich for free without checkin if we had checked in on yelp, very sweet
author: Cheyenne A.

description:
One of the better dessert places in SF, though their menu looks strikingly similar to My Favorite Cafe's. Maybe its under the same ownership?

Anyways, this place isn't bad at all for what it is (Asian dessert place in America). There seemed to be enough chairs and tables to go around, and its conveniently located off of Geary Blvd., though parking is a pain in the ASS. I suck at parallel parking and it took me well over 5 mins. to maneuver into a parallel spot...and my whip has a BACK-UP CAMERA. Fail.

The people at my table ordered a variety of things, and we all seemed to enjoy it. I had the sundae waffle, which I shouldn't have ordered because the waffle was Eggo-quality and the ice cream was something my elementary school served, but I was craving something cold. We also had some difficulty flagging down our waiter/waitress, as expected in these Asian places who simply expect you to ingress/eat/egress.

All in all this is one of the more decent Asian dessert places in the city and I recommend all to give this a try rather than jumping on the bandwagon (ala Creations).
author: Felix C.

description: Kowloons is alright. Service is quite slow, and desserts are decent. Kind of hard to find parking depending at which time you go too. But overall, 3/5
author: Deion D.

description:
Not my most favorite HK dessert shop in terms of quality and service but they do close really late - 1am on weekdays, I believe. They forgot one of our orders, but I understand since they were really busy. I prefer My Favorite Cafe and Creations, but I like to mix things up so I like coming here too.

Can't go wrong with eggettes. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
i hate how HK cafes all have soooooooo many items on their menu.. i get paralyzed and i dunno what to order :(

so i ended up ordering something im familiar with, mango sago

andddd ive had better sago, but hey its a nice place to be with friends on a friday night just talking about random stuff and getting free stuff for just checking in (and spending 25 dollars or more)

their peach and strawberry ice creams aiiighht. not really an ice cream fan though so you cant trust my judgement.

it looks super dingy outside, but its okay on the inside.

im too scared to try anything else though.. we'll see what happens if i ever go back
author: Rebecca K.

description: Good place to eat if u have a sweet tooth... i be sure to come again and try out all the item in the menu : )
author: Kai L.

description:
I came with a huge group of friends; we took up almost half the place. 

I just got eggpuffs. They weren't too bad; when I first got em, they were crunchy and didn't seem like there was substance inside.. but when they cooled down, they were softer. 

My friends enjoyed the free ice cream waffle sandwiches when they checked in.
author: Diane L.

description:
Got to Kowloon on a Monday a few minutes after they opened and surprisingly, my bf and I were the only folks in the restaurant and it remained that way for the first thirty minutes of our meal. Only a handful of people started rolling in afterwards. 

We ordered salty and sweet items including the deep fried chicken wings with fries, XO sauce fried rice noodles, condensed milk and butter toast, and the ice cream waffle sandwich. The chicken wings were crunchy, a bit oily but not too salty. The wings came with waffle fries and although they were nice and crunchy, since they were fried in the same oil as the chicken wings, the waffle fries had too much of an asian flavor so it didn't pair that well with ketchup. I definitely could have passed on the XO sauce noodles as they were plain and on the dry side. The toast wasn't that special, just composed of a thick piece of white bread topped with condensed milk and butter. I think I would have been much happier with the french toast instead. As for the ice cream waffle sandwich, what our waiter called "the main event" as he brought it to our table...it was almost perfect. What is a big ice cream waffle sandwich cut into quarters, this dessert is made of yummy waffles, which I presume is made from the same delicious batter as the eggettes, that sandwich big hunky scoops of tasty vanilla ice cream. The waffle sandwich gets minus points because our waffles were not warm which I understand from other reviews, should be when the ice cream sandwich comes out! This may largely be due to the fact that when we placed our order, we asked the waiter if he could bring the ice cream sandwich to our table after we finished our savory foods and he said yes, we just have to give him a heads up. I have a feeling that the cook made the waffles right when we ordered everything and just added the ice cream when we gave our waiter the heads up. Next time, I'll know better. There is a happy hour special where you get a free hot drink if you order at least $5 from a certain part of the menu. I got a free hot milk tea which was really good with the added condensed milk.

Also, I just have to make a shout out to our waiter. It looks like some reviews have noted how funny and friendly this guy is. He really is just filled with enthusiasm, doing kung fu moves behind the counter as he chops up fruit, and overall is very friendly and nice. It was really humorous encountering him but he definitely made our meal pleasant and memorable. 

To sum things up, Kowloon has lots of menu items so definitely take your time choosing what you order since items can either be a hit or a miss. Luckily, the menu prices are easy on the pocket. I do hope to return, maybe get the same waiter, and try some different things.
author: Maya S.

description:
Oh this place brings me back to the days of studying abroad in HK. The menu is filled with traditional Asian desserts like sago, mochi balls and brick toast! 

I have finally finally found good waffle puffs in the States!! Crispy and light, chewy on the inside! 

Great place to chill with a bunch of friends after a dinner in the area.
author: Eva H.

description: Came here with a date for some late night snacking and I can't believe their variety! Thru have pretty much anything you could want for dessert and the prices are decently priced. The ice cream waffle sandwich was delicious. They contrast between the warm crunchy waffle and the cold soft ice cream really made this item.
author: Dang T.

description:
Kowloon is your average typical Asian decent house that opens late. The service is terrible, but you just keep coming back since the choices of places opened after 10pm is very limited. Half the people here around midnight are pissed drunk and the other half are people who missed dinner time. 

Any fruit dessert with ice cream is going to be tasting good no matter what. There's not much to making a dessert with fruits and ice cream.

Their eggpuffs are flaky and pretty good. The waffle ice cream sandwich they make is definitely something to try.

Besides dessert, they have quite a good menu for hot food such as chicken wings, which are pretty decent.
author: Steven B.

description: The ice cream waffle sandwich looks better than it tastes. Was not worth the wait either.
author: Marci N.

description:
I discovered I really like sago late into the night. Cold sago with mango puree and fresh fruit, hot sago with red beans-- thank you SF for introducing us. Now I'm on the hunt for a place that will serve me these kinds of yummy things late into NY nights. 

I know you ladies in the kitchen gossip about the girls that came and ordered the whole menu-- because the overly friendly waiter told us. But its OK. You still make some delicious desserts and we might have been cows in our past life.
author: Angelina K.

description: Yummy asian desserts, but don't expect to find tapioca milk tea here.
author: Natasha N.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here with 4 of his friends after eating at Palominos since we all wanted dessert after food. They were raving about the ice cream waffle sandwich that was offered. We decided to get 3 of them for the 6 of us to share. Each was filled with fruit and ice cream. Somehow we got the pick of Strawberry, Green Tea, and Mango. We chose one for each of them. 

They were delicious. I don't think I would have eaten that much, but it was amazing. The cold ice cream and warm waffles really complement each other well. We were offered warm tea when we started the meal and got all our waffles at different times so that the ice cream wouldn't melt. 

I had heard from my boyfriend's friends that service there is typically terrible, but my experience so far has been average. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't amazing either. I trust his friends when they say that the service was bad for the couple of times they've been there.

Overall, I don't know if I would go back. It seems simple enough to put together that I could just make it at home. Service was just decent. Maybe the going out with friends is the best part.
author: Nina Y.

description: Best dessert in sf. The ice cream sandwich and egg puffs are the bomb. Its kinda busy at peak hours. But its definitely worth the wait.
author: Larry L.

description:
Yummy! I went here for desserts, but they actually have a large selection of entrees too! I had the:

a) mixed fruit ice cream waffle: I got the green tea and oreo ice creams mixed into it. So delicious! The crispy waffles with ice cream make an impressive sandwich. The green tea ice cream was my favorite: a light touch of green tea, with melting goodness!

b) mixed fruit tortoise jelly: meh. There was way too much jelly in the bowl and the jelly is primarily tasteless. The fruit was refreshing, although it was more summer fruit (mangoes, watermelon, cantaloupe): they need to add more fruit!

Still, I'm definitely coming back here! The best part: It's open late.
author: Vishal A.

description:
My friends couldn't settle on a place for dessert after dinner, and so I suggested Kowloon Tong Dessert Café. 

This place has a variety of dessert that begs you to try it all. Popular for their waffle ice cream sandwiches, they offer a menu that satisfies both savory and sweet tooth.

Among the things we ordered were...
Egg puffs - Typical egg puffs that are crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. 
Ice Cream Sundae - normal sundae with trio of ice cream, bananas, whip cream, and nuts.
Mango Madness - friend liked it, I cannot comment because his greedy self wouldn't share! 
Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich (green tea and mix fruit) - homemade waffles that hold a decent size scoop of ice cream...amazing! The pieces of fruit are a nice frozen surprise in each bite.

Ice Cream Sundae Waffle Sandwich (variety of flavors) - check in with your mobile device and you will receive this order free with a purchase of $25 or more!

Parking is only located on the street, so prepare to fight for a spot on busy days.
I generally do not see this place packed with customer, but I can see how the wait can take awhile if there are no tables available. Remember to keep the hot tea refills going because it helps you warm up for that next chilling bite!
author: Casey L.

description: This hk style dessert place is good for multiple reasons-- opens late and serves all sorts of food! I always seem to run into someone I know here, strange! My regular item has to be the egg puffs, always great to have when you are hitting it up with your friends. The service here is quite slow, but if they're not busy, you can sit here for hours just ordering a 3 dollar drink. Overall, not a shabby place to chat and hang with your friends together after dinner!
author: Sappho C.

description:
I ordered sesame glutinous with sesame paste for $4.95, and it only came with like three sesame glutinous balls and the whole bowl was sesame paste that tasted like 50% water. It's not super nasty, but I've had better.

We also got a free waffle ice cream sandwich since we spent $20+ overall and checked in on facebook. It tasted pretty good.

The other deal was to spend $25+ and check in on Yelp for a free banana split. 

There was no line when we got here at around 10ish on New Year's Eve. Service was okay, but not great. By the way, sticky rice isn't really sticky "rice" in the cold dessert menu.
author: Kelly H.

description:
I am not really a big fan of this place.. although MANY other people seem to really like it. (I rather head out to Creations).
The desserts are okay.. the same ol'.
Sago is good and some of their non desert foods are good, like the sandwiches.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Good for Tea  lovers & sugar addicts, Asian obsessed folks ( I'm partially) Chinese, and recovering AA members! Its basically good for those who can't go to bar as an alternative!  Its very busy and lively for many folks who just want to hang out with their pals and have tea and Hong Kong style items.

No cards taken so have cash ready!
author: R C.

description: Yummy! Even though I'm full I am still thinking about the ice cream waffle I just had. It's the best! It's crispy and although I wanted it to be bigger, it was really delicious and satisfying. It was two waffles and in the middle was a giant patch of ice cream. That was $5.50. I wish we ordered more to share because we only ordered one and shared among four. One slice of that deliciousness was not enough to satisfy me. I also got a mixed fruits sago and there was an abundance of fruits, just the way I like it. The mango was sour though but the strawberries and other fruits were on point. The sago was just the right amount of sweetness as well. The sago was $4.95, a bit on the pricey side for what it is but I'd definitely order it again. The service was okay, the guy was really friendly. This place is now my favorite dessert place because of their ice cream waffle! You must try the ice cream waffle!!!! That's a MUST!!!
author: Julian Y.

description:
If you want Hong Kong desserts, Kowloon Tong is as authentic as you are going to get in SF.

The eggs puffs are a must. They are done just right, a little toasty on the outside and soft inside. Mnnmm. I also usually get fruits or mango sago.

This place caters to the young and hip who are out late. They open at 5 p.m. on weekdays and 3 p.m. on weekends. Booooo
author: Tony N.

description:
The server was very enthusiastic when he sat us and took our orders. 

My mango sago was a bit watered down but it tasted okay. I've had better.

No board games but I saw a magazine rack.   Flat screen tv for your enjoyment. 

Cash only.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Let's be real. The only reason why this place triumphs over other dessert places in SF is because of their free ice cream waffle sandwich deal. That's right, if customers spend more than $25 per visit, the ice cream waffle sandwich is on the house. Sure, the customers also have to check in Yelp or Facebook but Kowloon Tong makes it easier for them since it offers free WI-FI. Other than that, their Asian desserts and snacks are standard. There is a large variety to choose from but I always stick with the mixed fruits sago, an egg puff, French fries, or the steamed rice noodle with sriracha sauce, hoisin sauce, and peanut butter sauce (my absolute fave). Most dishes range between $3-$8 so it's definitely affordable. Going out to eat desserts with friends or family is usually a family-style ordeal so order a variety of dishes and share around the table. That way, you can sample different desserts and it's more fun that way, too.
author: Annie S.

description: This place is great for a late night snack or a cup of milk tea with a friend. We went as five adults and two kids and were seated quickly. They serve complimentary tea in these metal mugs that look like little barrels. It reminded me of the Japanese anime, One Piece, and Luffy's pirate crew. While the rest of the gang enjoyed their mango-sago puddings and other fruit-based desserts, I ordered the sesame and almond paste. It was a blend of black and white that looked like the Chinese Yin-Yang symbol. They make their sesame paste in house, so it was smooth and creamy. Great job overall. Spend over 30 bucks and check in with Yelp and you get a free waffle and ice-cream plate!
author: William H.

description:
As far as HK Style Desserts go, this place is good.

Mango Pudding has real mangoes.
B Kid Grass Jelly always hits the spot.
Turtle Jelly is yums.
Sweet Tofu is good.
Sesame paste is good.

All in all, everything always came out good, even the ramen.

4 stars for the desserts, 3 stars for the food.
author: Mike W.

description:
OH GOD KOWLOON!

So I went here a couple days ago and was very dissatisfied. Not with the dessert per say, but the service. 1st of all, there were 4 cups of tea for 5 people. If someone tells you they need a table for 5, don't give them 4 tea cups. They're gonna need 5.

2ndly, 2 of my friends ordered banana splits. One without peanuts on top, one with. The banana splits came, as they requested .. but they forgot the bananas. I definitely got a kick out of this one as one of the friends was gonna order something else .. because "there's no bananas!!!!"

3rdly, they didn't rush us to leave, but definitely had trouble getting their attention, and the check. maybe they were short staffed, but then again, Kowloons wasn't nearly as crowded as it usually is. Also, I'm thinking the 2 people are new. Sigh sigh sigh.

2 stars for dessert, 1 pity star for service.
author: Jessica H.

description: I like their ice cream waffle sandwich. The other desserts are ok. but definitely try the ice cream waffle sandwich.
author: Rui S.

description: All of these places are good. This one is no exception. After going to Taiwan, I am very picky about my shaved ice, and this one just can't compare the almond yumminess we experienced out there. With that said, it was good. And fun. And I recommend!
author: Andrew K.

description:
3.5 Stars

The food is decent and it doesn't wow me, but when friends want to go for Asian dessert, we would come here. Service is okay, I never had a horrible experience and there was this one waiter who was pretty attentive.
author: Mandy D.

description: Yo, the service here is god damn terrible!! Jesus!!! The dessert is also not all that. I'd give this place a 2stars but I'll shoot them an extra star for being so cheap.
author: Michael A.

description: My favorite dessert place in SF so far :) I've tried many things here I don't really remember but what I usually get is the mixed fruit shaved ice or mixed fruit sago. Their egg puffs and rice noodles and also yummy! Their salt and pepper chicken wings were really good the first time I had them but the second time it was so bland.. I'm pretty sure they forgot to put salt on it. But other than that I've always enjoyed my time eating here! You also get free ice cream waffles if you spend I think at least 20 or 25 and check into facebook :D
author: Nancy T.

description:
We ordered 4 things off the menu. One was awesome and the rest were alright. 
I got the hot taro sago, it was DELICIOUS. tapioca was soft and squishy, the liquid was sweet and perfect taro flavor and texture. 
My boyfriend got the chicken wings with fries, the chicken wings were very big and decent quality. Way better than that kfc "chicken". The fries were delicious. Only bad thing about the chicken was that it was very very very oily and undersalted. But it was fresh out the fryer and HOT which is nice. 
Our friend got the waffle ice cream sandwich. They didn't ask what kind of ice cream he wanted in the sandwich so they chose vanilla for him .... Kinda lame. Don't forget to specify what type of ice cream you want. The waffles were eggy and a good texture and the ratio of ice cream to waffle was good. 
Also got curry fish balls. The curry sauce is very yummy and the fish balls were a good texture. 
Overall the food was ok, the sago is really good, but I'm disappointed that they didn't ask our friend what kind of ice cream he wanted and chose for him. 
Very packed at night, but not a long wait to be seated. Did take a while for the chicken to come out
author: Kaylie W.

description: I'd absolutely miss the dessert places in HK and didn't know where else you can find in the US except there.  Boy was I glad that my friend took me to this place bc it's great for those late night sweet attack that you can grab a table and savor the yummies.  This place is small though so can be packed quickly.  I believe there's another location but not sure where.  I wish there was something like this on the East Coast!! It's on my list to go whenever I visit SF now.
author: Melanie Y.

description: I came here with my buddies and was really looking forward to the ice cream waffle sandwich. We shared that and got mango go go for ourselves. The waffle sandwich is really good and i definitely recommend. The waffle was crunchy and chewy. The mango go go was not worth it for $5 because the fruits were sour. Get the ice cream waffle sandwich!!
author: Vivian L.

description:
I like this place, they have a huge menu and the happiest waiter every.  This must be the most optimistic, happy a go go kind of guy.

This place can get pretty pack so don't be surprise if you have to wait.  Don't ever order any of the noodles with the ham, I don't know what that meat is, but it is not ham.
author: Mimi P.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 3/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 3/5

I came here couple times before a while back ago, and I had came again recently. I ordered their Pork Chop sandwich because our friend said its good; and I was hungry so i had that. I was dissapointed, the bread wasn't toasted, came with no veggies; pork wasn't even fried. It felt like i was 5 again and eating a baby sandwich with Wonder White Bread and American Cheese -_-* then I had their Waffle Sundae which kind of made up for the food. I don't think I'll come here often, only when I'm desperate since there are many more dessert places around in the city.
author: Eva H.

description: I ordered a mango go go, banana smoothie, banana split, also some cooked foods such as popcorn chicken, egg sandwich, and chicken wings with fries. Next time I'm definitely sticking with all desserts except for maybe the popcorn chicken which was nicely done. The service is a bit on the slow side so just make sure you order a good amount of things the first time because flagging can be hard to do. Their seating is nice and comfortable, and waiters are generally nice.
author: Mike J.

description:
Hong Kong style desserts and fast foodstuffs.  I have yet to eat any of their savory items but i really do enjoy their Hong Kong style waffles, egg puffs, almond tea with crystal snow (crystal snow is energizing and supposed to be very invigorating for women), and their waffle sundae.  I also enjoyed thier almond paste with sesame dumplings.

Next time I'll be trying their savory items and their turtle or grass jelly drinks.
author: Theron L.

description: Sorry, did not see the attraction. Ordered 3 desserts to go, not cheap ($16 total) for what you get! Had 2 orders of their glutinous rice balls, 1 with bean paste that was in a ginger watery broth(?), & the other w/peanuts (ea came w/4 sm. balls),  the 3rd order was supposed to have sticky rice in it..it was MIA! No sticky rice to be found & the whole thing seemed watery & lacked taste as if it were missing something. The service was very blah & had to wait like 20 min to get my order. Talked my husband into driving 20 min from home to try this? Sorry! Now I know, not coming back!
author: susan w.

description:
eh.  yeah.  Packed but I'm not really sure why.  I guess because it's opened late and there are probably 3 options on this side of the park.  

I like their waffle sundae and ice cream waffle sandwich.  But it's so inconsistent.... be warned.  TIP: you can request different flavor ice creams so be sure to ask what kinds they have!!!

Don't get their shaved ice.  It's tiny and the ice is hardly even shaved.  I can't even chew it.  

There's this really nice guy that works there who's really enthusiastic about everything.  That gave them a third star.  Otherwise the food is definitely 2 stars.
author: Anna T.

description:
The tofu fa is hellaaaaaaa good with brown sugah!!! I tried it a couple nights ago and it's the shit!! It was small but it hit the spot, especially after I had dinner! 

SOOOOO GOOD! The strawberry juice was yummy too. 

Next time, I will be getting the kid-B dessert I think that's what it's called! Because my friend got it and it was pretty tasty!!
author: Alice Z.

description: Very inexpensive comfort foods and desserts.  No wonder my college son introduced us to this place.  I had the pan fried noodles with fried egg and luncheon meat (non-Spam brand)  Also, my husband ordered the spicey soup, which he described as a good spicey, sweet and sour flavor.  Son had two huge fried chicken wings with fries, daughter had the Nutella toast which was not what she expected.  Nutella spread on big thick piece of toast.  She enjoyed her chocolate milk shake instead and picked off everyone else's meal.  For Facebook check in and/or Yelp offer, you get a great offer of free waffle ice cream dessert.  This whole meal was only $30!  Not bad in SF!
author: Daphnie A.

description:
Yeah I've had better dessert. But if it's a random M-Th late night and you want somewhere to chill and talk, this is the place. 

I've tried their ramen, and it's alright. You can't really go wrong with ramen, all you have to do is throw it in hot water and add the spam and egg. 

They used to have this awesome waiter. He was always so happy and jolly, so happy that you can't even take him seriously. He was so nice and even gave our table free ice cream once. But I haven't seen him lately =[
author: Amy X.

description: The atmosphere is very casual, and the service is quick and informal. It is a perfect place to hang out late night. They have a decent selection of desserts and the entire menu is reasonably priced. I ordered the waffle ice cream sandwich, which I was pleased with and would order again.
author: Marc L.

description:
There are rare individuals out there that hold a positive attitude towards everything and puts a smile on everything they do. I found one such person here in Kowloon Tong cafe and I regret not asking for his name. With that welcoming attitude, it brighten up the experience for the rest of the night! 

It was purely for dessert that my wife and a friend came for and we each got our own along with a side of eggettes. The eggettes were generous and pretty close to taste compared with other places. I got myself the Steamed Milk Pudding, one of my favorite desserts from Hong Kong, and I was light and sweetly balanced. Not the best, but it'll do fine. My friend got the Mango pudding, I think, but didn't get a taste of it and my wife got the Red Bean Steamed Milk. It was okay...

This is a good place to have dessert, all thanks to the many choices you can choose from. There are some dinner options here, but I would stick with the dessert. It might get loud depending on how many are dining in, but this place is just a good spot for hanging out with friends.
author: Jeremy L.

description: The desserts are pretty delicious...Ice Cream Sandwich with Bananas is my favorite!  However, service is absolutely terrrrrrrrible!!  I had stepped outside to take a call, so the waiter served one tea less than people we had...no big deal...my friends asked for one more.  I came back inside and reminded our waiter, but even after that...I was without any tea.  I waited another 5 minutes and asked again.  The waiter had some serious attitude and responded with, "Oooookayyyyy I'll get you some tea!!" Jeeeeze.  We also waited 20 minutes longer for our waffle ice cream sandwiches than my friend who order the glutenous balls...not like we were in a rush, but she finished all of her dessert and then had to wait for us to finish ours...it would be nice to mention that those are going to take longer...
author: Jessyca M.

description:
One of the asian dessert places around the city and I used to love this place.

But recently, i just feel like the quality of this place has definitely dropped a bunch. Just doesn't taste the same anymore.. It's like coming home to your family dog that doesn't recognize you anymore. It's weird and it's sad.

Prices are kind of steep for the quality and the quantity. It is still one of those places you still go to cause of the memories, and a nice late night chill place to hang out.
author: Michael L.

description:
Service from the one guy there has always been top notch.  Very friendly and attentive.  Even when it's busy.

However, the food has definitely dropped in quality.  My favorite thing to get there is snow frog in almond flavored sweet soup.  In the past, the soup base was smooth and sweet. Now, when I drink it, it's chalky and weird.  The amount of snow frog dropped along with the quality.  

Makes me sad! It used to be that one spoon would be full of snow frog, but now I barely get a piece from every spoonfull!

I am disappointed.
author: TM O.

description:
I really liked this place when it first opened many years ago... but that was also because I only went to get egg puffs.  

It's been a little while since I have been back but the last fews times I have been here, it has been disappointing. Honestly, it mostly has to do with their ice. But shaved ice is so important in Hong Kong style desserts. I remember my friend had ordered a sago and the ice was not shaved well, and there were some lumpy pieces. I hated the shaved ice I ordered here. It was not fun eating that... shaved ice is suppose to be fine but the one at Kowloon Tong was not. 

Hopefully their ice problem has been fixed...

But I do have to say, their egg puff is good.
author: Angela T.

description:
This is the second time I have been here. The first time, it was so busy, we just left. So get here early if you want a seat!

Our choices included:

Mango Sago in Tapioca - 
Ehh, the mango was sweet so I proceeded to fish the chunks out of the blandness that filled the rest of the bowl.

Milk Custard in Coconut and Sticky Rice -
This was quite good. You gotta dig out the black rice from the bottom to include in each custardy bite for optimal satisfaction. 

French Toast -
I took a bite of my friend's french toast who happened to be sitting at the next table. The french toast was easily the most flavorful dish of the night. Its simplicity of presentation, a thick piece of bread adorned with a small pad of butter, shows that - this is what you came for so eat it - attitude and I love it.
author: Sandra S.

description:
Being a recent initiate into the Hong Kong dessert place thing (I thought they were just drinking boba), I am probably not the best judge of who has the best Sago or Dun Dan, or who has the freshest snow frog jelly (wtf).  But after frequenting Golden Island for a while, and thinking that there was no other place in the city where I could sip on ovaltine smoothies, play chess with my insomniac friend, and make asian girls feel uncomfortable all at 1 am.  I mean when I am going out at the hours that I frequent dessert places, I'm kinda just paying for the right to sit down and get out of the cold.
But on tonights somnambulic roaming, I just needed something savory and hot, and preferably fried.  Resisting the temptation to commit gastrointestinal suicide at ABC, we headed up to Kowloon Tong, where the kitchen was still open.  
First of all, the lighting inside is much easier on your bleary nocturnal eyes than the blaring fluorescent gogo thing going on at Golden Island, and there is enough space so that you don't feel like you're going to get some stranger's sweet tofu all over your elbows. 
I got some fried egg noodles with kimchee and pork.  At $5.50 for late-nite service, I can't complain.  Also got the fried tofu with garlic, which was fuggin good.  I don't know if my expectations were just so low that I would've been impressed with anything, but I was pretty happy with the food.  If I had some more cash, I would've gotten the whole full course dessert place thing experience ( which from observing other regular looking patrons, seems to be a boba drink, Ice-cream or sago with fruit, and then a big plate of chicken wings and fries to finish it off.)
If it weren't all the way across the troll infested park, I might make more nightly visits here.
author: Matt K.

description:
Decent place. Used to come here after work with my coworkers, but service is hit or miss. I'm giving four stars cuz of its location, and pricing, but the service is hot or miss sometimes. 

A couple weeks ago, went with a bunch of my high school friends, and it got busy, but they were slow on getting us like more tea or more napkins. It was not even a weekend or Friday, it was just a Tuesday night and they were packed.

Dessert is dessert, as expected, nothing out of the ordinary there.
author: Jason H.

description:
I actually give it 3.5 Stars.

This is probably the fobbiest and most authentic hongkongnese dessert place I have ever gone to.  

They have a great variety of asian desserts with chinese magazines for you to read.

This has always been my go to place for those late night dessert cravings.

I like most of their dessert and snacks and it usually hits the spot, but I'm not too fond of their tofu soup dessert or their red bean sweet soup.

My favorites are: ice cream waffle and their glutonous ball with crushed peanuts!
author: Sarah F.

description: Really love the dessert here. The egg puffs are done right here, and the free ice-cream sandwich with checkin deal is also rad. I think the one without bananas is actually a better deal and the banans don't make it that much better. The best part is that the food is dirt cheap. I honestly don't even know how they make a profit at all, not to mention that they open super late.
author: Yi Y.

description:
Aww.. the default Asian dessert place in SF.

I only come here for dessert.  Never had an actual meal here (does anybody?), so I only know about their desserts.

Great place to hang out, and they got plasmas, so it's nice to watch the Olympics or a basketball game here (if you dont feel like watching at home).  Usually crowded during the weekends, and looks like a popular hang-out for high school kids nowadays. 

The price is reasonable here.  The service is typical for an Asian joint.  I absolutely love their waffle ice cream sundae!!  Their waffles taste like they're freshly made, so its really crisp and good. :)  Have also had eggettes here, but those taste as they should.  Their mango sticky rice is also good!!  Decent place to get dessert if you're craving it after a meal (which I usually do), and if you like Asian desserts!

Parking varies.. it is in the Richmond, so street parking.. and that really just depends on when you go and/or if you get lucky.
author: Kevin M.

description: If my friends and I are craving dessert pretty late in the evening, this is the spot to go to. They are open late and have many options to choose from, both sweet and savory. I can never go wrong the condensed milk/ peanut butter toast and sesame paste with glutinous balls. And if you check in and spend over $25, you can get a free waffle with ice cream. Everything I have tried, I have not been disappointed with. And their service is good compared to other late night dessert spots around the area. It can get very packed on Friday and Saturday nights so expect to wait a little bit.
author: Zherr-Anne A.

description: Tried the peanut butter french toast and snow frog steamed milk custard. Disappointing. The french toast tasted a little weird (can't pinpoint, i think there wasn't enough egg, or the bread was too hard, or the butter was a bit funny?). The milk custard took a long time to prepare, and the portion was really small, with very little snow frog. We understand that snow frog is expensive, but for $7.50, we expect a bit more. The milk custard also tasted a bit runny and a little too pungent... So sad, we really wanted to like this place, seeing how authentic the menu and decor looked =(
author: Rosanna C.

description: Fish ball was too salty, tried spicy instant noodle,  just ok. Not good as I thought. Got a free waffle ice cream which is so good:)
author: Asa L.

description: This place is OK, the service is slow and sucks pretty much. The food is good but its more like late night drunk food than yummie delicious I must go here kind of food. The eggettes are pretty bland but if you get some ice cream to dip it in it turns DELICIOUS! =) The noodles are okay a little oily but the super mango pudding is to die for~ Well I was pretty drunk when I was there but I'm sure it will still be good! =)
author: Jenny N.

description:
A nice hang out place after dinner, pre-clubbing, or post-clubbing.....its usually really packed on the weekends, and parking is horrible, but its all worth it when you can sit down and enjoy some nice HK snacks/desserts with your friends after a stressful week of work/school.

The food is fine, and service is okay, but what it really boils down to is having a nice comfortable place to hang out and laugh with your friends.

If this place had a parking lot, I would definitely visit it a lot more often.
author: Albert L.

description: I love their super b-kid grass jelly!! Great variety of Asian desserts.I  Had to knock down one star due to lack of service. (Two people serving and person making the desserts... Be prepared to wait a little cause it gets extremely busy especially at night) But I will definitely come back cause I'm hooked!
author: Kristy V.

description:
We went to Kowloon Tong and ordered the following: Mango go go, banana split, waffle sundae, egg puff, watermelon juice and cold Hong Kong style milk tea. We made the mistake of ordering too much and had a hard time finishing. 

Mango go go was too bland tasting and not sweet enough. I would not order this again. Banana split was delicious but too much ice cream and whipped cream. Waffle sundae was similar to banana split with 3 flavors of ice cream except for the waffle part. The egg puff was really delicious, very crispy on the outside and soft inside. The watermelon juice tasted like they used real watermelon with no sugar added. The Hong Kong style milk tea was pretty good, not too sweet and a lot of tea taste. 
Overall, it was pretty good, but next time I would not order as much.
author: Jackie X.

description:
Kowloon Tong offers a verity of desserts ranging from mixed fruits with sago to ice cream with waffles. It's diverse, but to me the selection is still limited. Parking around the area got a lot harder, since Smart and Final now tows cars!

I've tried just about everything on their menu, and nothing pops to me and makes me want to come back for more. The shaved ice with red bean was pretty good last time though, and the waffle ice cream sundae's are tasty as well. However, when I feel I can make it on my own, it turns me away from the restaurant with the pricey tag.
author: Austin N.

description:
Kowloon Tong... I don't even know what it means.  I think my former co-worker told me it was a place in Hong Kong?  I'm not sure.  I would've never gone here if my former co-worker who is Chinese didn't bring me here.  I've been to Creations Dessert so I knew what I was coming into, I just wasn't familiar with the name.  I always come here around 9pm to like 11pm.  I would usually be the only non-Chinese there along with my other co-workers.  I know a lot of folks have said that they can be as Chinese as they wanna be.  As for me, I can speak as loud as I can be (in English) and I don't care, hahah.  My Chinese co-worker gets embarassed every time I do that.  

The food, the quality isn't the best as they use low-quality ice cream and other sorts.  The extra star is the steamed egg/milk/coconut custard, yummy.  The fruit desserts are good too.  Service-wise... it's okay.  Location... it's not really around eating place, but I know where it is, hahah.  Price? I never check with this place, yea I know.  hahah.  

If you don't feel like drinking coffee like going to Starbucks (they're usually close early) after a meal, this is a good hang out place.  I see this as a hang out place, I think they need comfortable seats so people can chill here.  

Overall, I like this place until I can find a better one.
author: Claire J.

description:
I would've written a review for this place sooner if I remembered the name. I only know it as "the place with the waitress" or thats what I used to call it. A while ago a really hot waitress worked there. She had perfect posture, red fox tail like hair, and wore tight designer jeans. Also she always smiled when serving customers even if the place was packed. Wait...this is suppose to be a review about the cafe not the ex-waitress.

Since she left I really don't come here a lot. They serve typical HK style desserts like egg puffs and waffles with peanut butter. I actually enjoy the fried chicken here although it's a bit hot to eat. I also like how they pour tea in metal kegs and when the guy asks "would you gentlemen care for more tea?" Definitely not as good as the old waitress but I do appreciate the greeting.

Kowloon is your typical dessert HK cafe. It used to stand out from the rest but now it's just another place to go to if your in the area and can find parking. Good place for a date since the waitress is gone and won't be distracting you.
author: Michael Y.

description:
MMM mmm MMM

There's nothing like a homemade waffle or egg puff on a chilly SF night, paired with fresh cut mixed fruits, pudding, ice cream, sago, grass jelly, or whatever your heart desires, really. Once again, the pictures on the menu are very helpful! I CRAVE mango madness day in and day out.

I LOVE this place. They have more tables and space than most of the dessert cafes in SF, so this is my top choice for sweet midnight snackies.

Sure, this place is at times hectic, and the staff is sometimes forgetful, but to me, Kowloon Tong has been a reliable outlet to get my sodium and fructose intake on at the same place, usually, just after midnight.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Our favorite dessert place, canto-style.  I'm a big fan of the peanut paste soup with sesame balls.  Of course, there's the infamous peanut butter french toast.  Good place to go after a meal or for a quick snack.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I came here with a friend recently and it's pretty good. 

We ordered rice crepe, ice cream waffles, and peanut butter french toast. This place isn't like Creations where you order something and it is enough for one person. I think this place is more for sharing so it's good to order a bunch of stuff at a time and try everything. 

The rice crepe was really hot when it came out and I had to wait a bit before being able to eat it. It was good, but my mom has made something like that before so I wasn't that amazed by it. The ice cream waffles was probably my favorite. It's pretty much an ice cream sandwich but with waffles. They cut it into fours so you can eat it without it being too messy. I think that it was a bit plain though because you usually eat waffles with syrup. But the ice cream was still good with it. At first, I thought that the peanut butter french toast had peanut butter baked into it. But instead, it's french toast with peanut butter in the middle. That was pretty good, but I thought there was a lot of peanut butter and I didn't taste as much french toast as I would have liked. It was still good though. 

Overall, I would come back to try some of the other stuff. They have such a huge selection to choose from and the food is pretty cheap. For three items, we only had to pay about $15.
author: Jenny L.

description: I was a little sad that we had eaten right before going here because the savory snacks (i.e. the deep-fried chicken wings that ended up at the table next to ours) looked delicious. I had the red bean pudding with mango. The mango was definitely the best part and it seems like you can add it to anything! The red bean was alright...not sweet enough for me...but I can see how other people would enjoy it.
author: Charlene R.

description: I was here once before back in 2009 and it reminded me of the Hong Kong style cafe when I was a child.  I decided to go again in a recent trip to SF but I was extremely disappointed. The service was horrible.  I love deep fried peanut butter french toast but it came out without peanut butter inside.  I told the waiter and he offered to give it to me on the side but I refused. They did remake it but it was nothing like I remember.
author: Amy L.

description: I like how the variety of snacks they have on the menu. Theres egg puffs, mango pudding, curry fish balls, noodles, etc. It's not pricey and it looks tasty somewhat. I just don't like how the food looks like you can make at home.
author: M L.

description:
Tasty Hong Kong style desserts! They have really good egg puffs here and the waffles aren't bad, but everything else is pretty average. They usually give hot tea, which is a nice touch when it's cold and you're waiting for your dessert.

The service is SUPER slow. I don't understand, but every time I've come, there's always just ONE person taking orders/working the register/bringing the desserts to tables. Um hire someone else? :T

Also, CASH ONLY.
author: Kei H.

description: This place sucks! I was here with my girlfriend we ordered super b kid grass jelly and she got mango go go, our server FORGOT the mango go go and waited a good half hour, the server said "oh sorry".  Customer service here is bad and slow, if you come here be ready to get your orders forgotten or wait longer than expected
author: Jerwin C.

description: Dont get me wrong, the desserts are okay, BUT me plus 7 of my family members/friends waited for 30-45 minutes for a table and we had to go in and ask them if they could add a table to an open one so that we could be seated (because the large party before us wasn't close to leaving) plus people after us were getting seated before. We were finally able to get a table added and sat down. Then the waiter comes to our table and says that he refuses to provide service and we were dumfounded. We asked them what we did wrong because all we asked for was an extra table. So we asked who the manager was and they told us "We can't give you his name". First of all you can't hide your manager from customers when they ask it's just bad service. We proceeded to ask if the manager was even there and they said "No he's not" so we then asked who was in charge then and the waiter replied snottily "We are ALL in charge". This wasn't the worst part. A woman in our party went followed one of the employees to the cash register and asked what we did wrong and all they could reply was "We don't have to serve you" she then asked for the manager again and the employee picked up a note pad and started yelling at her "If you have a problem write it on this and I'll give it to my manager!" As he was saying that he inched closer and closer to her face while making dramatic movements eith the pen and notepad and ended his sentence with slamming the notepad and pen on the counter in front of her. I don't know why they let go of good business JUST because they refused to add a table for a 8 person party AND on top of that they yelled at one of our female party members and made her feel threatened enough to the point where she was afraid and had to back away and ask if he was going to hit her. We were furious but the only thing we could do was leave with a sour taste in our mouths.
