Honestly you might have luck with a 2-4 man party but I'd highly highly recommend against anything larger or else you might receive the same treatment.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I went to this restaurant several times before. i ordered some of their dessert and the taste is awful and very plain

CONCLUSION = NOT RECOMMENDED!
author: Aris L.

description:
I've been here for a couple of times and I really liked it!
I just came back from there actually lol. and this time i ordered a shaved ice dessert with a scoop of green tea :)

it was good but the scoop was a little small for an additional $1, but that's okay. I mainly went there for the toy machines (I'm still a kid at heart but who says no to a hello kitty ?)I got two hello kitty toys and one super hero one lol

However, the place is a good place for a late night crave for desserts! the people who were working that day were really friendly :)
author: Kristin L.

description:
I was craving some asian desserts after dinner one day and decided to come to this place. I walk in and it was seriously poppin. It's not located at a typical place like on Taraval or Irving or even Clement.. It is off of Geary but on the corner of a street full of houses. 
It was pretty busy when we got there but we were seated immediately. Five minutes later, there was a line outside waiting for seats. This place is open till pretty late so people tend to stay and linger and chat which is nice for catching up. 
They have a lot of fruity stuff and a big selection of different types of asian desserts. The waiter we had was super friendly and took the time to explain to us what certain things were unlike some other asian places where they are really quick with you and are kinda rude. 
I really enjoyed the waffle ice cream sandwich and the mango sago. The egg puffs are pretty typical and since you can't really go wrong with them, they were good. I would definitely come here again.
author: T L.

description:
I came here recently & was *sorely* disappointed.
The fruit drinks were bland & service was bad even for a Chinese place's standards. Perhaps it was because every single seat was taken & there were only 2 people waiting on the whole entire place (and by waiting I mean making all the desserts, seating people, cleaning tables, serving food, and running the cash register all at once).

I don't think I'll come back here again...although there are so few late nite places in SF that perhaps I'll forget when I'm craving eggettes again.
--------------------------------
I've been here 3 times and have never been disappointed! I think they're food is much better than Golden Island & Dessert Creations House. From the eggettes, to the ice cream with waffle, to the sago/"tong saer"...everything is good.

I don't expect service here to be any different than dim sum....so I really just come for the food. 

It has always been pretty crowded every time I have come with people waiting for tables to open up. 

Note: When I called them yesterday to ask what time they closed, they said 2 a.m. But be sure to call just in case....
(Nice to know of more places open late in the city...)
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Kowloon is an alright Chinese dessert place, but i like 100% sweet cafe and creations better. The ambiance of this place isn't as great as the two others I've been to, but the desserts aren't bad. 

The service is mediocre. When the waiter asks us if we're ready to order and if we say not yet, he comes back in about a minute and asks again. This goes on in a cycle if you're indecisive. The waiters and waitresses are friendly though, so that's good.

The desserts are pretty good. I've had their french toast with peanut butter and condense milk and it was good. Nothing special, but what can i expect from those simple ingredients. It's pretty much like comfort food. They also have ramen with lunch meat. Great for late night munchies.  

Usually you'll find Asian college students who come back from break here and other places like 100% and creations. These are popular late night hang out joints. The food is good and the service is ok. I think there are a lot better Asian dessert places but the prices aren't bad here either.
author: robin w.

description:
Kowloon Tong is the place where my friends and I would go to for study breaks during finals/ random hungry nights. I love their egg puffs! They have a good variety of  cold and hot desserts. A place to go where you're hammered/ starving. Cheap and affordable for hungry students at night. Their service varies; sometimes its good, sometimes its not.  
All in all, it's a decent place to satisfy your stomach.
author: Tessa A.

description: Decent, average Chinese late night snack food/dessert place. Nothing particularly special - we ordered a few different items and all were average - nothing outstanding or anything. Service is normal for a Chinese restaurant.
author: Kelly D.

description: Service here SUCKS. At first, we got seated but they didnt take our order until after 10 minutes and took another 30 minutes for it to come out. We ordered DESERTS, not fried food. People who came 5-10 minutes after us and order fried food got their food before we did. All we ordered was deserts. Small group that ordered 3 deserts. After 5 minutes, we see a group leaving already so we assumed it was bad service because they were seated after we did. 30 minutes later, when we were super impatient, 2 of our deserts came out. My desert didnt. I ordered shaved ice.  It does not take fricking 30 minutes to make shaved ice. I decided I didnt want it anymore. The server asked if I wanted now after cancelling it. Hell fricking no I do not want your lousy shaved ice after waiting 30 minutes! You expect me to just forgive you guys by making it right away? No. Worse experience ever. Friends said deserts tasted bland, with no flavor either.
author: Lina D.

description:
How could I not have a review for this place yet. I used to come here so frequently. Practically everytime I'd run into people from high school or something.

Most things I've had are good. But it does get packed especially on weekend nights, so be prepared to wait.

Oh, I miss it now. Must make a trip for dessert soon. :)
author: Anita C.

description: Kowloon Cafe is fun to go to for the name, if for nothing else. I wouldn't go for the food itself, but it's a great place to hang out with friends after eating out, or a night out, and to get some tolerable versions of Chinese desserts. I had the sundae waffle, and the ice cream was awful, but the waffle was good. AK had the eggettes, or whatever they call them there (puffs?) and those are fun to pick at and munch, and the dumplings (you can get peanut, sesame, red bean, etc.) in the sweet soups (peanut, sesame, red bean, etc.) are good for a cold night. Each dessert is about $4 or $5. And service is unusually friendly for a place like this. It's great for fob-watching too. I'm a fob myself, so I know this.
author: Ming-Jou C.

description: Came for a late night meal and dessert with the bf. They have this new thing on the menu where you pick your protein + sauce + rice/spaghetti + free choice of hot drink for $7.95 or add $1 for cold drink . And then you can add $2 for choice of tofu fa, mango pudding, tortoise jelly and one other thing. He ordered the chicken steak with black pepper sauce over rice and added the tofu fa for me. The chicken steak was super juicy and tender. The black pepper sauce was pretty disappointing though, it was a very loose gravy with black pepper. We frequent dessert places with our friends very often and this is one of our favorite places, so we'll definitely be returning soon.
author: Sarah L.

description:
BANANA SPLIT ICE CREAM WAFFLE SANDWICH! 

Do they make birthday cakes out of this? Holy crapola. This dish (for $6) is ginormous... there's four pieces each with its own flavor of icecream w/ banana (vanilla, chocolate, or strawberry).

They have a ton of check-in specials for Yelp (Spend $25 and get a banana split ice cream waffle sandwich for free) and Facebook (Spend $20, tag a friend, and get an ice cream waffle sandwich for free). Unfortunately, that equates to buying at least 4 desserts, and consuming 5. Which is a bit overload, so don't forget to bring your friends... all your friends.

We got the egg puffs (very mild, and good. but not mindblowing as the flavors are mild) and mango sago (OK-- but not my cup of tea... I enjoy chocolatey flavors).

It was pretty packed on a Tuesday night with a mixed crowd -- so if you're not Asian, not to worry.

The waitstaff is also on point and great, which is an added plus. Clean atmosphere and fun place to kill an hour or two or ten.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Makes me think of the time I was in my hometown. The deserts are good; it's not easy to find a place that can make me recall the time when I was in my hometown..
author: Chester W.

description: I absolutely love this dessert place!!! I come here with my friends at least once a month.  My favorite here is the strawberry madness! It has ice cream, mixed fruit and jelly on top.  It is very refreshing and delicious.  We also almost always order the chicken wings and french fries as something to munch on.  The place is small but it is very cozy and hits the our sweet tooth.  They also have yelp and Facebook check in deals for free ice cream sundae or ice cream waffle.  This place is definitely my favorite dessert place in SF so far.  I have been to creations and was not impressed, but Kowloon Tong Dessert Cafe is the place to fulfill my sweet cravings!!!
author: Jennie W.

description: This is a really nice hang out place. They provide many kinds of desserts and food. Prices are good and they offer free dessert if you check in your yelp account or facebook. They are usually busy on the weekend and you have to wait to be seated. At that time their service might be slow but their food and desserts are really good. A lot of my friends love that place!
author: Cally C.

description:
the closest thing to hk desserts, minus the 12 hr flight...

just got back from a jaunt to hk a few months ago and been craving some "yeung chee kum lou" (mango shaved ice with pomelo bits and chunks of mango). so brought my sweet tooth and was about 82% satisfied. Yummilicious, and the variety of stuff you can order definitely warrants a +1 star bonus. Check in on the yelp app or facebook and there's a sweet little bonus for ya. Did i already say sweet? sweet.
author: nic t.

description: Had the pork rolls and the egg puffs. The pork rolls had very little pork and didn't have much flavor besides the peanut sauce. The egg puffs were better - nice and crispy. The waiter was pretty funny. He had a hair clip in his hair and talked like he was in Star Trek and makes a gesture and says "EN-JOY!". Parking sucks around here so be prepared to circle a couple of times before getting a spot.
author: Cynthia C.

description: if you want to be a badass HK boy and eat some fruity sago, this is the place to be.  good stuff, fresh but not cheap.  you can get carried away ordering small bowls of sweet stuff.  they will give you a free banana sundae if you spend 30 bucks, really?  after 30 bucks of dessert, how the hell are you going to down a sundae?  oh and I asked if I can bring it home, the answer is no.
author: Kevin L.

description:
It was a cold night. After we stuffed ourselves silly with some good chinese food, our group head over to Kowloon Tong Cafe for some very much needed dessert. 

I love the fruit cup with variety of jellies they have here. It's so yummy, a perfect way to end the night, gracefully accompanying facebook photo uploads and silly recaps of the day. 

The warm tea, the crowded asian people, and delicious eff puffs, a cup full of jelly and fruit toppings. Good for your digestive system too, btw. If you order guilinggao, it's also good for your skin. 

I recommend everything as I'm a sucker for dessert, hot or cold, sweet or sour, but my favorite is fruit cup and egg puff. 

Also, on the weekend, be ready to spot some cute girls/ guys. =)
author: tee w.

description:
This place has many yummy desserts.
Quick service, good customer service as well.
The only down side is that you have to pay in cash and limited seatings. It's not a really good place to just 'hang out' because it's always so jammed packed with people no matter what hour you're there.
The egg puff is definitely one of their best dishes, because of the crispness  on the outside and soft on the inside. We got it twice and it was just perfect.
author: DANA L.

description:
it was packed, but the line was moving, so didn't had to wait long for a table!

The Pears Steamed Almonds  was average.. the pears were still hard, but overall just the right sweetness
author: Coco L.

description:
It was a unusually warm day in the Richmond area. Just a few hours earlier in the day I was baking in the sun at Golden Gate Park. But then evening came all too soon and the fog was rolling in again. A friend took us to this cafe and we were immediately served with hot tea.

How cool is it when someone in our party knew one of the workers there? Got free egg puffs because of it!

Desserts are yummy. My momochacha was quite ordinary, but the ice cream waffle sandwich was delicious!

Flat screen TV was tuned to a hilarious TVB show!
author: Eric C.

description:
The pork and cheese sandwhiches are yummy! Sometimes i will get the maccroni soup. But overall, I won't get dessert in this place. For some odd reason i don't order any of it here. 

Service... Well its a hit and miss. Strangely their best workers does not work here any more. There was a dude that serve us really well... 

Ah Noo Homo.. =)



My Friends Opinions: The desserts are okay and it looks good. 

Parking.... Before you can park at Smart and Finals! But now.... they don't allow people parking in their lots. 

Be Warned: DO NOT PARK AT SMART AND FINALS NO MORE!!! Chances are you might get your car towed away. The security guard apparently live there..... LOL...  Jking on him living there..


My 4 Stars - 2 star for my pork and cheese sandwiches with fries. 
                      1 star for that dude that serve back then... (-1/2 star now)
                      1 star for smart and final parking space... (-1/2 star now)
author: Ernest S.

description: My friends took me here for some late night snacks and desserts. The place is pretty small and there's not much decor. The service, food, and dessert was overall average. Street parking.
author: Anji W.

description:
I came here w/ my friend around midnight the other night because we were craving sago. It wasn't that crowded so we were seated immediately. The two of us sat at a table for six haha.

I ordered the mixed fruit in watermelon puree w/ sago while my friend ordered the same thing but in strawberry puree. We also ordered egg puffs to munch on.

Our order came out pretty quickly. I don't know if it was just me, but I felt like my sago left kind of a weird aftertaste. The watermelon puree also tasted kind of flavorless. Let's just say that I've had better.

The egg puffs tasted egg-ier than I'm used to, too.
author: Justine O.

description: terrible service; the guy serving there acts like he's the owner and was extremely rude.
author: Muka M.

description: I came here with some friends after my lackluster meal at Chapeau!  My friends ordered the egg puffs and the waffle sundae and they wolfed that down and seemed to enjoy it very much.  The boyfriend had the hot tofu with brown sugar (he originally wanted shaved ice, but the shaved ice machine was broken) and I had the B-kid grass jelly which was delicious.  It was exactly what I wanted, grass jelly and fruit.  Totally hit the spot and made up for lacking meal elsewhere.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Slow service when busy. Good for late night dessert. Don't go here unless you're desperate.
author: Nancy W.

description: Terrible dessert place. Horrendous service - the servers were rude and didn't care about their customers. After we sat down and looked at the menu, the server came by without saying anything and we told her that we weren't ready yet. She pretty much disappeared until we had to stand up and make eye contact with her to get her attention. She acknowledged our eye contact for half a second and kept on walking away to her other customers without saying a word. How rude! When she came by to take our order, she didn't say any word again and just wrote down what we asked for. Took forever for the the food and dessert to come out. The popcorn chicken was so salty and, quiet honestly, way worse than that at Quickly. The taro in coconut milk and sticky rice dessert was mediocre. When we were done with the food, we actually had to walk to register to pay because no one came by to ask us if we wanted the check. We saw one couple who came in, sat down for a while and walked back out because no one bothered to take their order or ask them anything. There's also another guy at a different table who had to shout "can we order now?" to the two servers who were just standing behind the register counter minding their own business. Awful food and service. Will never set food in this place again.
author: Vicheth K.

description: This place reminded me of Creations on Geary. I got the toast with peanut butter and condense milk which was yummy. I'm thinking about making it for breakfast because it is so good. My boyfriend got the ice cream waffle sandwich i believe and it was also yummy. It comes with the usual flavors: chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry but the chocolate taste weird for some reason. I also got a cantaloupe smoothie but it didn't taste like cantaloupe for some reason but more of evaporated condense milk.
author: Janice V.

description: I loooooove kowloon! It's a little pricey but it's such a cute little place with cute little snacks and such! It's definitely a place to try put. Sorry it's so short yelp but I thought it was pretty good. And it better be good for the price lol
author: Song D.

description:
We settled on this place late Friday night after Creations said the wait would be at least 15 minutes for 9 people. When we came here, we were lucky, parking wasn't too bad and we were able to get a table right away. The egg puffs and ice cream waffle (got mine with green tea ice cream) are good! 

If you check-in on Facebook and spend $20 you get a free ice cream waffle! If you check-in with Yelp & spend $25 you get a free banana split/ice cream sundae. Definitely need to come with a big group or be prepared to spend a lot just to get the free items :P
author: Jess H.

description: The deserts are decent. Not magnificent. I had the taro coconut milk pudding. It wasn't too sweet and just right for my taste. The service wasn't so great. It took a long time for our food and also they asked what ice cream we wanted for our FREE waffle sandwich and we said "GREEN TEA" like three times. They still gave us vanilla ice cream. If that was the only choice then why ask? WTF.
author: Lai P.

description: I spent 2 months in Hong Kong living and playing...Never tried the egg puffs there. I know right?! Well, I had them here and they were quite the treat. I wish a place like this existed in the South Bay closer to where I live. I love the mango + fruits Sago dessert. It's so refreshing. Why isn't there a Kowloon Tong Dessert Cafe in Southbay?! Plus, they show TVB dramas on the TV!
author: Jamie T.

description:
After bar hopping and couple games of pool, we decided to get dessert on a whim and walked into this place at half past midnight, and it was packed. I noticed that a lot of people didn't like the service, but the guy that was working seemed really nice. He was really funny too! 

Anyway, I think he messed up on our order a lil bit because we asked for mixed fruit with coconut milk sago and we got it without the mixed fruit and just the sago and coconut milk. It's ok. I don't blame him, he seemed to be doing a good job since there were only 2 people working. 

We also ordered a popcorn chicken and it was pretty good. A little too salty for me but much less greasy than Quickly's popcorn chicken. We also ordered a egg waffle and it was really good.

With that said, there aren't any dessert places in the east bay so given that I was in the area and came here on a whim and enjoyed the experience, I will come here again if I'm in the area.
author: Stephy Y.

description:
I never did have a sweet tooth. Dessert was something I always skipped but I come to Kowloon Tong every now and then when I have a bizarre craving for something sweet.

I haven't gone to many dessert places but I definitely know this place isn't the best. As a matter of fact, it's pricey for what they serve. I stick to what I like like waffles and ice cream or egg puffs. The service is usually slow here just because there are two waiters for a full house.

The male waiter is pretty funny, or at least he's funny to me. He makes me trips a little more exciting each time
author: Connie C.

description:
Good times!
Went here with a few friends to work on a project and get some food. Service was pretty prompt and very good with our orders.

We each got the daily specials:

Chicken Steak (1 order with curry sauce), Pan Fried Pork Chop (1 order with satay sauce and one with black pepper sauce) , Two Fried Eggs & Luncheon Meat. Each came with rice and a hot drink! Not bad for a dessert place.

The waffle ice cream sandwiches and banana split were aweome! Definitely recommend them.

They were really prompt about refilling the tea as well. That's service!
author: Bernard R.

description: Ice cream waffle is over hyped! Went to this place and I wasn't impressed, it was plain. I Ordered popcorn chicken, it looked like chicken nuggets chopped into pieces with seasoning. I waiters pants were so low I saw his butt crack. Very unpleasant. I do not recommend this place!
author: Sally L.

description: Friendly, never crowded but lower quality ingredients make this place just mediocre.. If you're looking for a quality dining experience go elsewhere but if you're looking for decent desserts and don't want to wait outside in the fog at Genki Crepes, then this might be the place for you.
author: Luke W.

description: Egg puff has no egg taste, coconut taro purple rice and mango black sticky rice are too sweet but watery with no other flavors
author: Marvellous M.

description:
I usually go to dessert places in the Sunset like Golden Island and 37 Degrees. Last week, while passing thru on Geary I decided to give this place a second try ; I came here once before maybe during the prior year.

The service does not seem the most organized. I say this partly from observing having to call the server repeatedly for things.

I ordered mixed fruit tapioca with watermelon juice. Just tapioca dish reminds me of my trip to HK on 1994 when I was introduced to this. That was my first time back since immigrating with US as a child 19 years earlier. Since that trip I love making repeated trips back there. Back yo the dessert, I ordered the buree style which came with milk. It was okay, but I think I prefer the style at Golden Island with shaved ice.
author: H K.

description: I was in need of a tortoise jelly or something to cool down my stomach.  We went to dinner at The Stinking Rose and came out feeling not so good because the garlic was tearing us up.  Chinese tradition is to have something to cool down the fire.  I was craving for some tortoise jelly because I knew it would help.  My cousin took me to this place.  Boyfriend ordered a Mango Tapioca which was really good and the Tortoise Jelly was amazing.  It's not bitter at all and just the right amount of sugar.  Yum
author: Alice T.

description:
This is as Asian as it gets when it comes to HK desserts. Although known for their desserts, I should note that they do have other snacks like fried chicken wings, noodles, etc... However, I normally come here for the sweet stuff so I'll focus this review on that.

I tend to stick with their "sai mai lou" ( dishesthe white pearl dessert. In particular, I like the mango flavor. I think they use real mango but honestly I'm not sure. Either way, it still tastes pretty good. 

My friends tend to get a variety of things--from ice cream to drinks. I can't say if their dishes are just as good but at least they look appealing enough especially their ice cream with waffle pieces.

Pretty cool place to come to at night. It can get crowded so be ready to wait. 3.5 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
food: 3/5
service: 4/5
decor/atmosphere: 3/5

This was one of the first asian Hong kong style dessert places that opened up in SF that I went to. I still remember when it opened up. This place has been here many many years and is still fairly popular. Kowloon Tong serves up your usual HK snacks such as fried chicken, popcorn chicken, calamari, noodles, etc. And they have tons of asian desserts, both hot and cold. There is also a pretty good drink menu. Service can be good or bad, typical of an asian place. If any of you get the waffle ice cream sandwiches, they are really big. I suggest you share it. Over all, the food is so so. I would say slightly above average but not outstanding. Like most HK dessert places, the decor is pretty dismal. People really come here just for hang outs. The thing I really like about late night asian places are that no one kicks you out if you stay too long. We don't come here for the food, we come to socialize. Just a tip, I know that they now have a minimum amount that each person in the table must buy. I actually think this is BS since alot of people come here for desserts and share. I can understand a large party just taking up space, but i think for small tables it is hard to enforce that without being jerks.
author: Cecile S.

description: Typical HK dessert cafe. I like that there are so many options. This place can get packed. I always get the strawberry sago which is usually good. I come here when my friends want to sit and chat for hours and just get some cheap Asian dessert.
author: Annie P.

description: The desserts here are a bit below mediocre. It really doesn't taste that great and it's not that unique. You can really make the waffle sundae or the waffle ice cream sandwiches on your own. The ice cream they use doesn't taste of good quality. I have tried some of the Chinese desserts here before and they are not good. The place can be really busy at night and they don't seem to have enough waiters/waitresses so asking for napkins or tea can get frustrating. This place is usually the last place I would consider going if I was craving for late night snacks.
author: Lucy C.

description:
I'm a total fan of Kowloon Tong, and I'm quite surprised that it only has an overall 3 star rating. It is what it is at Kowloon Tong--simple, cozy Hong Kong style cafe with friendly service to boot (even to me a non-Chinese speaker). 

I keep coming back for their HK style milk tea--the best in the city (and battle the ones I had in Oakland Chinatown); egg puff, and their sago anything! Once in a blue moon I'll order something savory...I suggest taking a look at their day's special as so far they haven't disappointed. 

Love that they're open late and have plenty of tables. Quick service (for the most part) is another added bonus. Go to Kowloon Tong for a plethora of Asian desserts and savory bites as well.
author: Marie B.

description:
This Asian dessert cafe has a great selection of traditional HK desserts like glutinous rice balls, egg puffs, ice-cream waffles, brick toast, mango/fruit/sago and shaved ice.

The real highlight was "snow frog" on their menu. My first time there, I was deciding between "snow frog" or the white fungus/steamed papaya (a warm, sweet soup with chewy white fungus and small stewed papaya chunks...as tasty as it sounds). 

I asked our nice waiter if the "snow frog" was real frog, to which he replied "oh yes, it is actually the fallopian tube of the frog". Tempting, but it was outweighed by being slightly perturbed at ingesting part of a female frog's reproductive system. 

That dish threw me off, and I forgot to ask him what the "tortoise jelly" was. Guess I'll have to come back and find out. For now, ignorance is bliss.
author: Miriam K.

description:
Probably the nicest staff of workers I have ever experienced at a cafe. The people here are super nice and always willing to serve with respect to the customer. One specific employee though was really friendly. He joked about how him and I are long lost brothers because we looked alike. It was totally random, but super friendly where I had to like him. Added more onto that, later on I saw him run to customers that left just so they get their to go bag they left behind. He ran about almost a long block to find them. Super nice.

As for the food, the food wasn't bad. I got a milkshake and it was your typical milkshake. Their other foods like the popcorn chicken, fries, etc we had was however tasty. It filled my hunger and I enjoyed it.

So I recommend this place to people with a late night hunger.

P.S. Place is cheap.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Always love the ice-cream waffle! Tonight they gave strawberry ones for free with order of 25 or more!  Love the new flavor no less than the banana ones!! lol
author: Annie Z.

description: One of my favorite cantonese dessert place, crowded every night.
author: Yan X.

description:
After an amazing dinner at Anh Hong, I had the hugest hankering for something sweet...I know I know, what a fatass!

I arrived at 10pm and the whole place was packed.  It took us awhile to get our orders in but seeing as though there's only 1 waitress and 864398742 people, I let it slide.  Hey, I can be understanding too!

We ordered the mixed fruits ice cream waffle sandwich and french fries (I can't resist anything fried;it's my Kryptonite).  It was exactly like I remembered, a huge dollop of strawberry ice cream mixed in with canned fruits nestled in between 2 crunchy pieces of waffle.  HEAVEN.

My other favorites include the deep fried fish balls, fried chicken wings, any of their ramen/instant noodle dishes, mango sago and the egg puffs.  

Great place to catch up with an old friend on a cold night.
author: Lisa W.

description: Mixed fruit Ice cream waffle sandwich. nuff said bitches
author: Alvin P.

description: Dessert was very typical, and i hate how they forced us to like their shop just so we can get some free waffles, that ended up on our bill...
author: Geezy L.

description:
OH HOW I LOVE THIS PLACE!  I been going here for about five years now and it never fails.  I am a simple girl with simple needs.  I always get the same things and they are always delicious!  

What I usually get:

Egg puffs- A must if you are coming here

HK style waffles- It is filled with peanut butter, condensed milk, and butter. (I'm not a fan of the ice cream waffle sandwich, but if that is your thing go for it.)

HK style toast- A thick slice of toast topped with again peanut butter, condensed milk, and butter.

Milk tea with grass jelly and vanilla ice cream-  They don't have it on the menu anymore so if you want to try you have to ask for it, but it is soooo good!

Fried chicken Wings-  Fantastic when you're either REALLY hungry, or drunk, but don't get if you're not because it is really greasy.

Overall I like this place.  The service is quick and friendly, and the place is cheap!  I ordered all that last nice and it was about $18 without tip.  Try it out.  

If you plan to drive to this place go after 7 pm and park on Geary Street.  TONS of free parking there.
author: Lyly P.

description:
It's okay but it's not worth it to me to go there when the service sucks butt. I would go there if I'm in the area because the food is pretty good. Other than that, if I'm craving for desert and I'm not in the area, forget it! Unless it's after 12am where most places close. 
3 stars for opening late and decent asian desert. 
-2 stars for really sucky servers that would just ignore you! Not a fan on coming there on late night weekends because it will be packed! Get there with a backup plan!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Ideal place to grab late night Hong Kong desserts, drinks and snacks. I really enjoyed the mixed fruit sago and puffs. The ice cream waffle looked good too. I didn't enjoy coffee with condensed milk. I thought it would be similar to Vietnamese coffee but it wasn't. It's SUPER sweet. Ugh, I couldn't finish it.

The back area towards the restroom is dirty and doesn't smell all too good. I hope that doesn't effect the food they serve here!

Parking can be a pain around here. If you come late at night, I parked in the Smart & Final parking lot.
author: Melissa T.

description: I love getting Chinese desserts in SF and this place always comes up as one of the best in the GG Park area, always busy with an innovative menu
author: Iris K.

description:
I'm a huge fan of desserts. 

I tried their waffle & ice cream, almond milk, fruits sundae, mango sago, sweet (honey?) toast etc etc. There's nothing special about this place but the sweets are good. 

Like most Asian dessert house, their desserts are very reasonable and use a lot of fresh fruits. That's a plus.

The service? There's not much service there. The waitress is rather rude and cold. 

I don't mind going back there if I'm in the area.
author: May V.

description:
Fast and friendly service.  They have XO Sauce pan-fried rice noodles on special.  My Turkish friends introduced me to this place and I have to say so far so good.

Snack food.  Desserts.  A warm place to sit and relax on a rainy day after a long shift.  Did I mention they're open late?

I was even able to teach my friends some Cantonese so they could joke around with the staff.  I can tell they'll be going back to Kowloon Tong a lot.  I should really teach a "survival Cantonese" class to international students one of these days.  They seem to feel, unlike many Americans, that learning more languages enriches their lives and gives them more access to places, which is 100% true in my opinion.

I read some of the other reviews and they seem to be less enthusiastic.  Fuck 'em.

Kowloon Tong has:

1) Good eats.
2) Good people.
3) Good hours.

at a great location!

I don't ask for much more than that.
author: Justin C.

description: Average food, the waffles and ice cream here are good, but still just okay, the staff is pretty nice though and the prices are good. The chow mein I got was alright, the popcorn chicken was kinda funny tasting though
author: Kevin L.

description:
this place is alright.  

i go there because:
all my asian friends go here
it's open late
they have glutinous peanut balls in sesame paste
the selection is endless

but sometimes i feel tricked because i know i can make everything for a fraction of the price at home and it would taste even better, if only i stocked up at ranch 99.  i mean the ramen is packaged, the glutinous balls are sometimes freezer burned tasting, and the spammy looking luncheon meat is not even Spam brand (i know my Spam).   

just add water and stir.  that's what i'm paying 4.99 for.  for someone else to add water and stir.
author: Josie M.

description:
I came here a few times before, but the service wasn't really all that great. I came again last night after watching Wicked (GREAT musical, by the way), and I have to admit the service was a lot better. Maybe it was just the two workers who happened to be working last night? Who knows.

But anywho, the first lady who took our order was pretty chill. My friend ordered the shaved ice with ice cream (which is $1 more). Normally all their shaved ices come with a free topping (mango, grass jelly, strawberries, mixed fruits, etc) but my friend just wanted the ice cream with no free topping. The waitress kinda gave that surprised "Oh wtf?" look and we all started laughing. And my friend was like "What? Is that not normal or something?" She eventually ordered it with the mixed fruits so she could be "normal". It was pretty funny.

And then another guy brought us our tea, and one of my friends and I were very familiar with the cups (they were from Ikea). We were like "HEY! These cups look super familiar!" And the guy just said "Ikea." And we busted out laughing. He was really funny too.

It took a while for the food to come, but I can't blame them since only two people are working with a somewhat-packed cafe. The shaved ice was good, pretty crunchy though. I'm more used to a more finely-crushed iced. I actually really liked the popcorn chicken as well. Like the other reviewer mentioned, they're popcorn chicken is a lot more less greasy than the ones you'd get at Quickly's. We also ordered the Sundae Waffle. The same guy who brought us our teas even asked us what kind of ice cream we want. Normally, they just give us the original strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla. So he gets a thumbs up from me.

I know I'm talking about the tea guy a lot, but he was just so funny! So I ordered a popcorn chicken to-go to bring back home. A majority of my friends were already waiting outside or heading to their cars. So it was kind of just me sitting there. The guy eventually came back with my popcorn chicken and he was like "If your friends left you, I can drive you home." So, I didn't know if he was joking around or trying to hit on me (I'd like to go with the first option), but it was funny. 

If he's working again, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Tee C.

description: Sweet spot to hit up if you got the munchies or sweet tooth after midnight and in SF.  Parking in the area stinks since you can't park in the Smart and Finals nearby w/o getting your car towed so hope for the best and fine street parking.
author: Grant L.

description:
This place reminds me of a hole in the wall dessert restaurant in Hong Kong.  The tables are teeny with people crowded around it and the place is small. Love the desserts here especially the mango sago, the desserts are fresh and not too sweet...the fried chicken wings came out nice and hot and tasty.......the desserts came out in a small bowl for $3.95.  and two full wings for $5.95, kind of pricey for quantity but still good. 

service and parking sucks though. But hey, its a dinky hole in the wall chinese place, so I didn't expect service to be great. Parking = really sucks ass. SF parking anywhere sucks ass.

I want to go back! NOW!
author: Emi H.

description:
Located on a quiet street off of Geary, this Hong Kong style dessert cafe fulfills any  sweet tooth's dream while serving comfort food.  Kowloon Tong's attentive staff serves delicious (but not limited to) fries and chicken, rice crepes, spicy noodles with pickled cabbage and sliced pork, ice cream sandwiches, ice cream sundaes, sago desserts, and egg puffs, each under $6.

Enjoy!
author: Philina L.

description: My three wonderful girlfriends choose this place to host a welcoming party (second baby shower) for hubby and I yesterday.  I was sorta surprised by the location since I didn't know they did private parties (found out we were only the second baby shower hosted at this cafe).  The place was large enough where my gfs were able to set up a kid's activity table.  There was a buffet/snack bar and yummy treats.  We had about 40+ guests and it was wonderful.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a casual place to host a private party that is fun.
author: Mac S.

description: Tasty desserts and good snack food.  Had an ice cream waffle, which was delicious, but kind of a giant portion.
author: Yuran L.

description:
been hitting up this place more lately and have found the staff to have turned their attitude around.  not all of them, but the new dude they have there is peppy and very helpful in answering questions regarding their wide variety of contemporary asian hong kong style deserts.

the girls that work there still kinda roll their eyes if you have any questions, or hesitate when ordering.  common, let a guy and gal learn the menu by asking questions.  ya think they would realize that they benefit them the next time you would come in because you knew that the fuck ya wanted to order. :-P

**we're semi-regulars now and the girls have really warmed up.  they are smiley now and are actually quite nice.

anyways, i love the deserts there.  so many new flavors, textures, varieties to try out or enjoy again.  during those occasional hot or warm summer nights in SF, i love going to this place to eat some cooling sweet treat.  my favorite is still their shaved ice combos.  fresh fruit, shaved, ice, sprite or 7-up mixed in and topped with a scoop of ice cream.  aaahhh...relief from the heat...

the place is light and clean.  with all the hip young asian kids hanging out, i feel like i am actually in hong kong for a while while we're chomping on our desert.  cool.  its like taking a mini trip to asia.

we've tried a few of their food plates and they're not too bad.  "street" or "fast" asian food plates to prep for the main event which is their deserts.

i like their "hot" deserts too.  nice on a cold winter night in SF.  they have this mochi ball with sweet fillings like sesame paste, in hot sweet "soups" desert which hits the spot.

i dig this place, especially with their new eager to please and knowledgeable server.  order up something exciting, sweet, and new.

when it comes to well made modern asian hong kong style deserts, you can't go wrong at kowloon tong... ;-P
author: Patrick M.

description:
Pretty good. Not awesome. Servers are nice.

I like the variety but for mango, definitely go for Creations. Other than that, it's less crowded compared to Creations so it's good.

Eggpuffs is good
author: Cliff T.

description: I really like how fast the service is even when its super busy. I mostly like the ice-cream waffles here. As for the appetizers they are alright. The curry fish balls taste chewy and so does the fish siu mai. I would not recommend the fried tofu because it has no taste. The soy sauce chicken, fried chicken and fries are good though. Affordable and last time we got free ice-cream waffle w/ $20 when check in on Facebook!
author: Carmen L.

description: The waffle and ice cream sandwich is heaven. Genki has better egg puffs in my opinion.  While they did tolerate the cat (she was in a carrier), I would leave her at home next time.
author: Michael E.

description:
I love late night dessert shops! Especially if they serve eggettes and sago. I usually come here or Creations and last night, my friend and I decided to come here since it was close to my house.

I was craving eggettes for the longest time so decided to order that and the mixed fruit mango puree sago.

The sago was definitely worth trying. The fresh fruits were actually fresh AND sweet. Especially the mango pieces. They didn't skimp on those too. BUT the eggetts was a disappointment. The flavor was just not there. Didn't taste like how they should and I was just really disappointed. I wish I had went to Genki for theirs since they have so many flavors to choose from.

Service was super friendly and fast. Gets packed during late night weekends!
author: Juliane N.

description:
How the heck do I go to a Chinese place for dessert and somehow select the mochi?!?  It was "Dumplings dipped in peanut sauce and coconut" WTF!!?!

Don't tell anyone but these are some pretty good pseudo mochi. Shh! 

The egg crate thing was good too. I shoulda got the waffles and ice cream like Trevor. There's always next time.
author: Kevo M.

description:
Customer service here is pretty bad; they don't greet and seat you when you walk in, they take a long time to bring out your food (which only takes minutes to make), and they will mess up your order if you modified it.

...but their desserts and snacks are pretty good.
author: Nance W.

description:
I'm a huge fan of their waffle ice cream sandwich but had a very awkward experience today.  

On most days I sit in and enjoy my dessert but today I ordered their waffle ice cream to go.  The cashier told me it would be 15 minutes, so my friend and I sat at a corner table and skimmed through magazines.  It was nice to be indoors since it was so cold outside. Our dessert came 15 minutes later as I was in the middle of reading an article. 

It couldn't have been more than 5 minutes when a waiter came up to us and kindly asked us to leave because according to restaurant policy, people who order to-go usually immediately leave after they receive their food.  I looked around and there were only 2 other tables occupied so I knew it wasn't because they were short of tables. 

The waiter was nice but I still felt awkward and unwelcomed.  I don't think I'll be coming back for awhile no matter how great their ice-cream sandwich waffles are.
author: Shirley W.

description:
Waffles and Ice Cream, Waffles and Ice Cream, Waffles and Ice Cream

Red Beans, Red Beans, Red Beans

Waffles and Ice Cream, Waffles and Ice Cream

Mung Beans, Mung Beans

MEATLOAF SANDWICH!

I mean... MANGO TAPIOCA THING!

(sloppy goop, slop, sloppy goop... yeah)
author: Trevor F.

description:
Expensive desserts that I can make at home for 1/2 the price! BUT NONE THE LESS the dessert is good. The mixed fruit sago is good and satisfies my sweet tooth in a healthy way. 

Service is usually pretty bad, but for some reason service was quick and attentive this time, maybe its because my friend has tattoos and she was scared or something LOL! THAT'S RIGHT BETTER SERVE US! LOL!
author: Brian P.

description:
GREAT HK style chinese desserts here.  Service blows, but ah well.
ALWAYS get the gei-dan-zai (chicken egg things) that are like waffles you break into little egg shaped pieces...hard to describe.  So tasty and chewy.

I like getting the mixed fruit with black sweet rice, but the tapioca is good too.  They also have a decent turtle jelly here and grass jelly.

They have the mysterious "snow frog"...which no one can agree on, as to what it is.  I have heard things ranging  from frog fat, to frog saliva glands, to frog semen.  No one agrees....  Take a chance on it!  Supposed to be good for you.... 

Have I mentioned I pretty much always come here for dessert whenever I have dinner in the Clement/Brothers BBQ stretch of the inner richmond?
author: Fong L.

description:
If I could give this place ZERO or NEGATIVE stars I would. I have frequented this place a few times only because my actual favorite HK dessert cafe was too packed. 
This place has the worst service ever! As I myself am a waitress, i'm sympathetic to how it can be on busy nights but the last time I came here, it was not busy at all. There were about 5 other people inside and they never served us. They didn't give us any tea or hot water (like they're SUPPOSED to do when you first sit down) and when I requested it, we had to wait 15 minutes for it! I know for a fact that places like this already have the tea brewed and waiting! My friends and I told ourselves we'd give them another 10 minutes and if they didn't take our order, we'd leave. Well lo and behold, nothing happened so we got up to leave.  I loudly said "thanks for NOTHING" (in English AND in Chinese) and only then did an employee pay attention to us. 

I have put up with their craptacular service before but that was defintely the last straw. There was NO EXCUSE for the way we were treated.

Oh, and it's a bit overpriced for poor quality desserts that are CHEAP to make.
author: Susy C.

description: A good Hong Kong style dessert place. Yummy food, nice staff, good price. Can't resist to go in there every time I pass by. Really bad for my weight watch.
author: V L.

description:
A bunch of us came here as a post-valentines day dessert place. It opens pretty late and its always packed, so thats a plus. Luckily we were able to get a table before the swarm of people came in. There's always people here no matter what day of the week it is. My friends and I would come here on a weds night, and it'd still be filled with people!

This is just a typical hk style dessert place. My fav's are the hot 'dun-dan', mango sago, sticky rice with mixed fruits, egg puffs, and the hot tofu with sesame. Too bad they only serve hot tofu on the weekends. They have the waffle with ice cream that's pretty good too...but I tend to go for more of the 'asian' desserts. Prices here are cheap too - ranging from $3 and up, depending on what you want. The menu is long, so def. come back here a couple of times to try different things!
author: Betty S.

description:
Kowloon Tong Desserts keeps kids off the streets!  

The war against drugs should get a clue and start a new campaign to open Kowloon Tong Desserts nationwide.  Kids get bored and if you don't give them something to do, then they will find things to do, drink, smoke, snort, and shoot.  OK, this could get in the way of the war against obesity, but what's worse?  Chew on that!

Or better yet, just visit Kowloon Tong =)  It's open late and is jam packed with kids - hence the above little spiel.  It's bright, loud, and the service is slow - but boy, are the desserts good!  They have everything from the more traditional red bean hong kong desserts, to snow frog desserts made of actual frog spawn.  A couple of my favorites are the egg puff and the peanut butter milk toast.  Mm...the toast is smothered with peanut butter and then drizzled with condensed milk.  Oh, so good!
author: Nicole N.

description: They have some yummy treats for a mid-day snack.
author: John S.

description:
I used to be crazy about sugary sweets as a kid.  So much so that I had a ton of cavities and all kinds of fillings and caps.  I looked like a little pirate with no eye patch.  Luckily, those were pretty much all baby teeth so they fell out and after many years of painful dental work, my teeth look more or less normal.  

My taste for candy and desserts pretty much died with the last of my baby teeth.  Whatever was left of it has been banished due to recent revelations but I'll go with people when they need a fix, which was how I ended up at Kowloon. 

A friend wanted their waffle ice cream sandwich and since we were only a couple blocks away at dinner, we came by after.  I tasted the ice cream sandwich that had vanilla ice cream and banana at the center.  I would've been more impressed if it was a warm, fresh waffle but that was probably expecting too much at 10pm.  The mixed fruit sago was inedible to me because of the mango (not a fan) and sweet sauce.  Everyone else seemed to like it though.  

It was open pretty late, the service was excellent and we got to watch some Olympics on the big although not very clear TV.  Definitely A-OK.
author: Seong P.

description:
I find myself here more often recently. Their food is not better than other similar places and their service is very slow and could improve if they would refill the tasteless tea more often. 

Reason is probably due to it not being as crowded as My Favorite and parking is easier. I really shouldn't be eating so late at night.....thanks for contributing to my muffin top.
author: Katie K.

description: Their service is pretty bad and very slow. It took a while for them to get our food out. And I also asked for a refill on tea and had to wait more than 10 minutes. The guy gave another tea first and just ignored us. I'm only giving this place a 2 because the only good thing in here are the pan fried rice crepe and the egg puffs.
author: Wing C.

description:
Went here when I was in high school....been awhile since i went and now it is still the same ....

the variety of dessert is a lot to choose from...

I love the egg puffs that they have there....

the waffle with the ice cream with fruit in the middle is another one of my favorites...

the sago with mix fruit was okay...i definitely been to other places that had better sago and more mix fruit.
author: Omi Y.

description:
Came here on NYE... and was expecting more based good reviews from friends, but sad to say I have to give this place only one star.

We were greeted with rude service to start out our experience. Although our service subsequently improved after the server took our order, the food was mediocre. We ordered four items including eggettes, a mango fruit thing, Tong Yoon (a rice ball thing.. sorta like mochi but in a soup form...) and this grass jelly thing.  The eggettes SUCKED, there was no filling in each puff but only air. The mango fruit thing didn't taste fruity at all, in fact it was kinda bitter. We were promised 5 Tong Yoons but only ended up having 3.  

I don't think we will end up coming back here...
author: Natalie G.

description:
Great hangout late nite to keep them kids out of trouble.  Late nite sweets doesn't go well with my Dental Hygiene, and my sleep pattern :(  

Go with the Mango Sago! 

Wish they have one of these is Seattle
author: M C.

description: Another dessert place worth checking out after dinner. You seat yourself and the menus are under the glass on the table. (Genius!). They serve hot tea in little tin cups that are shaped-like barrels. We started with a mixed fruits mango sago, then a sundae waffles. Yummy!
author: Anne T.

description:
Honestly, there's only two good things about this place: the abundance of parking in the nearby Smart & Final, and the fact that they are open late.

But that is enough to warrant this as my favorite Chinese dessert place in the Richmond, despite the fact that the food is mediocre and service averages around mediocre as well.
author: William C.

description:
I'm really going to have to question any previous votes of anything over 3 stars.

The service is below awful.  The waiters take EASILY over 3-4 minutes to even acknowledge your existence even on a half-full-shop day...  Note: I have attended this place innumerable times simply because of other friends recommending to meet there.  When you order, the language barrier comes up yet again.  They would rather bring you the WRONG thing than to ask you to confirm what you had ordered.  This has happened to me 5 times with the same simply order of Milk Toast...HOW DO YOU RUIN MILK TOAST!?!??!  Ok, I'll settle down...or will I?  FYI, they take so long to bring you your check that you might as well run right out with your friends laughing and knocking things over as you go...sounds familiar...

Parking is available on the streets and the prices are not justified when you can easily go to other Asian mediocre desert joints all scattered across SF.

1 star for complete failure for taking up a piece of land in wonderful San Francisco!  Am I coming off as too cynical?  I'm sorry!  NO I'M NOT!
author: Terence K.

description:
Typical chinese restaurant with bad service but that's to be expected
i believe all is forgiven because i've never had a dessert as good
as the Strawberry Madness, its freaking madness how good it is.
Strawberry Ice Cream with a fruit puree, melon balls, lychee jelly,
strawberries (duh) and kiwis to make what i call a "mouthgasm"
although the only reason i'm not giving this place a 5 star 
is because they're not consistent with their AMAZING
sometimes my strawberry madness is SUPERAWESOMEWOW!!
and other times.. its not so much, sometimes they don't have kiwis T.T
and this can be madness!! when i want my amazing dessert
and they don't deliver, it can be a little frustrating .. but hey
they have plenty of other things to choose from

i also enjoi their mango sago, waffles and ice cream, 
mango madness (not as good as their strawberry)
i also enjoi their pork chop with spicy doll noodles
just your typical ramen that hits the spot, nothing fancy
i also love their rice crepes, good sauce and feels
like you're consuming lava sometimes haha but sooo good.

overall i consistently come back here to enjoi their dessert
and consistently have good times with friends especially
when i force them to try the strawberry madness for themselves!!
author: Vince D.

description: If it were not for the food+prices I would put 1star. I never realized how much service can really affect your food experience as well. Sometimes this place is so rude I would come close to boycotting the place for the rest of my life. But I'm such a sucker for sago and on top of that it is a mere 2blocks away from my home. Darnit! Curse you Kowloon. I know karma will kick your ass hard sooner or later...
author: Tracy N.

description:
when did you have to get your own tea and napkins?!?!? hahahaha maybe they thought you worked there...anyhow, I know everyone is saying this place isnt as good as hong kong and blah blah blah..

Hey we are not in hong kong so give it a rest...

They have pretty good desserts, service is pretty good considering there is usually only one waitress. The eggettes and sago are quite tasty, and i they have this one ice cream and grass jelly drink which i think tastes quite wonderful. One of the major things i like about this place is that its usually open till about 1am on the weekdays. So thats a plus for me..heh heh..
author: phillip w.

description: I have been recommended to come here many times so I finally decided to try it with my boyfriend since we were in sf. When we went we weren't even greeted. Then we ordered a mango go go, another dessert, steamed rice crepe, and a rice platter. The food came really fast but they were really stingy. There was only EIGHT fishballs for 4.50! Are you kidding me! Over 0.50 cents for 1 puny fishball. That wasn't even it. The mango go go was all powdery. If you are looking for a true a Chinese dessert, definitely don't come here. On top of that they forgot my dessert. I clearly heard the lady repeat it... Other than that the rice platter and steamed rice crepe was ok. This is a definite rip off when it comes to asian desserts. But i think the waffle ice creams are probably good since it requires barely any cooking. Definitely never coming back.
author: Ting F.

description:
Kowloon serves appetizing and not so appetizing sounding desserts (snow frogs, anyone?)--plenty of flavored milk tea, fruit drinks, and milkshakes to choose from.  But a whole lot more than desserts are available.  The menu would not be complete without fried finger foods, such as chicken wings, french fries, and balls...squid and fish, that is.  In addition, sandwiches, noodles, and eggs can also be prepared.

With several flavors of ice cream, the waffle ice cream is good, but extremely fattening.  The tortoise jelly tastes of black tea made into a jelly mold, no taste whatsoever.  Don't rely on the pictures too heavily when you're ready to place your order; you may be disappointed.  Instead, use it to get a rough idea.  The service is the worst.  The only thing worth going here for are the egg puffs (think, Eggettes: http://www.yelp.com/biz/alMVd3ZuDqSL3EIf5NQf_g?hrid=HfwVrQBSiLcOCpmvLqTMNA).  Open late, it's a short jaunt from the Richmond bar-scene.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Yummy desserts and food. The servers are nice too! There are lots of options on the menu so everyone will be satisfied :)
author: Shea T.

description: This is the go to place for people who have a thing for eating out late at night, this place has a variety of  dessert/appetizers depending on your late night cravings. i normally order their lemon ice tea, typically our line up of late night snacks would go as followed: egg puffs with a side of condense milk (MUST HAVE!!!)  soya chicken wings, ice cream waffle ((mango & strawberry) ice cream). Rarely do i spend more than $20 there with my girlfriend, the prices are reasonable. The service is pretty good, once in a blue moon they'll have a new hire that'll kinda ruin it for you, but other than that the staff is awesome, the food is awesome. they'll always have a HK drama running in the back of the cafe, so for all you  HK drama viewers, this is the place for you to pig out and enjoy your dramas outside of your homes !!  This satisfies and exceeds what i expect from a late night cafe !
author: Jeff C.

description:
It's appalling that this place has such a low overall rating.  I LOVE THIS PLACE.  It's open late and has the best Hong Kong-style desserts that I've found in SF so far.  It's a great place to hang with friends and get some good dessert after dinner.  

Well the 5 stars I give are mainly dependent on two of their desserts that I love: sesame rice balls soup and strawberry ice cream waffle sandwiches.  The egg puffs look intriguing and smell great too but I haven't tried it yet.  

The ambiance is cozy and it gets packed starting 10pm and after.  By that point it feels like you're in Asia, surrounded by all Cantonese and Mandarin speakers.

The service isn't amazing (they've gotten our orders wrong a few times), but the yum desserts and late hours override all other flaws.
author: Chris P.

description:
I was born in Hong Kong.
I'm not close to Hong Kong.
I miss Hong Kong.
Kowloon Tong allows me to be as "HK" as I want. 
I can talk in Cantonese as loud as I want here. 

The dessert selection is endless.
The desserts are delicious.
The "dun dan" (egg custards), eggettes, and sago's are bomb,
You have to come here.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
My favorite egg puff pastry in the Bay Area!  The rice noodle dish is also inexplicably delicious - I never come here craving it, but then I see it on the menu or on another table and HAVE to have it.  The fried noodles are also a good cheap filler if you haven't had dinner.

I admit I come back here so often because I'm a huge fan of the owner.  He's super nice and always smiling, not snobby at all like some of the people at other HK dessert joints.
author: Wendy T.

description:
I love goin to this place for my late-night munchies--I think they open until 1am.  I've had the egg puffs here quite a few times, and, despite what past reviewers have said, they've never been burnt.  They were yummy... not quite as good as the stuff in HK, but very good. 

 Other yummy choices on the menu:
--Spicy ramen with fishball (get the spicy one, its way better)
--Strawberry ice cream waffles with fruit inside (REALLY GOOD!)
--Deep fried chicken wings with french fries (real greasy goodness)

It's a great late-night hangout place.  There's also a big flat screen TV that always seems to play tacky Chinese music vids--def adds to the feeling that you're in a HK cafe.  The service is not bad--a bit patchy at times--but I've had much worse at other Chinese joints.
author: suzanne l.

description:
dear Mr. Tong,

I went to your place with my friends last Friday, your place was pretty full, only two empty table left. 
We seated pretty quick and one of your server serve us pretty quick too. But no greet, no smile...
We ordered some...and your server gone before we finish ordering.
I know working in the food service establishment really are tiring. But here an advise you can tell to all your servers there..."It takes 37 muscles to frown. And 22 muscles to smile. So Smile. It conserves energy ".
The desserts were pretty decent that night though, but as long as no smile there, two stars for now.

NB : Don't worry, we don't hate your place...we actually love it, but next time...we want to see a smile, please...
author: toto h.

description:
Bad. We wanted to get the free ice team waffles so we ordered a bunch of stuff
Glutinous balls with peanut- 1/5
Momochacha- -1/5 that's a negative
Zhi ma tong yuan (sesame glutinous balls in soup)  - 1/5, something wrong with soup
Fish balls with sautéed sauce- 1/5 
Xi mi Lu- 1/5

$25 worth of knowledge not to go there again.
author: Cindy L.

description:
I agree with the last reviewer.  I've been here about four times (including tonight) and tried something different every time.  I didn't even come close to liking any of their desserts.  Mango sago is my favorite dessert and theirs didn't have much mango flavor on the two occasions that I got it.  My boyfriend got the ice cream waffle sandwiches once and I thought the waffles were nasty.  The eggs puffs are also too dry and not hot enough.  But I was craving some sesame glutinous rice balls (tong yuan) tonight so I decided to give this place one more try.  Once again, I was disappointed.  I think the packaged stuff I get from May Wah tastes so much better.

Service is also horrible on the weekends.  The workers are so inefficient and it takes forever for you to even flag one down.  I would not recommend this place.  Creations, My Favorite Cafe and 100% Sweet Cafe are all way better.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
The food is so-so, but the cafe opens late on friday and saturday nights. San Francisco doesn't have a wide variety of dessert cafes. Kowloon Tong is most preferred by me and some friends. I usually get their rice noodles, spam and egg sandwich or the ramen with  chicken wings. Not really a sweet tooth person...

What I do like about this place is one of the waiters. This young scrawny HK guy. He is super funny, jokes around a lot and can really make  customers feel welcomed. What a cool dude.
author: Jenny K.

description:
closes at 1am, 2am on weekends. late night spot!

*edit: thanks for the correction, JA. :P

i came here starving like Marving, so I ordered the fried chicken wings and fries. nothing mindblowing, out-of-this-world, smack-your-momma good, but I was definitely satisfied. the chicken portion was quite large though i would've liked more fries. i washed it down with hot Aloe Vera & Lemon tea; it was surprisingly good (i've never had anything of the sort before).

i'll try the desserts next time. i'd definitely come back. i'd rather drive here than go to Oakland at night. fools might jack my Aloe Vera & Lemon tea....
author: Sean L.

description: I used to come here SO MUCH in my teens. It was the place to hit up after a night of boogeying. The desserts are great. My fave is the mango sago and the egg puffs. You can never go and not order these. The place gives wisps of the HK lifestyle...from the chinese soaps running in the background to the crowds of asian folks laughing and goofing off. It's great if you're looking for an inexpensive dessert joint.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Banana Split Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich was delicious!

Parking was not too hard but can be difficult in the area...

Overall a very nice experience, this was my first time here and went with my girlfriend and one of her friends. walked in at around 8:45 pm and it was not too crowded, got seated and got served tea, we ordered the banana split ice cream waffle sandwich and the coconut milk with taro sago and her friend ordered a mixed fruit with grass jelly. All of them looked great, of them all the sago was a bit bland but still very tasty. They also serve hot food but didn't get to try any, just had dinner prior going. Sat and talked till around 9:45 and it started to get more crowded and it filled up quick. The store is not to big seating is not too packed but very limited, i say not more than a party of 6 at a time. This place shows TVB dramas which was awesome, they where showing just so happen to be playing one of the latest dramas. Service was okay, food didn't come as quick as i expected but wasn't too bad. will defiantly be back to try their hot food and drinks.
author: Jeffrey N.

description: Went here on a Saturday around 6ish.  For a one man crew, the guy there was fast and quick and the quality was still good.  We ordered the mango sago with the Eggettes.  Both were good and the place is nice.
author: Joseph C.

description:
OK, so I'm giving this place a 5-star review to balance out Jenny L's.

Sure, it took us FOREVER to get our food.  But only because I'm a sexy sexy guy and the waitresses want to keep me there for as long as possible.  I like the slow service.  It gives me more opportunities to gawk.  No to people-watch.  Naw I'm gawking.  So what if the lady "forgot" our order?  I secretly sent her a bat signal to not put it in until way later.  Take that!

I mean, I come here with my friends and never order anything.  I just sit and wait and wait some more, until their food finally come.  Then I sit some more, drinking my (sometimes) free lukewarm tea.

And because our food took so long to come, the owner gave us free fruit.  Obviously I ate that.  WIth a smile.  Free food makes Ronald a happy boy.
author: Ronald T.

description: Came here a couple nights ago with two friends... It wasn't too packed at around 11:30p on a Wednesday night. The server was really nice about everything and the food came in a timely manner. I tried their Sundae Waffles, Hot Milk Tea and Egg Puffs.. All of which were really yummy. The Sundae Waffles came with Strawberry, Chocolate and Vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, chocolate syrup, almonds and about... 6 or 7 pieces of waffles.. Yummm. Superbly yummy. It was about.. I want to say, 5 bucks but totally worth it. Their milk tea and egg puffs were just as delicious as any other dessert place. Hehe. I like that they're open later than most dessert places on weeknights, so it makes everything more accessible. lol. The only downside about this place is that well... There was only two people serving and it took a while to get the check when groups of people came in at 12:30a. But other than that, I'd come back again. :) It's definitely up there with the other dessert places I've gone to. Hehe.
author: Susan Y.

description:
I like their egg puffs!  and the ice cream.. and the ice cream waffle.  and their papaya with snow frog.  but i sure hate going there hoping to get better service every time.  it keeps getting worse.

*edit* I changed my review to two stars... Those two stars deserve ONLY the desserts.  the others, -3FTL for sh*tty service.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Craving for some HK-style desserts like sago, peanut butter milk toast, mango pudding, or tofu pudding?  This is the perfect place for you.

However, don't come here expecting 5-star service, clean tables, or comfy chairs.  The desserts are delicious, but I wouldn't say the best.  Prices are decent, so no complaints there.  They open late which is great for people who want to catch up with friends or are jonesing for a late night snack.  It's usually crowded so expect to wait or to be within close proximity of other people.
author: Michelle W.

description:
I'll give this place a 5-star review.  The service staff was nice.  The desserts were awesome.  My friend got fresh mango, strawberry ice cream, and waffles.  I wanted her dessert more than mine.  I got fruit over grass jelly, it was awesome.  Prices were good.  Wait, I don't think I paid.  Well whatever, prices were good.

This place is great if you want to get your dessert and eat it too.  Just don't ask the owner what his favorite dish is.  

"All of them! I made the menu!!!" 

Not really the answer I was looking for, as we aren't on the streets of Hong Kong and there aren't other vendors trying to seduce me.  I wanted an honest answer.  What the hell is your favorite, man? A simple question deserves a simple answer. 

Still, I'll chalk that one up to culture and rate the place on the service and the desserts.
author: D. T.

description:
This is the one and only Chinese dessert place I've been to in San Fran so I have nothing to compare.

Waiting is a must when going late nights.  Cafe closes at 2am.  

Lots and Lots of choices and all of them are some type of Hong Kong inspired.

Tried the Watermelon sago, mango sago, and strawberry sago:  -Hated the watermelon, too liquidy and tasted more like water than watermelon
-Mango was my favorite, get a huge blast of mango flavor with every spoonful
-Strawberry was good too although mango still remains the winner out of all 3.

Egg Puff:  Not that good as compared to the street vendors in NYC, but decent. 

Aloe vera w honey:  Hated it, could have bought a whole bottom in the chinese supermarket than wasting almost 3 bucks to drink it here....will try some other drink the next time I head over (which might not be likely since I'm only visiting San Fran for a week....heheheheehe)

waiters were very nice.  offered me a better chair since he thought i looked uncomfortable sitting in the one I was sitting in.
author: Kei Ling W.

description: I love this place. I live 5 minutes from Oakland and I'd rather pay toll and drive to the city and eat dessert here. its so yummy.  I always get the egg puffs. the waffles are good, the ice cream is yummy and the madness desserts are to die for =]
author: Serena L.

description:
3.5 stars.

Not quite a fan, but sure is A-OK in my book. Well, more of a fan to Kowloon Tong than Creations.

Vs. Creations:
-More savory foods, better ones, too.
-Mixed fruit with sago in coconut milk: more coconut milk and more sago and actual ripe fruits 

When they have their Tofu-Fa (really smooth Tofu in a simple syrup kind of dessert), it's delicious and warms you up.

Atmosphere: Bright green walls.  Mirrors that line the wall for you to utilize when fixing hair that has been through 20mph winds or to double take a girl that you thought was hot, but realize that her face is just painted on. Ew. Or to check out the red-faced drunk Asian crowd. 

Service: Improved since they turned over the old staff. The only male server that works here is great entertainment. I think I may be in love... *Sigh

And recently a sign on the wall next to our table read "Starting 6/1 we will be open everynight until 2AM." Yes, exactly like that. No space.

HEY YELP! I may only have thirteen reviews thus far but MAKE ME ELITE! I'm writing this review instead of packing for my Vegas trip in less than eight hours; that's DEDICATION!
author: Maggie H.

description:
Looking back, I went through a few phases in the past. I had this japanese phase where all I really cared about was effeminate and gorgeous japanese guys (james iha!! takeshi kaneshiro!!), j-pop and j-doramas (no anime, thanks)

then I went through this HK phase when it was all about Chinatown with my good friend Ann every thursday to buy pop cds (the latest from sammi, kelly and leon) and jewelery at some store on Grant and during that phase, it was always dinner (baked porkchops over spaghetti from one of the billion HK cafes in SF), dessert house and karaoke at Safety Zone or on Fillmore afterward. 

I love HK dessert houses and I used to go to different ones pretty frequently, including this location. I was excited when this place opened up several years ago because it's so close to home. 

This place is pretty typical of an HK dessert house with a billion items to offer (the menus are on the table already). Even though I was full from Halu, I always make room for dessert and ordered 2 things: Strawberry Madness and toast with condensed milk and peanut butter. 

The strawberry madness comes in a mini banana boat with strawberry ice cream, melon, mango, strawberry puree and COCONUT JELLY CUBES. It was nice, icy and refreshing even though it was windy and cold outside. The toast was thick and gooey with peanut butter though I wished they didn't skimp on the condensed milk (one of my favorite childhood snacks used to be dipping regular ol' white bread slices into condensed milk). 

Best part is that they're open late so if you're in the mood for some good dessert, this place won't let you down. 

(PS: i also love their waffle ice cream sandwich...how can you go wrong with scoops of ice cream sandwiched in between 2 waffles?!)
author: kristin e.

description: All i can say is Mango Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich with mix fruit!!! SOOOO GOOD!!!
author: Rob G.

description: This isnt the best dessert place out there but its still my favorite to go to! Theres only one thing that id actually get here and its the ice cream and waffles. Besides the really slow service, even when its empty, the waffles and ice cream is de lish! Its actually the only thing that keeps me going back! especially the fact that they have a bunch of different ice cream flavors.
author: Sandra T.

description:
Our order of Eggettes arrived and I'm thinking, "Did we order the chocolate by mistake???"  The answer is NO- they were the original eggettes...nicely BURNT & DRY- yuck!  First time ever that we did not finish and order of eggettes (and there was 5 of us)!  

*Go to Eggettes on Noriega- don't let this place ruin your Eggettes experience!*

They get points ONLY for being open late and having a huge variety, although nothing was all that good...You hardly taste the curry in Curry fishballs and the Fried Chicken Wings were bland.  The only thing satisfying is the Rice Crepes, but how can you mess that up???  They buy that at the local Asian market- steam it up and slap some Hoisin and Siracha hot sauce on it!
author: Judy K.

description:
HK desserts and food, quality is alright, other shops have better...
they stay open until 1-2am every nite...
needed a quick bowl of ramen late last nite, less than 5 bucks, mmm...

+4 stars mainly for convenience, its never crowded, lots of parking since its off of geary and clement, lcd tv running HK shows, and cheap tasty ramen
-1 star, dessert quality is average
author: Ethan L.

description:
Yum! I just got back from this place after a random night out. 
I guess we were here at the right time because we got great service. The servers here are so enthusiastic about their jobs, and get what you need fast. This place was packed when we got inside which was approaching midnight. For this area, that's a lot of people at this time of the night! Anyways, they've got a pretty vast menu (which I like). From your typical Asian cafe food to funky dessert choices (funky to those who have never been around Asian desserts). The menus are stuck under the glass parts of the table and they also have certain special deals, and some deals are time sensitive. Noodles looked delicious, appetizers were delicious, and the desert was pretty good. The only thing I didn't like about this place was that their waffles were kind of hard and stale like as if it was prepackaged, but what can you expect from a place that open late night? For the reasonable prices, service, and wide selections, I found another place to visit when I'm in the area!
author: Monina C.

description:
Blech.  Nothing special here (sesame paste was poor, fruit sago was not fresh).  Nor are the cooked foods any good either.

I can't see why it's always packed at night though - there are so many other dessert cafes in the Richmond area.
author: Haywood H.

description:
Very disappointing experience. Came with high recommendation, and only to found out a few things: 

1. Food quality questionable- Egg puff tasted horrible...seems like the batter is off with too much eggs and no flour. Texture is very soggy and outside crust is soft and burnt. Color is actually dark brown. When we told them that this was not acceptable, they put on an all defensive mode, and said it was all fine and everyone who had it made no complaints like we did. They try to make us feel so bad like we were trying to get away with paying $2.5... what a complete loser. Also, our steamed egg custard did not have enough sugar in it, it was tasteless.. why have desserts when its not sweet.

2. Service is bad, we asked for water and we didnt get any response after a 30 mins sit in. 

3. There was a large group next to us who had some issues with the restaurant too.. they seem upset but I couldnt hear what the problem was from where i was sitting. Overall bad experience. We will never go back.
