Despite of the bad experience, we were hopeful to find better egg puffs that night. So we walked a few blocks to Genki Sushi (on Clement) and bought a fulfilling pack of egg puffs. We finished them within minutes and they were top quality, just like those authentic ones in HK. 

This Kowloon Tong place will not survive for more than another 6 months at the rate they are going.
author: Ada W.

description:
The east coast needs a place like this.  Having lived in the east coast after moving here from HK, I don't have the convenience and luxury of getting my beloved "gei dan jai" (Eggletts like some fellow Yelpers would say).  However, only 3 stars because they were burnt and dry.  They were more like crumbly than the soft, pillowy, eggy puffs of goodness I remembered as a kid.

Besides the gei dan jais, they do have a pretty impressive menu of HK desserts along with the mountain of HK gossip magazines.

One waiter was funny too.
author: Sally T.

description: This used to be my go-to dessert place, but I haven't been here in probably over a year. The food here is ehhhh. I mean there's nothing that stands out but I'm not saying things suck here. It was a great late night hang out place but on weekend nights it may be hard getting a table. Then again, I don't know how it's been like recently. I used to always get their rice roll.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
3.5 stars.

This place has the typical Chinese desserts, it's fairly good. The place is decent enough to accommodate a large group, but you'll probably have to wait a while. They also serve hot food, but I've never tried it (my reasoning is you came here for dessert not dinner =P). I usually get the strawberry or mango madness, as those also have loads of goodies. I like their metal-barrel tea cups. They're awesome.

I would come back again. I would pick this place over Creations any day.
author: Sam W.

description: Terrible service!!!!  Heard so much good about the ice-cream waffle sandwich, so I want to try it. Unfortunately the staff do not pay attention on orders and did not deliver the dessert to the appropriate requestor. The staff did not check and assumed the ice-cream waffle order is a shared dessert and just dumped my order in front of other people which caused confusion and thought that it's a shared dessert. And it got eaten up. Such irresponsible and unprofessional service!!!! Will not recommend to others and not going back.
author: Xo X.

description: The interior reminds me of a cafeteria with bright lights and lots of people chatting with each other. The menus are actually underneath the glass of the tables and even though there are several of them they are all the same. If your familiar with asian desserts then you'll be fine ordering, otherwise you might want to bring a friend along who can explain what frog frost or bird's nest is. They have other desserts and sides like other HK cafes in the area, but I find that its best to stick to the desserts. I had the sweet sticky rice with coconut milk served hot and it was a great way to end the night.
author: Theresa D.

description:
It's a very typical HK/Chinese dessert place.  They have some great desserts, but man the service is horrible.  They are open late and the place is pretty large, so I suppose that's a plus. 

Never actually seeked this place out; I've only gone when a group of people were already planning to go.  Some of the stuff on the menu is a wee bit adventurous for my blood.
author: Dave K.

description:
I like this place because it stays open really late.

Theres about only 1 nice waiter there, and I forgot his name but he wears glasses. Totally sweet, and outgoing, attentive, everything. He even told my boyfriend if he werent there he's be trying to get my number lol. The toher waiters? Need to be more attentive. I gave a 25 cent tip because I waited 30 mins for my check, when I was obviously done. They didnt even refill my tea :[


Food overall? Bomb ass waffle ice cream sandwiches. :3
author: Melissa D.

description:
A good place for after-Chinese-dinner dessert. I had some hot honey red date, sort of a fruit tea as opposed to an herbal tea or a tea tea. It had a mild sweetness and you could taste the fruitiness from the thin thin slices of date steeping in the hot water. 

I also had momochacha, not Singapore style but rather with red bean in place of the sweet potato and only the barest hint of taro but I was good anyway. Just not sure why they called it momochacha. For the sago perhaps?

Service was friendly. Staff recognized I wasn't a regular (only white guy, and only one of 2 or 3 non-Asians in the place).  Offered to comp me an order of egg puffs which someone had ordered then canceled too late; in all good conscience I had to turn it down as I don't care for, or even get the attraction of, egg puffs (yes, I've tried them before). But for people who do like egg puffs, there seemed to be a lot of people ordering them. 

Mostly high-school and college crowd but one family and a couple tables of friends (?) in their 40s or 50s. Quite lively on a Saturday night.
author: Charles B.

description: the food quality here kinda sucks while the prices are a little more expensive than most places. The sago looks and tastes watered down and the fruits are drenched in syrup and or other liquids that leaves a soggy taste to it. The one funny thing about this place is the ice cream waffle sandwich. It literally is 4 scoops of vanilla ice cream sandwiched between 2 ego waffles that you can toast yourself . I will not be coming back to this place.
author: Robert Y.

description: I came here on a Saturday evening around 8ish and it wasn't that busy. It does get busy later in the evening though. I had the steam rice noodles this time and it was not that great. The peanut sauce was so watery that it just tasted like nothing. I also had the curry fish balls, those were meh too..nothing too great. At least I got a free drink, this made my trip worthwhile.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I used to love this place.  It was one of the first HK dessert places in the city, before they started popping up every few blocks.  The service used to be fast and friendly, and so were the servers.  Andy, where'd you go?  Why'd you sell the place?

Now they have the slowest service I have ever seen.  Ordering a dun lai (steamed milk custard) took 90 minutes.  You know what I can do in 90 minutes?  Go to Safeway, buy all the ingredients, and make a dozen orders.  And eat all of it with time to spare.

So the first waitress forgot to put our order in.  It wasn't until we prompted another waitress after seeing tables who arrived after us get their food that our order was placed.

Then they claimed that the kitchen was slow.  Um, hello?  How did everyone else get their food?

The complimentary fruit dish did NOT help.  If anything, it was like a slap in the face for keeping us waiting so long without a proper explanation.  If you just told me that you forgot, I would have felt better than you lying to me.

And when the dun lai finally came out, it wasn't even that good!  Epic failure.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Hell, I'd give all the stars to this place just for that waiter! He is freakin' awesome!!!! Funny and energetic. He manages to happily cater to all the tables in the place on a full night too.

Oh right, the food too. Yeah the food is pretty good and it's a decent variety of things to choose from.

But man, that waiter!!!! He gets all my praise!
author: Lily L.

description:
They have a lot of yummy stuff here...but the strawberry shaved ice drink is literally a plastic cup with shaved ice, sliced strawberries, a flat lid, and a boba straw. ....how do you drink that??? My friend asked them to add some condensed milk....still not a drink....and probably doesn't deserve to be ~$3...

also had an insect situation the night I came by....

It's hard to hate on this place since they have a huge menu so maybe they'll redeem themselves....
author: Kelley N.

description:
I normally think this place serves decent food with average service you'd expect for an asian dessert place. But today...

Scene 1 
It started with my friend asking for Papaya puree with sago... 3 min later.. "Nope dont have it in puree.."
"How bout Papaya juice"...
 "ok"... 3 min later...
"Actaully we just don't have any papaya"... 

 Scene 2.
We tasted the Super B Kid Jelly.. i liked the aloe chucks so we ask the waiter if we can just get something w/ chunks. He stared at the menu for a second and says " Oh the mixed fruit bowl will have aloe and I can put more aloe than other fruits".. "ok"... 3 min later....
"Mixed Fruit Bowl actually doesn't come with aloe because it's not a fruit..."  (ok.. then why did you recommend it!)

Scene 3 ( What ticked us off the most)
Two friends each ordered Mango puree with mixed fruits. The two bowls came half full without fruits. We demanded our fruits and the waiter took away the two bowls.... 3 min later... The waiter comes back with the 2 bowls (still half full) with a small side dish of fruits (5 piece of fruit) for two people to share! We complained why the dishes were so small because I've been to this place many times and it hasn't been this bad.  He said it's always like this.  We demanded a refund on one of the mango desserts and the waiter agreed.  BUT 3 min later... he came back with the bill and said he can only take 2 dollars off. What the heck!

I've been to this place for many years. I'm not sure if it's under new management. They better hire new waiters that know what you're doing and stop ripping customers off with bowls half filled.  Because of my loyalty to them the past couple yrs, I still give them 2 stars.
author: Emily L.

description: save your precious time and money and don't come here. very poor and unsophisticated service! all workers are apparently all managers all at the same time. they also refused to tell us who is really in charge. they also yelled at us for putting the tables together especially to a young woman. don't come here! you will regret it! I would say go to 100% dessert :)
author: Erin C.

description:
Having had dinner, my friend and I decided it was time for dessert.  Instead of once again going to Genki desserts, we ended up here.  I think if I came here again I might like this place more, but it has yet to find a little place in my heart that makes me love it as much as I do Hong Kong Bistro back in Mountain View.

The menu is fairly extensive, but I had to dock them a star solely based upon the fact they have one dish that has taro.  I mean, come one!  The dish that we ordered, coconut milk taro sago, came out as the other dish, the version without taro.  *sigh*  We also ordered the peanut butter French toast which was good, but somehow just fell short of the version I oh so love at HK Bistro.

The service was fast and friendly, and the place is clean.  I would certainly come here again, but as of the time of writing this, I'll leave them with 3 stars.
author: Brent A.

description: Came here around 7pm. Service was great! Got the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, the sticky rice with XO sauce pan fried, and mixed fruit sago. There was 3 of us and it was good!
author: Vivian L.

description: Of all the places I'd expect to have a minimum per person charge, this is not one of them.  When you're one of the handful of places open as late as bars are, you shouldn't need to require people to order things.  I guess that's the survival tactic of a place that can't retain its customers from service, quality, AND hours - all of which they lack except the latter.  I don't even remember what I ordered from here anymore, and on a separate occasion, my friend waited forever for her drink, only to be overcharged, and given the wrong thing.  Better off going to Creations if you don't mind a mini school reunion (for all the SF natives out there).
author: Jenn C.

description:
So that's the name of this place! My friend's always call it "That Small Dessert place on 7th and Geary. The One that ISN'T Creations."

I honestly think this place kicks Creation's mango loving butt. Their menu is a lot more diverse and their service is way friendlier. 

There is always at least a 10 minute wait. Yelpers usually complain about the parking but I usually find a spot the first time around the block. Feeling ballsy?--park at the Smart and Final lot. I have parked there super late at night and haven't had any problems...knock on wood.

I can't help but order 2 or 3 things here. The noodle rolls with XO sauce is really good. The waffle sundae is a must for me everytime I go. And the sticky black rice with glutinous balls is great if you are feeling adventurous. My friends and I also like getting the egg puffs to share. They aren't the best ones around but they're good to snack on and are really cheap.

They have one really talkative waiter there. He's really funny and super friendly about everything so one extra star.
author: Jo Ann E.

description:
This is where I had my first eggettes and was pleasantly surprised =)

The sago here is okay. The sago juice is sometimes frothy and I don't know why... 

Can also get crowded on weekends, be prepared.
author: Christine C.

description:
1.5? 

Usually don't come here cuz it's waaaay far and usually doesn't have that great of dessert...is my dessert thats supposed to be a good mix of sago and mango supposed to be really liquidy mango juice!? 

Meh. It is open later than the other places and less crowded though, but yah, if i wanted some dessert this would probably not be my place...
author: Linda C.

description:
A big plus is they open late.  I've only gone once where the place was packed, but it's generally full.  A good place to go for HK desserts.  I usually order their Eggettes and whatever else I feel like at the moment.  My latest trip was Friday night after a not very filling dinner at Namu with Hue L. and our non-yelper friend.  And surprisingly, the man showed up to join us.  Since this was his first time meeting the friends, I'm sure he was quite nervous.  Plus, I think he felt extremely out of place in a mostly Asian-filled dessert cafe.  

I think the only thing really going for this place though is the fact that they're open late (and close to my house).  Service is pretty much non-existent.  Extremely unfriendly.  I've ordered some desserts over the phone and gone in to pick up before and I find that much better since the ambiance of the place just doesn't do it for me.
author: Kris L.

description: THE SERVER IS INCOMPETENT. I ordered water for three times and guess what, I didn't get any of it. I ordered a PEANUT BUTTER french toast, and he came with just a french toast without any peanut nor butter in it. The price is way off for a standard taste of dessert, and I hate that place so much. You can get better dessert at places like D&G compared with this place.
author: Arnold K.

description: Lots and lots of varieties of chinese desserts (sweet soups, shaved ice, sweet tofu), hot snack foods (fried eggs, pork chops, rice, noodles), and drinks (coffee + tea mix, juices). The sweet coconut soup with sago was pretty decent and the egg cakes were good (smelled wonderful, crispy on the outside, inside was more mochi-like than cake-like though not in a bad way). Seems like a perfect place to satisfy a craving or pass the time just eating.
author: C L.

description:
I went to this place tonight, i feel that it is quite hard to fully rate this place with just one visit, but from what i did like about this place was that the Waffle Sundae was very good.  i like how they open late, dope location.  The thing that wasn't so great was that the food we ordered took a while, actually the other people that came in after us, got their food before us.  Luckily im not anal about that type of stuff especially when you are hanging out with your friends, but i would definitely come back to this place. Oh yeah service was good too, the tea too!



EDIT:: 8/31/2010

it must have just been my first time here where it took a while to get our food because ever since ive first reviewed, i have probably been here over 15 times.  Im addicted to this place...its awesome!
author: Kenny C.

description: So, my friends and I went to see Avenue Q at the Orpheum (GREAT musical by the way), and we were jones'in for some dessert afterward.  Mitchell's and a bunch of other places were closed, but then we stumbled upon this place.  When we got in, we were served hot tea right away.  This review is mainly for the Mixed Fruit Ice Cream Waffle Sandwich they had.  It was delicious.  There was chunks of mixed fruit and strawberry ice cream inside the waffle, but got to me most was the waffle itself.  The Waffle's crispiness sealed the deal for me because in worked in synergy with all the other components of the ice cream sandwich.  So glad I ordered it.  On top of that, I shared a Banana Split with my friends.  Even though there wasn't a Maraschino Cherry on top, one of the guys who worked there hooked it up with a watermelon ball.  Good service...Great dessert.  Stay hungry my friends
author: Brian L.

description:
FOOD:
Mediocre.  It's nothing to get excited about.  They have a variety of Asian desserts and snacks.  The egg puffs aren't that great honestly, but someone ALWAYS orders it, and I end up eating some without even realizing it.  I usually end up ordering stuff from the mixed fruit section.  I personally like Creations more.  Just personal preference.  

AMBIANCE:
I feel like I'm in HK.  Not that I've ever been to a dessert spot in HK, but judging from Asian dramas on TVB, this is as close as it gets I think.  HAHHAHHAHAHAH.  There are tons of Asian people here during the peak hours of 10pm-whenever they close (some time in the AMs).  Lots and lots of Asian people here, and I happen to ALWAYS bump into people I know every single time I've been here. 
Service here is kind of slow.  Probably because I always come here during their busy hours.  

GOOD TO KNOW:
A lot of people park in the Smart & Final parking lot across the street, but be careful.  They DO tow!  Park at own risk!
author: Lisa Z.

description:
The Good:
- Wide selection
- Opens late

The Bad:
- Service
- The food (we got cold stuff when it's supposed to be hot)
- The wait

*lazy review - I'll edit later
--------
I didn't expect excellent service but I wanted somewhat decent. When we walked in, we had no greeting [all I wanted was a hi or a smile at least]. We didn't get seated, although they DID see us. They rather talk than make money, really. When we did get seated we had to wait a good 20 minutes for someone to come take our order. Another 20 minutes for the cold desserts. Another 10 for the hot one, which actually came cold instead. Our last dessert didn't come until we signaled to them. 
Two good thing about this place is the fact that they do open late for night owls like me, and they have a pretty big selection.
author: Shirlene K.

description:
I've heard people say this is the best HK-style dessert place but I come here every so often to hang after dinner, I just don't see how it is. It just feels average to me. Some days, my dessert ends up being good and other days, not so good. The only consistently good thing they have is their hot milk tea. That's about it.

This is also a great place to check out some interesting hairstyles! :)
author: Barney M.

description:
Your typical Asian (HK) dessert joint.

I've only tried the egg & luncheon meat sandwich and waffle ice cream sandwich. The sandwich was good -- nice, thick bread and the egg & meat hit the spot, totally unhealthy... just the way I like it! haha. The waffle ice cream sandwich is sooo good! I think they used to have vanilla ice cream, which is better, but the last time I went they used strawberry. I usually don't like strawberry ice cream but it was still satisfying.

The menu is quite extensive and if you aren't Chinese, you basically won't know what anything is since there are no descriptions and the translation doesn't tell you much. I had to ask my friend what MoMo ChaCha was -- not because I was interested in getting it but what the hell is MoMo ChaCha?!!

This place is good for the ice cream sandwich but I'd rather go to Creations for desserts and Golden Island for sago & HK-style sandwiches.
author: Miss H.

description:
RAWR RAWR RAWR RAWR RAWR.
It's only good because I had a good night here. (:
It was new years eve. my birthday. my first time meeting my bf's cousin. a whole lotta things happened that night (: this topped it off even though I didn't get anything.. SIKE. I had to get something! I always get something. MANGO SHAKE?! ANYONE? I shared it with my bf because I couldn't finish it. his cousin was sick and ordered a lemon honey tea. I would of switched with him because I was frezzing cold afterwards and in the car fell asleep in his arms. LOL. but the mango shake had no much mango I couldn't handle it anymore! 
.. right now i really want some sago.
author: Carolyn Y.

description: Great place, service is kind of slow due to being understaffed. Best times to come are after 7 or 8PM on M/W/F/Sat when the staff is way more energetic. Other days the people that work there seem to hate their job and make a lot of mistakes.
author: Jack C.

description:
Came on a sunday night..and it was packed. Luckily I didnt' have to wait, but perhaps because it was spring break for most schools. We sat down for a really long time and we had no tea and no one came to take our order. When we finally flagged someone down, he told us that our hot foods would take at least 30 mins to get some steamed rice crepes and a hong kong style waffle!!
We decided to wait for it anyway, half way through again, I asked for tea again, it never came till near the end, after i had asked about 4 times. I know it was busy, but if my food was going to take that long, I could at least get something to drink while I wait right? My waffle came out in less than 30 mins, but it was cold and hard. I did see a couple of people order the soy sauce pan fried noodles and it looked delicious!
The food is usually pretty good, but try not to go on a busy night? I didn't get much service and quality wasn't that great. One thing for sure, its open late and they don't rush you out.
author: Anita W.

description: Waffle Sandwich is a must! Great deserts. Prices is decent.
author: Mike A.

description:
This place is always packed and it's a gathering place of young people.  I know that many of my young cousins and friends go there for post-dinner dessert or late night chat.

The menu list is so long and you may really need to take some time to decide which one you want.  However, variety does not equal to quality.  I have tried some items and find out the "safe" choice is the tofu dessert with red bean soup.  Overall, the price is high for its portion.  Service-wise, it is slooowwwww.  One time, I went there with my husband and we were the only customers there.  We ordered a tofu dessert with red bean soup and a rice dumpling with sugar, coconut and peanuts.  It took about half an hour!!!!!  And, we had to repeat several times what we want to make the waitress understand what we would like to order, either in English and Chinese.
author: Roserrele W.

description:
Before Creations, this place was one of the places to go for dessert. But I hardly like this place because the Chinese dessert was not up to the par. But the other food items were ok (like ice-cream waffle and snacks). I had a yeung ji gum lo before and it wasn't good. But the traditional Chinese dessert (like red bean soup, seasame soup) is ok. 

It opens late - so it draws a nice crowd as the night goes. But I'm just not a big fan of the food quality at this place. 

And my friends and I note that - this place has a lot of hot girls! =P many Asian girls dress up with full make up and expensive luxury handbags come to this place for dessert. I feel under-dress when I was in tee and jeans and no makeup on a Friday night. =P
author: Michelle L.

description: Craptacular slow, Is it me or a lot of workers at chinese dessert places looks like they'd rather shoot themselves in the head than help you?
author: Terry S.

description:
I shared the sticky black rice + mixed fruit dessert with a friend..it was good..not too sweet..it wasn't bland..it was cold and refreshing..and the texture of the sticky black rice was really enjoyable.

the service was bad..i raised my hands a few times until I got the attention of a server..also they never came around to ask if we're doing okay or anything..also it's busy (maybe due to their slowness) and theres not enough seating you you gotta wait outside..the night that I was there the servers got a lot of orders wrong.

I would give it a 4 star for the dessert that I enjoyed..but with everything into consideration a 2 star.
author: Chatree T.

description:
Kowloon Tong has a lot more options on the menu than Golden Island (Noriega), and it's a lot less crammed and crowded. Service is a little more laggy though, takes more time to prepare and serve. One of the servers looked like she was out of it, who knows.

I had the mixed fruits mango sago. They definitely put a lot of sago in it, which I like. Lacking on the mixed fruits though. Sesame paste with peanut dumpling is also not bad. Nice and warm on a cold night.
author: Yosie G.

description:
I haven't been to many late-night dessert places, let alone Hong Kong style ones, so when a friend of mine treated me to a snack here the other night I was pretty delighted, not only at how great the food was, but also how busy it turned out to be (this was around nine or ten on a Wednesday night).

Anyway, it turned out to be a nice place to hang out for a few hours to chat. The girl serving us was pretty friendly and brought our stuff in a quick and timely manner, and she was pretty generous with the free tea - we had maybe four refills before we finally decided to head out around eleven.

The food itself, as I said, was good. We each had one of the mixed fruit puddings (not sure if it has another name), which was fresh and flavorful, as well as some of the egg puffs, which were also tasty, especially with tea. The prices all seemed fairly cheap, definitely far from expensive, which is another plus if you're out late and don't want to blow a ton of cash on late-night snacks.

It did get crowded after awhile, but at no point was it ever overwhelmingly loud or obnoxious. Overall the experience was pleasant, and I think I definitely found a new place to hangout in the evenings.
author: Will C.

description: Every time I've been here before, it's been before 10pm, so service is decent, the food is always good, my favorite has to be the xo pan fried rice crepes. But yesterday I came in around midnight and there were tons of ppl, if you're not sitting near the register, it's really hard to get their attention, the customer service was horrible, food took forever to come out. But it was one of the few places still open late on a Monday night. The only reason I'm giving them 3 stars is because my past experiences were good, just don't expect to get good service when the place is packed
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Love how they stay open late.

As an ABC, I feel like I'm probably visiting hong kong with all the chinese speaking and loud environment. It's like I'm taking a mini trip to China?

I really only go there for the mango sago, and black sticky rice with mixed fruits!!!!!!!!! Everyone I take here loves it also.
author: Annie L.

description: I use to go here a lot until this one worker was very unprofessional towards my friends and I. As we were ordering he acted as if we were wasting his time and gave a lot of attitude.  WE COULD HEAR HIM SWEARING AT US  IN CANTONESE UNDER HIS BREATH. When we ordered he gave us the wrong dish and told us that it was our fault. This individual also gave us a hard time about the ice cream sandwich deal, that is suppose to be free with a $25 purchase. We had 2 groups of people each ordering more than $25 worth, but he would only allow us to get one. If you come here, Watch out for the waiter that's tall, skinny,  and Asian with glasses.
author: Jack L.

description: Hooray to late night dessert! My friends and I been there couple of times whenever were in the city and we would often stop by there..Most of the time I order the Mix fruit Mango Sago...pretty darn good and refreshing!
author: Helen L.

description:
The teas they gave us was so diluted that I thought it was just plain water.

As my eyes were wandering around the room looking at what kind of desserts people ordered, I realized how a lot of customers not have their cups of tea (at all). &They ordered all the food already. That's crazy.

We had a group of 8 and we were bunched up in the tables where the drinks/desserts are made. I think our sitting area was blocking the waiters from working efficiently and so the guy waiter asked if we wanted to sit somewhere else. I think there was some sort of miscommunication because the young female waiter with braces was proceding to sit another group at our table.

We moved tables and we ordered our desserts. I ordered the mixed fruits with honeydew puree with grass jelly. It consisted of some pieces of strawberries, mangoes (probably frozen), honeydew, cantaloupe, watermelon, pieces of grass jelly, sugar water, coconut milk/watered down condensed milk and some blended honeydew pieces. It tasted okay, but not the greatest. People usually go to these dessert places mainly to catch up, not to rave about how "great" the food was. 

They make really good waffles though. 

We didn't even get napkins. 

The young female waitress with braces seemed to be annoyed at us though. We ordered some eggettes but they didn't come. We asked her like 3xs and we just decided to cancel it. I understand if the place is really busy...but they really need to hire more people. For instance, 2 waiters and 2 people making the drinks, and 1-2 people in the kitchen making the "real" food.
author: Jay Z.

description:
Pluses:
1.  Open Late (till 2am on the weekend)
2.  Good place to chill with friends
3.  Mango and Strawberry Madness

Minuses:
1.  Unhealthy snacks and only bearable food quality
2.  Gets busy on weekends
3.  Slow service

Bottom line:
Go here if you're craving some cold fruity dessert or want a place to hang out.  Skip if you're on a diet or can't handle slow service.
author: Stephen G.

description:
i practically live across the street from this place and i wanted to love it so much!  but i don't.  maybe i keep ordering the wrong things but every time i come here, i've been disappointed.  

my favorite part about this place is the atmosphere.  it feels just like hong kong and i liked it immediately the first time i walked in and sat at one of the round tables.  tvb plays almost nonstop on the big screen tv at the back of the restaurant and it feels cozy and a nice place to hang out with friends.  the people who work there are extremely nice and welcoming.

but the food is not up to par!  i really wanted something to fulfill my craving for hong kong food.  i tried the toast, i tried the egg puffs, the chicken wings, fried octopus balls, and some of the desserts and smoothies my friends ordered.  it was just average at best.  it wasn't bad but i wouldn't call it good either.  i need to keep trying and i will not give up until this place lives up to my expectations!!!
author: Irene W.

description:
Everything tastes good when you are intoxicated and got the munchies.  This place is the last stop in the itinerary of our (in)famous Inner Richmond Pub Crawl, and at 2AM after visiting 9+ pubs your standard of a good dessert is compromised.  

Yet they were nice enough to let a bunch of drunkards *i.e us* in (+1 star), prompt with the orders (+1 star).  Unfortunately not much else can be said about the visit.  

A visit after dinner at Spices yesterday, while we were stone-cold sober, confirmed my suspicion - the mango pudding was strangely bland and a friend's dessert (some odd steamed congealed milk that only Chinese native speakers would know the name of) came 20 mins after everyone else's.  

So unless you have a blood alcohol reading that would make the cops hot and heavy in the (hypothetical) event of catching you riding dirty down 101, this place isn't really worth visiting.
author: Ange L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE. This is one of the very first Asian dessert place I've been to. Came here not long after I started college and I love it! The desserts are sooo good - waffle ice cream, sago, egg puffs, you name it! I  had dinner here once, ordered the udon. It wasn't great but when it comes to dessert time, I was more than simply satisfied - wish I could just chomp down every single dessert they have there haha. I will be back for more! *sigh* how come they don't have dessert cafes like this in the cupertino area T___T
author: Melissa S.

description:
we came on a saturday night, the place was half empty. we ordered a watermelon juice and mango shaved ice. the watermelon juice was kinda gross, maybe because it wasn't cold. after what felt like an hour they brought the shaved ice and there were probably only 3 small pieces of mango, and not a lot of flavor.

i swear this place used to be good and always packed, but that was more than 5 years ago. after this disappointing experience, we're probably not coming back.
author: Jenny C.

description: Slow service, and the special offer wasn't clear at all.  It got us all confused.  When we asked them, we didn't really understand their english! I thought the sesame glutinous rice ball wasn't that good, however,  I like their coconut taro sago.  It was real taro, not the taro powder that Quickly uses.
author: Elena L.

description:
2 stars for the name.  

I've been here so many times cuz i been dragged there. Anyways they always get my orders wrong. Hot drink becomes cold or  Food comes out late.  The old lady is so cheap on the eggetts dough, pour some more in for god sake! They're always empty!!!  They are expesive compared to the one on clement!!!
author: GaLei J.

description:
The food was so-so. 

Crowded, loud, slow service and horrible waitstaff.
author: Cupcake s.

description: They get such a high score from me because they are Cantonese/Hong Kongnese comfort food late at night. You just don't get that everywhere. Because there aren't many places like this, there's gonna be quite the crowd at night with youngsters. They have Canto soap drama on the large TV. Their cooking/waiting staff seemed small which isn't a great idea when the place is usually packed. The waiter would take a while getting back to us when refilling tea but I appreciated that he decently would come back to our table to inform us that a certain dish would take a certain amount of time longer and that when they took down an order wrong, he would apologize and redo the order properly. What I liked best was the large variety of HK comfort food available. A super simple scrambled egg sandwich on soft white bread without the crust...MMM like momma used to make. Their egg puffs are decent enough but nothing overly memorable. I am saddened that they don't do pearl tea and their honeydew smoothie didn't even taste like honeydew. The other desserts my friends ordered were tasty like the fried chicken and fries and black sesame seed soup. Their ice cream waffle sandwich was delicious, way better than expected! I'd have that again next I'm there.
author: Amy C.

description:
Went here the other night with some friends, they open late which is good. It can get pretty crowded but the desserts we ordered were all good especially the glutinous rice balls with crushed peanut & sugar and the ice cream waffle sandwich! 

Would definitely go back.
author: j s.

description: The food was below average. The service was worst. The waitress was new and very slow but she tried her best. The store was really slow that night. The owner lady could not accommodate any substitutions or add ons to our orders. She was expressing her negativity and talking about the customer very openly in Chinese. She was rude and caused all the business from my friends and I for the rest of 2012. The disgusting part was that the steamed papaya had a fly in it. She also only gave us 4 small napkins for table of five people. Overall if you want shit talking mediocre service and contaminated desserts with flies go here. If not I would suggest Creations, Purple cow, or anywhere else because this place BLOWS!!!! Owner lady you can suck on your own Seasame gluttonous balls!
author: Jason C.

description:
i LOVE this place. beyond love. i honestly dreammm about mango madness and the little jelly squares dancing around it. i really cant express how much the MM and I are in love. love love love.

sorry, onto the review. super cheap desserts, totally random things i have never seen (i'm really curious about glutenous balls!), and an amazing waiter. he really makes the place. he is sooooo incredibly awesome. he's so funny, so nice and really just a breath of fresh air in the service industry. really check this place out, it's fabulous :)

and definitely get your taste buds on that mango madness. i promise, it will be A-mazing.
author: Jenn A.

description: Asian desserts galore. I'm pretty confident that I can make most of this at home, but it's better when someone else does it for you and the dishes! With that said, it was a pretty decent place. I think I had the B grass jelly (or something of that sort)...fruits were really great in it but I couldn't take too much of the "jelly" Also waited FOREVER for the damn ice cream sandwich...wasn't that amazing. Nonetheless, if you're lazy to make dessert (who isn't?!?!) then come here. It's super cheap and gets you a quick fix.
author: Lola D.

description: I'm very partial towards this place. It's very homely. The service staff is understanding and have a sense of humour. Their selections vary, which is great compared to the many other dessert places that have tons of iterations of essentially the same item, making it difficult to choose. They offer a promotion if you order more than $20 worth of stuff (great for larger parties) and check in using yelp or facebook, you can get a free order of waffle ice cream sandwich. We were off by 30 cents from the $20 promotion and the new waiter did not allow us to claim it. We asked the waiter we've seen for months and, after checking our order to confirm, gave us the promotion without hesitation. We understood the new waiters were only following their rules and have not developed the boundaries that the seasoned waiters have. A con of this place (along with all dessert places that serve hot tea) is that the place gets very stuffy, combined with the room full of people, so dress accordingly. Dressing light, even through cold weather, and sprinting inside has always worked for me.
author: Dominic L.

description: Had a Mixed fruit mango puree with tofu fah. It was good but the strawberries were sour. The waitress was really nice and our order came out really fast. It is cheap and worth it! Would come back for a late night treat :]
author: Melissa G.

description: My friends and I was looking to get smoothie after midnight.  We didn't really know any that open this late except for Jack in the Box, Ihop, Mels Drive in and near the Sunset District.  The Hong Kong style waffle was good but no syrup just peanut butter and evaporated milk also I had the deep fried wing and fries for 4.95 to me was a small portion.  This restaurant is only good for snacks not for big meals unless you order the XO Sauce pan-fried rice noodles for 4.95 and Ice cream.  At least they open late.
author: John F.

description: my favorite dessert spot in SF.  I love their ice cream waffle sandwich, fruit sago and mango sago. nomnomnom
author: Cee L.

description: I have been here 2 times but only ate on my second visit. they have very interesting asian desserts. I ordered the one with mango pudding, mango ice cream and fresh fruit...it was light. sweet and fresh..it was pretty good considering i do not have a sweet tooth. I would probably come again just to try something different. this place looks like a night hang out spot, so if you are in a late night craving for dessert give this place a try.
author: Linda L.

description:
i've been here a couple times and it's always crowded. but they always manage to seat us somewhere. it also depends on when you go. it's open late so it's a great place to go for a late night meal or after going to bars/clubs.

there is this one waiter that works there who is VERY nice. super enthusiastic and puts you in a good mood :) so even if its slow or super packed and loud, if he's serving us, we're happy.

their food isn't great but good. recommend mango sago. their hk style waffles are good too. i forgot what it's called but their egg puff waffles(like eggettes) are good as well.

they also have food other than just dessert too.
author: Sachiko K.

description: I'm make this long story short.....OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!Price is reasonable, food is great, specially the desserts. and it opens late!
author: Liu P.

description: Very average dessert spot ... Been coming for years and it seems like they never took the effort to make things more awesome. I guess their consistent, but no surprises means no extra stars! ... Only thing i really love is their ice cream waffle sandwich ... everything else is ehhh ..
author: Frankie L.

description:
Ordered egg puffs and they were lukewarm and tasted old. 

That was my most recent memory, but nothing really stood out the other times I've been there.

Other than that, nothing really special about this place that separates it  from other dessert places.
author: Willie F.

description: It was pretty late at night and I was searching for a place to get something sweet, so we Yelped this place and decided to check it out because it's not really in my neighborhood. Because of how late it was, parking was not really a problem. As soon as we entered we found a place to sit (luckily, because it was pretty busy) and were promptly served hot green tea. It was a perfect drink to be served because of how chilly it was. We were overwhelmed with the selection of desserts and drinks. I decided to choose the Mixed Fruit Coconut Sago. I was really happy with how fresh the fruits were and the taste of the sago overall. What made this experience not as enjoyable was the promptness of the staff. We had to flag them down to order, and then when we were ready to pay we had to go to the front because they didn't realized we had been done for quite some time.  I will probably go back if I'm feeling any of the desserts they have.
author: Bianca R.

description: hmmm hordes of high school kids and sub-par Chinese desserts...but for some reason i keep finding myself coming back. It is one of those places that after you have eaten you discuss amongst your friends how much better another place is, a place where you aren't necessarily satisfied each time you eat, but a place where you keep coming back due to what i can only explain to myself as a force of habit.
author: Eric T.

description: 3.5 stars...love their waffles and egg puffs!! their curry fish balls with spicy instant ramen is good too, but wish it was spicier! not too fond of their sago, sometimes its too icy. service can be slow at times, but is usually okay.
author: Stella J.

description:
This is one place I look forward to going to. I tend to have a favorite thing so I can't say that everything is good. The nice thing is it is open late and it is a cheep eat. It does tend a bit crowded and noisy though.
My favorite is the mango sago and the egg puffs. I wasn't too impressed with the papaya sago though.
author: Mary D.

description: emmm it serves local hk snacks and desserts. Not as amazing as i thought since my friend is been telling me how great kowloon tong was. but i m abit disappointed with the food quality. But one thing i like about kowloon tong is it has long opening hours and it is located in a convenient location.
author: Sandy K.

description: Each time we go here, I end up trying something new.  The things I have tried have been good and have nothing bad to say about this dessert place. I tried a sesame ball with ginger syrup and some steamed egg thingy that was yummy and creamy. The TV was too loud for conversation and oh, the house was full and people were signing up on the sheet at the door for a table, while there was a table of 4 who were there b4 us and finished b4 our food arrived.  They were playing cards while people were waiting for a table. Do you think that was rude????  Lemme know whatcha think bout that one..
author: gordon g.

description:
i've never eaten dessert that were that BAD....i ordered walnut paste; it tasted nothing near walnut and it was sooooooooooo watery. It was basically water+sugar. 
the egg puffs were not good either; too crunchy and not chewey at all....those of you who've eaten the authentic egg puffs from HK will know what i mean.
i would rate it zero start if i can!
author: Karen L.

description:
one of the best asian dessert in sf... i go here at least 1-2 twice a week. the service is quick and fast...
the egg puffs are delicious...but sometimes they come out burnt. ....
the chicken wings are also really good. 
I recommend trying the mix fruit with mango sago. 
the price is super cheap and reasonable.....
author: Tiffany L.

description:
-fried noodles is good

-curry fishballs - delicious

-ambiance outside the store is a bit of nostalgic - i feel like im in another place when i went there the first time.

-the servers are not that attentive sometimes..
author: carlo c.

description:
i guess it deserves the same amt of stars as creations.

theres a waiter here whos super funny...or awkward...but makes it funny? yea..but their service is pretttyy slow too sometimes...
this place has moree food foood than fruits. which is alright too...but im not trying to eat hellaaa at 1 am!

yupp....another nice late night place to venture off tooo
author: Christine M.

description: I wish they were open earlier on weekdays! =( My friends and I had to kill time until they were open at 5. When it was 5, we noticed the lights still weren't turned on, but there saw a worker inside. So we went to kill time again. Came back 10 minutes later... still not open. We decided to look like complete fools and wait outside their door until they were open... The worker came outside and said that their chef was running late, but we could sit inside and wait. Inside, it feels very comfy. The tables aren't too compact and there's a lot of room to walk. We ordered 2 mixed fruit ice cream waffles. i noticed that there was only 1 worker that night, and the chef in the kitchen. It took pretty long for him to make our order... i don't know if there usually is only one worker but if it was a full house, he would be working his ass off. The ice cream waffles were okay.. it seemed like you could just make it yourself at home. The waffle is a little chewy, i wished it was more crunchy. The ice cream melted way too fast, maybe they should give forks with it too. We wanted to order more food but he seemed really busy. So we decided to just pay and leave. What was weird was that he already knew we wanted the check so he didn't need to go back a second time, maybe he overheard us. I would come back to try more of their desserts. I think they're way better than Creations.
author: Angela H.

description: always one of my favorite dessert spot, the other would be "my favorite cafe" on clement... great customer service and snacks :) the season fries and lemon tea today was very good :)
author: JessePanda C.

description: i love how they serve you tea with the cute lil cups when they seat you. i wish they did that in LA, but people in LA charge for everything. i ordered the mix fruit tapioca and egg puffs. i have to say that their mix fruit tapioca tasted a lot better than phoenix desserts in LA. their egg puffs were really good too, very fresh and crispy. the service was great. good and fast service is always a place.
author: Mandy C.

description: This place is border line 2 stars.  I am being generous because I like HK.  Too bad the desserts here are overpriced and crap.  The mango crazy dessert or some shit consisted of blended ice and a few piece of mango.  It only cost $5.  Cheap.   It was terrible.  I've been back a couple of times because I really like chinese shit but this is literally poo.  Go here with low expectations and you will be impressed.
author: Fatty A.

description: Tons of things to choose from, but dont' order the hot sesame or peanut desserts.  Recommend ice cream waffle or mango madness.  Mango madness, 2-3 schoops of ice cream covered w/ mango slush and then fresh fruits and lychee jelly ($6ish).  It was fun, but not sometihing i'd die for.  Egg puffs are really good too ($3ish).
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Kowloon Tong is another in a series of dessert cafes seemingly lifted straight out of Hong Kong and across the Pacific Ocean. So for fans of Hong Kong-style dessert, or anyone looking for a place to burn the midnight oil while indulging that sweet tooth, this place should be right up your alley, almost. 

For all sorts of reasons, most of the dessert here has the dubious honor of being average. A problem I find typical of California versions of Hong Kong restaurants is the quality of fruit isn't the same, which has more to do with America's stringent importation rules than owner's ability to select ingredients. But whoever's to blame, it leaves Kowloon Tong not needing to be a priority on your list of choices for Cantonese dessert.

As you'll notice on the menu, Kowloon Tong has everything standard for Hong Kong dessert cafes. My hands-down favorite dessert ever, Mango & Pomelo Sago (they call it Mango-Go-Go, Yueng Chi Gum Lo) is a sweet soup of tiny tapioca balls meant to be just barely squishy. Tough and chewy a la its bigger tapioca pearl brother (the infamous boba), the way it's done here, is not the way to go. Also, the mango and pomelo just isn't as good for the aforementioned reason. 

There's also the Steamed Milk Custard (Dun Lai), which comes in a variety of soup base flavors, like ginger (our choice) or various fruits. It's usually solid, and came served in a semi-liquid state, which is disappointing. 

And Hong Kong cafes wouldn't be complete without the hot snacks. Curry Fish Balls (Ka Lei Yu Daan) are above average, using your typical curry-out-of-a-canister-but-still-okay flavoring. Seven to eight fish balls half an inch in diameter, for four dollars however, makes it just out of reach of 'worth it'.

Still, despite the gloom and doom of being average, there's a not-so-hidden gem to be found. On the main window is plastered a sign in Chinese promoting their Kaak Chi Beng, with no English translation. (It is on the menu but you'd have no idea that it's a big deal.) Too bad, because this Ice Cream Waffle is clearly their specialty and the best thing they serve. A generous scoop of ice cream between two freshly toasted maple syrup infused waffles. It smells good and tastes better. Also plastered on the window is their Egg Waffle (Kai Daan Chai), but having not tried it I'll stick to vouching for the Waffle and its derivatives. (Other customers did order a Waffle Sundae, the same thing only not in cake form which I'm sure is equally amazing.)

Kowloon Tong isn't the most user-friendly place to get your dessert fix without bringing either a Cantonese-speaking buddy or someone who has been to these kinds of places with you. The menu has a billion items on it and few of the English names are indicative of what you'll actually get (a common problem with English translations of Chinese dishes). The place itself is equally unfriendly to the uninitiated: loud people, loud TV blaring, and dirty in a clean way but dirty still. It didn't help that in one sitting I witnessed two incidents of customers having hair in their dessert. 

Still, come for the Ice Cream Waffle. I suggest elsewhere for your other Hong Kong indulgences.
author: Daniel H.

description: Standard Chinese dessert place with the standard items.  Good for late night snacks and hang-out.  Parking in this area is not so great so expect some walking.  As is typical for Chinese dessert cafe in SF (understaffed at late night), the food can take a while to arrive, but I've basically accepted that as the norm.
author: Chad S.

description:
had the 
mixed fruit mango pudding ... it's a flan texture
pork chop sandwich .... soooo deelish
mixed fruit watermelon puree sago ... very refreshing.
author: Joanne H.

description: Always crowded and they don't have the best desserts either. I've been here a few times only when my friends suggest to come here. Parking isn't great either since you can't really park at the smart and final parking lot anymore. I guess the best thing they have are the rice noodles with peanut sauce and hoisen sauce.
author: Tracy A.

description: I came here only once, but that was all it took. I had some of the hot soup desserts. It was disgusting. Expensive and was bland. It's pretty hard to look for a place that sells HK desserts so I thought I hit jackpot, but man was I wrong. It was such a disappointment. I can't say anything about their other desserts but I warn you not to get the soup ones. I guess the only thing I can think of that this place is good is that it open late.
author: Audrey M.

description:
This place sucks ass... period.  DO NOT go here.  They don't derserve your hard earned money. 

If I could give negative stars I would.  Service is probably the worst i have ever experienced.  All of servers are bunch ignorant a**holes.  One server got my order wrong and when we received it she refused to take it back.  Food is lousy as well.  They serve eggo waffles with peanut butter and charge 5 bucks for it.

They need to fire all of those fobby servers, who don't know a thing about customer service.
author: Ethan C.

description: Good place to eat, and i love their ice cream sandwich and  mango with sticky rice. Good place to try
author: Tim T.

description: been here a bajillion times, usually with a group of friends, usually very late at night (since it's the only place open) or usually here for a late night venting snack. now that i've found a better place to get sago that's also closer of a drive from home, i don't think i'll be coming here again. haha but the ramen with fried egg did get me through some nights when i was too lazy to make that myself at home. i mean who wouldn't want to pay $5 for something that you could make at home for $.99?
author: Anh P.

description:
i love this place.. 

after a whole day of roaming around and taking in all of what sf had to offer my friends and I wanted to end our day with some snacks and desserts.  

we came in during a week night which wasn't busy at all. they were quick to come out with hot tea which is always a plus.  then we all went and order. our order consist of.... drums roll pls... 

green tea waffle ice sandwich -delish! 

chinese style french toast with condense milk.. yum

popcorn chicken.. good just wish it was spicy;)

mixed fruit sago. i love love love

egg puffs-good

rice noodle rolls.. good.

and these mochi looking balls.. so good! 

so if I were to ever crave for some good asian dessert when Im in town.. i'll know where to go to get my fix.
author: Hong T.

description: I came here with four friends on a random Sunday night and had a really nice time. I don't understand why this place has been rated so low but I'd sure like to try the places that are better. We ordered a bunch of random desserts and snacks from a pork chop sandwich with fries to taro coconut sago. All were delicious and hit the spot for our late night munchies.
author: Julia T.

description: I found this place on Yelp, I was craving some dessert late one night. This is the only asian dessert place that I could find that opens the latest in the city. Decent desserts...still pretty busy around 1am when I went once. They also have real meal dishes, aside from desserts. Decent quality. If I'm ever craving asian desserts late at night, I'll be back!
author: Susan H.

description: I know there are quite a few options around this area when it comes down to asian dessert. Out of 2 other locations, i personally prefer this one. The service is good and it's the best place to cure ur sweet tooths
author: Ernie P.

description: This place is pretty cool. I like how they have the menus right under the glass on the tables so you don't have to wait for the waitress. There's usually only 1 female waitress walking around taking orders, and this can get real annoying quick on busy nights. I usually get  the egg puff, rice noodles (churng fun), grilled squid, curry fishballs with a cup of hot tea... what are you guys going to eat? I hardly come here to eat their fruit desserts because I hate to say it but it's not as fresh as let's say 100% on taraval or the one on Geary... so just come here if you've got the munchies for some sweet and salty chinese snacks while watching some chinese news on the flat screen tv on the wall or wasting your money buying the stupid HK 'Winnie the Pooh' keychain sh*t they have in the machines like how all my girl friends do... lol
author: Ms. T L.

description: Typical HK late-night snack/dessert place. Friendly staff. The "shaved ice" is not "shave ice" like in Hawaii. The "shaved ice" here is basically Sprite with chopped ice and chunks of fruit. Not what I was expected, but equally tasty (mango for me).
author: Rob T.

description: One of my favorite dessert places in this area!  I usually get the Mango Sago, Egg Puffs, and the Mo-mo Cha-cha...it can be quite busy after 9 pm on friday and saturday.  Parking is easy to find at night around here.
author: Jeff H.

description: This is one of my favorite places to come to for desserts.  I love come here because it's a nice sit-down place and I can get a semi-healthy desserts.  It's WAY better than going to an american style Ben & Jerry's or even the Chinese-style Tapioca Expresses or Quickly's.  Plenty of choices on the menu and healthy at the same time.  Can't beat that.
author: Frank G.

description: This place is great to kick it. I would give this place a full 4 stars since it's not all that. However the service is slow and we went on a Wednesday night and it wasn't even full. Lose a star because of slow service
author: Jason T.

description: This is basically the hangout spot when you're bored but you don't want to head to a bar.  The food (desserts) here are yummi (I usually get some sort of sago) but there are a few misses (such as when my friend order tofu-fa but ended up getting a bowl of tofu-no syrup or anything!)  Basically cheaper than golden island and better tasting than creations...don't expect grade A service tho! PS for some strange reason, the tea they give you here sometimes smells fishy...
author: Ann H.

description: Great, refreshing desserts--try the fresh fruit sago (think fresh strawberries, mango, papaya, kiwi, etc. over a cold  bowl of little tapioca pearls--not boba!).  They also have a variety of hot foods that I haven't really tried, but make for good snack food (think chicken wings).  What sets this place apart from other HK style dessert cafes are the hot desserts they serve...but beware--like a lot of the other dessert cafes, it can be awfully crowded and loud and full of young'ins!
author: Joyce L.

description: only reason its missing a star because the service wasn't that good last few times i went, kinda pricey for certain things, but a nice place to go for dessert and its open late.
author: gordon l.

description: This is a great place for if you're craving some tasty affordable deserts at night.  I came here with my friends a few times and my favorite so far is are the rice noodle rolls and the sagos.  The noodle rolls come hot and steaming soaked in a peanut butter syrup and a side of hoisin sauce and hot sauce.  The sago are so cute!  It's those tiny clear jelly-like stuff that are so fun to chew.  I thought the french toast was a bit too greasy and the egg puffs were a little bland, probably need something to smothered it with, like chocolate syrup or something.  The service here is good, quick and efficient.  It's often pretty crowded at night, so it's hard to find seating sometimes.  Oh yeah, I recommend not trying the banana split.
author: Anna L.

description: Somewhere to go late at night, but aside from that, there's nothing about this place that's worth a trip.  Desserts are pretty subpar (if you've ever been to Hong Kong style late-night cafes/diners in S. California, this place is on the same page) and the ambience is nonexistent.  Open until 1:00 a.m. on weeknights and 2:00 a.m. on weekends (Fri, Sat, Sun).
author: Lynn O.

description: So maybe it's just me, but I ordered shaved ice with red beans. They handed me a plastic cup, with crushed ice and some bitter red beans. I've been brought up to know the difference between shaved ice and crushed ice and it's pretty obvious! Secondly, a plastic cup??? Seriously? Third, it was like they straight up boiled the red beans and didn't add any sugar. Then I also had to ask for condensed milk, which they didn't put in. Maybe nobody orders the shaved ice over there for a reason. The rest of the desserts are great (maybe because they actually put some thought and effor into it!). This place gets one more try with me. I'd recommend this place, but just save yourself the effort and avoid the shaved ice.
author: Alexander M.

description: Um, many mysterious snacks and sweets to pick from.  Personally, I don't think frog fat is that appetizing but hey, another person may think it's amazing.  Many good things, many MYSTERIOUS things...
author: Dana C.

description:
why do i always experience the oddest customer service in these HK-dessert places?

me: (looking over menu which shows a few photos but no corresponding item) - whats in your strawberry madness?
girl taking order: strawberry
me: sounds so yummy, i'll take that

order came and it consisted of 3 scoops of strawberry ice cream with some frozen strawberry slush and a few pieces of mixed fruit. for $6, i should have went to Sophies Crepes!
author: Nancie T.

description: Craving a midnight snack after a late night out with friends?  The waffle ice-cream sandwich with a side of fruit is the best here at Kowloon Tong Dessert Cafe... don't be fooled by the other copy cats out there.  The best time to come are off hours when there isn't a long waiting list to sit and it's easier to find parking on clement.  The egg puffs are good but there's definitely more variety at eggetts.
author: Cathy L.

description: Pretty extensive menu, with a lot of hot and cold stuff. Waffle ice cream was really good. Sometimes theres only 2 people on staff,  so the wait is quite long. Good fare for the fare.
author: Ray C.

description: I've been here maybe 5-6 times. It's not bad, but I have yet to find THE asian dessert place in the city. I guess that place is still a hidden gem :( Anyways, when I come here, I usually get the noodles. Usually soy sauce in eggnoodles with pork cutlet. It wasn't bad for 5 dollars... Hey, at least they open late! I've also had their xoxo rice rolls. That was damn good ;) I recommend this place if you're sick of creations and want to try some place new that also opens late.
author: Bonita C.

description:
This place has a nice menu, wide variety of things.  It stays open pretty late, one of the few places in the city for a late night snack.  ice cream waffle sundae is pretty good and so are most of the other desserts. the egg puffs are good and come out very fresh.

But the serve here SUCKS! It's always busy and they usually only have maybe 2-3 employees working on friday and saturday nights.  I once made an order, waited maybe 20-30 minutes and saw a group of 6 people walk in and get a table, place and order, and all 6 people order what i ordered (ice cream waffle sundae) and got their sundaes before i did!  I had to ask the waiter where my order was and everyone at my table had already finished their dessert.  By the time i got my sundae, i was in no mood to eat.  Service is slow and they've messed up on a few orders before.  They usually take forever to make the orders. Some table do get free hot tea before they order, but some don't.  This place is always crowded, will usually have to wait to get a table and it's very hot and stuffy inside.  Not the best place for a late night snack but if you're willing to wait and put up with the crapy service it's not a bad place to eat.
author: Darren W.

description: i totally agree with everyone else whn they say this place has HORRIBLE service.. but i have to stop at this place everytime i'm in sf. i love their sago. they put cococut milk in it unlike the place on noriega with the cow. i  used to work across the street so it was always dead at 3pm when they opened. late at night they are packed and thats always a hassle. everytime i've been back the place has been more packed and the prices jacked up.. sucks that this place HAD so much potential but they dont know how to tend to customers.
author: Lena H.

description: I love it! If I can get a seat. It is ALWAYS jam-packed at night! The man that works here let us in (after their closing time), so 1 star more for you! The desserts/food is alright. I do prefer the drinks over at Creations better though. But I come here just for the hell of it at night cause of the mood and I ALWAYS bump into someone I know here.
author: Elaine H.

description: My friend used to work here. She told me to never get the grilled squid because it is not worth it. The first time I came here, several years ago, I got the egg puffs and waffles with ice cream. The egg puffs were good, I wished they would use a little more BATTTER because I do not like them crunchy, I think they should make it a choice, crunchy or not. Their waffles were good, I am sure they used the same batter as the egg puffs but who cares, it is still good. The second time I came here I ordered the mango sago I think and my boyfriend ordered the waffle with nice cream. The mango sago, was not that good. I shouldn't really order mango in restaurants because it always taste creamy and I think that mango and dairy does not mix. The waffle sundae was pretty good, tasted the same, but now they have those HUGE plastic things to put in on and it looks more nice, instead of using plates. The first time I came here the service was bad.  My friends and I walked in and a bunch of fobs were just sitting their playing cards, some were waiters, they were kind of rude saying "wow are they going to order" in chinese, and of course I knew what they said as a chinese speaking girl. The second time I came the service was good. I can't wait to get to eat their waffles again.
author: Janet Z.

description: A variety of warm dessert soups and cold dessert drinks and assortment of Hong Kong style snacks - curry fishballs, fried noodles, rice noodles, etc. Love the waffle-like dessert....
author: Yan M.

description: Awesome desserts!! I love the waffle ice cream sandwiches! You can ask which flavors they have because if you don't, they'll just put in whatever. It gets freakishly busy on weekends at night so make sure you write your name on the clipboard if there's a line. I usually get hot ovaltine with some egg puffs and enjoy my friend's conversations. The waffles and egg puffs take a while so be patient and don't worry, they didn't forget your order [ unless it's been a real looong time, then you might want them to check on your order ]
author: Christina Y.

description: Pretty good HK desserts for late night munchies.  They open til 1 AM on weekdays, 2 AM on weknights.  This place is popular on the weekends and is packed so if you bring friends, expect to wait - sometimes outside.  THEY DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS!    Bring cash.  Service can be slow because of the large crowds.
author: Allie C.

description: "Fobby HK desserts" as my friend puts it. Definitely an Asian hang out spot in the Richmond district. My friends and I have been coming here for years and it's one of our chill spots for catching up/chatting while snacking on yummy desserts, drinks, and appetizers. It's a small place, but they have a large menu of Asian desserts. Service can be spotty and slow, especially during peak friday/saturday nights. Food is mostly okay with a some really good dishes. Some of our favorite items: rice noodle rolls with hot sauce, fried fish balls, egg puffs (gotta have it with the condensed milk!), mango ice cream dessert with fruit, waffle sundae. Their instant noodle is good too if you're hungry! 23E!!! LOL (inside joke). It's a cool place that has a good variety of desserts and snacks, but of course not as good as the street vendors in Hong Kong....
author: Linda C.

description: Good places for eggettes and late night HK style desserts. The place is usually busy during weekends. Try the almond tea snog frog.
author: Teresa Y.

description: I used to go here to have dessert when I used to live in the city.  They serve a lot of traditional chinese desserts, but they also serve modernized hong kongie sweets.  I love their "tong yuen" which is almost like a chinese style gnochi but made with sticky rice flour.  This style of tong yuen is sweet, and can be either served in black seasme seed soup.  The one I usually get is covered with sugar, coconut shavings and small peanut pieces.  They not only serve sweet dishes, but they also have savory dishes.  I like their noodles with soy and peanut dipping sauces.  The soy sauce chow mein isn't all that bad.  Egg puffs are usually good too.
author: Philip L.

description: place was packed at midnight. this place has more chinese style dessert than quickly.
author: NY Y.

description: This place is great for opening late nights. I don't expect the greatest service since most of the servers are teenagers and what average teenager wants to be stuck working late night during the weekend? I like the basic desserts: egg waffles, mix fruits with sago, peanut butter bread with condensed milk.....a great place to go after having a hearty dinner meal.
author: Tiny H.

description: Open pretty late... not the best HK dessert place... but some items (the hot ones are pretty good..) I had the almond, and sesame paste dessert which was really good.
author: Doris M.

description:
Their egg puff is what differentiates this place from the dessert places on Noriega, Taraval, and Geary.  It's fresh and delicious and fun to eat.  

But you have to ask for the free tea otherwise you won't get it.  And by the time you are choking on your egg puff, it's too late.

update 8/20/07:
Service last night was so atrocious we almost cried: not sure from laughing too hard at our pathetic selves for allowing them to treat us this way, or simply from the pain of waiting.  Four of us ordered three items as the waiter carefully wrote down everything (he could have been scribbling down his own grocery list for all we know, since he didn't remember what we ordered.)   Minutes later, I got my Longan Ice, which was a bunch of longans soaked in a sprite with ice.  Then people started to come in and they seem to have completely forgotten about us.  After we watched other tables getting their food, we mentioned to our waiter our food hasn't arrived yet.  Twenty minutes later, our friend's ice cream with waffle came.  The waffle was cold by then (we actually could see the waffle being made behind the counter and then managed to sit there completely neglected.)   We mention to the waiter again.  He says it's coming.  It's not.  Our friend lost her patience and said that she could go stand by the counter and wait.  He said, oh no, it's coming.  So we waited.  And indeed it came, and it was a LONGAN ICE!!!  We all sorta jumped and were like, no! that's not the dish that's missing!  We already got our longan ice!  

And the rest of the night went by fairly fast: we waited for the taro coconut sago dish.  It finally came.  My boyfriend inhaled it because we have been there for an hour by then and people need to get home because it's a SUNDAY night!  And of course, they messed up on the sago and substituted it with tapioca instead.  But that's okay, because we probably won't be going back anytime soon.  We didn't want our friends to think we are a masochist couple who only pick abusive places to eat.
author: Candice B.

description: Not the best desert place, but it's a place to go for a nice desert at night. There's this one guy who works there, try to get him to take your order.
author: Edgar G.

description: I come here for the eggettes.  It definitely is not up to par compared to Hong Kong but where else can I get my fixin of eggettes in San Francisco?  Please tell me.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: I would give this place a  3.5 stars.  My bf and I like to swing by here for Chinese dessert whenever we are in the city.  We both love the hot desserts and egg nuggets.  It's got a laid back atmosphere that's good for large groups.  We came here with a group of 8, ordered a bunch of dessert and let the good conversation flowed.
author: Jay L.

description:
This place is okay.  There isn't anything on the menu that I ever really want.  I've just been here several times because it's a late night hangout and it's convenient for friends.  

I can't really recommend anything on the menu.  Come here for fruity desserts and sago.  That's about it.  Just your traditional asian style dessert place but nothing that impresses me.  I try not to go here if I can help it.
author: Scott L.

description: A good place for some desserts. Usually when I come here, I get the Spicy ramen with spam and eggs. yum. recently i've been getting the mango sago.There menu has alot to choose from so you can't say theres nothing to eat there unless you're a really picky eater. Sometimes the service is slow due to the place being crowded. The only thing that I don't like about this place is that there is a minimum per person.  Sometimes you just wanna share a dessert but then again at this place everyone has to get something. -1 star for that.
author: Rhonda H.

description:
I love the fact that you can still experience hk at this cafe  Everything you experience at any typical "milk tea" cafe in hk is evident here from the stools, tables, workers and to the food.  "chicken eggs" the egg waffles to spam and eggs... mmmm... BUT, other than that, the quality is not acceptable.  Convenience, yes.. but quality.. no..

2.0 stars
author: Derek M.

description: This is my usual spot for desserts. The menu is extensive, the service is great, and the desserts are usually pretty delicious. I like the waffles and ice cream the best! The Thai sticky rice is NOT tasty; I don't recommend that at all. The toasts are always delicious.
author: Jenn O.

description: reasonable prices for great service. this place was poppin' at 9ish
author: kim w.

description: Service is horrible. It gets crowded and loud. The desserts are so so. They try to be like the dessert restaurants in Hong Kong...but its not so great.
author: Prescott T.

description: Feels just like Asia - perfect when you are craving a way-past-midnight drunken snack. Get the ramen with spam and eggs - you know you were going to make it at home anyways, but here you can eat it while scoping out the cool Asian kids.
author: Lisa M.

description: Eh..Its great that their here late night but the service is so-so. Food takes a long time to bring out but it tastes pretty good.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Food quality is alright, but a great place to for hang out with family/ friends. They have great red bean icee, but the other items on the food aren't healthy or tasty. Service is not the best and staff can ignore you pretty easily. i try to avoid going to this place at night...it doesn't feel too safe with people wandering around on the street at night.
author: Chunky P.

description: Eh.. this place is not that good, I don't understand why I keep coming back here. There is nothing here that stands out to me, the waiters/waitresses are really bad, they are slow... The only thing here that is "okay" is the waffle sundaes other than those, this place is not worth coming to. Seriously. I don't get how this place is so packed at night... answer anyone? lol
author: Johnny T.

description:
most everything is good on the menu although i'd skip the snow frog.
i'd prefer the eggettes, waffle ice cream, fruit sagos, and warm desserts.  they are open quite late and there always seems to be a crowd.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I'm surprised this place got such mediocre ratings. I love this place and it's ALWAYS packed on the weekend nights and especially Fridays. Their Mixed Fruits w/ Mango Juice & Sago is heaven. Their batter is very interesting for the Egg Puffs here, it's the same batter they use for the Waffles. The Super Mango Pudding is good as well. Highly recommend this place, open late and a variety of snacks and desserts.
author: Sean E.

description: Great place for a late night snack or for some dessert after dinner.  This place gets packed late at night (even weekdays?) so come early!  Like other asian dessert places, you have the usual mango desserts, but I go for the shakes or the drinks here.  Its also easy to find parking around here because I usually park in the lot for the bank so thats always a good thing.
author: Justin H.

description: I've been coming here since they first opened! This is absolutely the best place to go on a late Saturday night!
author: Monica N.

description: Lot's of stuff to choose from.  The girl that was waiting on us did seem like she was more intrested in watching the chinese soap opera that was playing on the TV.  Did get the order wrong but quickly fixed it.  It is open late which is a plus.  I would go back they have lot's of tasty dessert's.
author: mike p.

description: Great desserts, they make a delicious steamed egg and refreshing grass jelly drinks.  Only real bad thing about this place is the service.  With only 1 person serving 10-12 tables of people, the service is a work in progress.
author: Kamui K.

description: This place deserves NEGATIVE stars.  The most DISGUSTING dessert experience ever. First of all the place stinks like something died in there.  I thought I would give this place the benefit of the doubt since people raved about the waffle sundae.  We took 1 bite and walked out.  Basically cheap ice cream and stale waffles.  What a waste of time and money.  You could not pay me to go back to this dump.
author: Chicago N.

description:
I've only been to this place a couple of times, but it's fun. They have really cute tea cups there, but service is a bit slow when it's busy. They don't have that many options, a lot more fruit dessert items. 

But this place is opened late and fun to hang out w/ late at night w/ friends. The people and service is nice. Try the Frog Fat dessert. :)
author: lily l.

description: the mango sticky rice taste like soap! wtf ! the worse taste ever and their eggettes look likes its been deep fried..
author: jophine c.

description: My 30th time coming here? I think. And yet my latest visit there was pretty bad. Our table's food took FOREVER to arrive. I'd say about 1.5 hour.
