Asked another waitress, put our order in cuz the first waitress probably forgot. Then she came over and gave us a free bowl of fruits. Yay? Haha, I'm not mean but time is money. And I need my beauty sleep. Anyways, food-wise, this place has never disappointed me. From french toast to sagos to noodles. All pretty good.
author: Jimmy N.

description:
saw some pictures of the food 
and decided to go to the cafe 
had dessert in hongkong
so was disappointed 
got the sundae waffles and mango madness
this place is probably more about presentation than taste
ice cream was alright 
waffle was a little burnt though

place was packed 
it was around 11 at night
the service was really slow
there was only one guy who was really working
but he was nice

probably go one more time to try something
else 
maybe it'll be better
author: Candy Y.

description: I came here with a friend once when I was sick, so I decided to get a warm dessert. We came on a Friday, which is one of the few days they have warm tofu soup with red bean paste.  It was delish.  The tofu was silky, creamy and soothing as it slid down my throat, and the red bean gave it just enough sweetness.  My friend likes black (tortoise?) jelly, so he got that with some fresh fruit, such as mangoes, watermelon, honeydew, and strawberries.  I didn't care so much for that bitter, black jelly, but the fruit was fresh.  I would definitely come here again.
author: sarisha h.

description: Kowloon Tong is just not my cup of tea. But speaking of tea, I don't like the tea they serve you either, it's always lukewarm. The only time I come here is when I'm forced to, which is basically when My Favorite Cafe or 100% is closed. Majority of their menu doesn't appeal to me and the only thing that I think is decent here might be their sundae and that's it. But I will say that the good thing about it is that you never have to wait long for seats.
author: Kari G.

description:
cant compare it to the desserts in asia, but this is as good as it gets in san francisco. out of the many dessert places in sf, this is the one my friends and i go to the most. its at a good location and opens late everyday. its usually really packed on the weekends and you just sign yourself and your party up on a lil clipboard. once you get seated, the service is pretty fast. 

desserts: mixed fruit sago - i used to always get this, but i got tired of the fruits never being sweet. its just cold and hard in my mouth, and the strawberries being socked in a sweet sago juice becomes sour. so i switched to just mango fruit with mango sago. cant go wrong with that! sweet soft mango with a cold mango juice and little tapioca balls. yum :) both the waffle ice cream and waffle sandwiches are really good too. they offer like 5 different variations and they let you choose 2, sometimes 3 if they're feeling like it, flavors. my favorite flavors are strawberry and oreo. the egg puffs are a good and cheap snack, but i think its getting soggier now. the only dessert that ive tried and did not like is their shaved ice. shaved ice is suppose to be a fluffy ice mixture with red bean (or wahtever topping u choose) and condensed milk. their shaved ice is just like those crushed ice you get from your fridge, juice (or maybe just water from the ice) ur choice of topping at the bottom and a scoop of ice cream. doesnt even come in a bowl, just comes in a long cup soo all u can eat is first the ice cream, then water nd ice, and finally the red bean at the very bottom. toast with condensed milk ontop actually tasted pretty good, but its something you can easily make for yourself at home.

snacks/food: the chicken wings and porkchop sandwich with fries are good to munch on, especially if you have the drunken munchies and want something savory instead of sweet. 

this cafe is a good place to grab inexpensive dessert after a meal, after any bars/clubs, or just to get together with friends to talk and hang out
author: Katherine C.

description: Having been to HK, I've tasted alot better.  Service is lousy.  You get your own tea, napkins etc. Have a long wait to order, may get your order wrong and can't get your bill.  The desserts are never consistent; they have good days and bad, so you never know what you are getting.  Go to other dessert places and skip this one.
author: A N.

description: Went here with some friends the other night.  My friend and I shared the steamed rice crepe, and it was pretty good for a snack.  But as for food to fill you up?  The selection isn't so broad.  When you go here, you find yourself debating whether you want savory or sweets, and that night, I only had a few bucks on me so I wasn't about to go crazy.  Obviously, I chose savory, with the steamed rice crepes, while my other two friends got the Super Mango dessert, Coconut Milk with Sweet Rice, and milk tea.  I tried each of their desserts too, and the Super Mango was pretty good with the mango ice cream, and balls of melon and fresh fruit.  The coconut milk dessert was interesting...it tasted so heavenly at first, but once you stir and mix it up with the sweet rice (which looks like red bean if you ask me), it tastes nothing close to heaven. The milk tea was a bit bland too; I tasted more water than milk or tea?  Questionable.  Well, maybe this just wasn't a good round with Kowloon, but I wouldn't mind going again to taste the other snacks/desserts on their menu.  Oh yeah, the service kinda sucks, considering that they spend more of their time watching the latest chinese soap opera on the one television that they have, than catering to you.
author: Jasmine T.

description: This place is actually alright . Not really the best dessert place but it's not all that bad either .. it just really depends what you order . The deep fried chicken wings are good . The soya chicken wings are alright . The egg puffs are too hollow .  The grilled squid is nasty .. it's actual dried up squid . The strawberry is nasty as well . Too much milk and not sweet at all . The sesame filled glutinous balls are alright . It's not from the freezer .. they actually make it themselves ! The Mixed Fruit Strawberry Sago is okay .. just be sure to mix it all up before you eat it . I like how it wasn't super sweet . The mango pudding is too sweet or something .. tastes a little odd . But I do like how they put pieces of mango in it . The papaya milkshake and mango shaved ice is alright . The tortoise jelly is good . The squid balls are pretty good too . They're thicker than fishballs and they taste more interesting . The HK style waffle is hella good . The HK Milk Tea w/ Coffee is good . But the Coffee w/ Condensed Milk is a lot better . I'm so addicted to it :) I'm esp. addicted to the deep fried soya tofu . They open till 1 Sunday - Thursday while other dessert places in SF and millbrae close at 12 . Didn't know that did ya ;)
author: Eileen L.

description: i love coming here at night just to hang out with friends. great dessert and a lively atmosphere. i love their mugs (the outside isn't hot as the inside from the tea!) if i'm hungry the chicken wings never fail my tastebuds, and the waffle with ice cream is tastey! but when in doubt get the sago!
author: Suzan L.

description: Service is terrible..Me and my bf first walk-in, but no one notice we are there for 5 mins...so we decided to just have a sit ourselves...then 10 mins later we still didn't get service from anyone..(they were not that busy at all..they just keep doing their own stuff without checking around and see if anyone need service..)  so i ask my bf just go to the cashier to order...we clearly told that girl wat we want and  where we sit.....then 30 mins has passed....we still didn't get our dessert, so i go ask the other lady from the cashier counter where is our food?? she then pass me the dessert, but they are all in to-go container.... wth...... then i said we were going to dine in....she didn't even apologize, and just say they didn't see us.( we were just sitting at the first table, how can they not see us??) ..and ask if we still want to dine-in, i said yes, then she just open the to-go container for us, and we just eat over there with the to-go containers....I really don't know wat to say....i guess it's just very funny, we've been sitting there 45 mins...even tho they really thought we order to-go, but after the dessert came out, how come they didn't bring over the food to us? or at least let us know the food is ready? ...what kind of service is that...another thing is the dessert is nasty!!!!!  I'm not trying to be mean cus of the service, but I've never taste anything like this bad in any other HK style dessert place.... if you guyz like HK style dessert, I recommand you guyz to try those in Sunset, like 100% dessert is good...or other one is still better than this one!!  Just wonder how can they still get all those customer with that kind of BAD service and Nasty dessert....
author: Q.Q W.

description: This place gets pretty busy late at night during the weekends, but the wait is never too long.  I only come here for one thing and that's the waffle sundae with my choice of green tea, mango and vanilla ice cream.  I love it.  My friend usually gets the deep fried chicken wings with fries, which I really like too.  The food is fairly priced, and is definitely a great place to get some late night snacks and chit chat with some friends.
author: Emily L.

description: i never heard about this place before last night, but apparently everyone else has!  the place was super crowded on a late fri night.  my friend wanted to try the waffle ice cream sandwich here, so that's why we came.  we got that and a mixed fruit sago dessert.  the ice cream sandwich would have been better if the waffle was still warm.  the filling was vanilla ice cream and a couple slices of banana.  the mixed fruit sago thing was pretty refreshing w/ lots of fresh fruit.
author: Helen T.

description: asian teen-college late night hangout, and it does get busy for their one server.  a typical HK dessert menu including eggettes, actually i didn't even order anything because not much stood out.  tried the steamed papaya in rock sugar.  i prefer the fruit options at Creations.
author: Rob C.

description: what to do on thanksgiving night? tart to tart? no they close at 11... creations? nope i dont think they are open.. but kowloon tong was open... me and my cousins ordered so much food, eggettes.. mixed fruits with mango sago, strawberry madness thingy, steamed rice noodles, chicken wings... everything was just mediocre.. the only thing i would order again here is the strawberry thing
author: JUDY L.

description: not too bad for a cheap late night dessert. crowded with kids tho. i prefer creations instead.
author: Jen P.

description: must love their waffles and eggettes.. when u can easily make it at home... service sucks.. take long to serve u water or tea... u nEEd to ask!!.. crowd at nights.. with teens.. drinks (smoothies) sucks there.. too much ice... their fried noodle with soya is good though.. want something to snack on? come to here.. oh, comes at 3pm to 2am i think...
author: Lily T.

description: i love this place because it close to my house and their strawberry madness is delicious! they have alot to choose from and are usually open pretty late. however, their service is usually not that great. they only have one or two waitresses working even on their busy nights, so dont expect them to always check on you. one time, our table waited 40+ minutes for our food and when it never came we asked the waitress. she then replied with a blank stare,"you ordered already?" and then flipped through her notebook and saw that we were right. moral of the story: do not sit there and wait for your food if its been over 20 minutes and do not expect them to check on you; you have to flag one of the waitresses down.
author: Vivian D.

description:
great healthy dessert - lots of FRUITS.

great hours for night owls - 5 pm to 2 am on weekends i think..

weekdays - it closes at 1 am. 

rarely you see many cafes open that late in this city, so it was a great relief to hang out there considering that i moved here a while ago from big apple. 

great dessert menu and i love its HK style tea.  

i haven't ordered any nasty dishes yet.  i will only order them if i ever bring my intoxicated out of town buddies here and test their big cajones.

the only downside is the usual slow service... but what do you expect out of this authentic chinese cafe?  just don't go there on friday/saturday nights if you want to get excellent service!
author: Gabe L.

description: I came to this place yesterday night after dinner at about 9pm with 3 of my friends. We ordered sweet sticky rice with fruits and sweet sticky rice with coconut milk along with the coconut saga. The time it took for these bowls to come out were extremely slow. The funny thing was the one with the fruits came out first them the sticky rice alone and then the saga. I enjoyed my sticky rice but it could have been better. My friend did not recieve his saga until about 40 minutes later after my friends and i were finished. To top it off, there was a piece of hair in his bowl. They took it back but it seemed like they just reboiled it. I dont kno if I would try this place again. Next time I might just go to Creations on 17th and geary. If you want cheap desserts and a friendly environment during the late night, this is a good place to hang out and chat with your friends but if you come here for the food, Im iffy about it
author: Bonnie Z.

description: The 'shaved ice' was kind of disappointing: not the 'shave ice' you would expect, but more like a pile of ice chips and chopped fruit in a cup of Sprite. Our waiter was very friendly, but he was a bit too fobbishly and eagerly abrupt. The other desserts looked pretty good though, especially the ice cream and waffle sandwich, so I think I may come back for another visit.
author: A. T.

description: I went there with a group of friends who grew up from the region where these desserts were originated.  With much anticipations came with huge disappointments.  The egg puffs were artificially colored and tasted like soggy cardboard.  Various kind of steamed egg custards were too plain.  We couldn't find any beef in the beef noodles but lots of fat tissues and tendons instead.  When we confronted to the owner, he was all defensive about it and claimed that no body ever complained about the quality of the food!!!
author: Mary S.

description: yummm~ the waffffleeeee sandwich ice cream is melting
author: Elsa K.

description: A little bit too bright on the lighting, so-so atmosphere but tasty HK desserts. Mango Madness is my favourite.
author: Kwai C.
